title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Research Consultant - Modeling and Meta-Analysis
description: Research Consultant – Modeling and Meta-Analysis Reports to Associate Director Modeling and Meta-AnalysisJob SummaryAs a Research Consultant at OPEN Health, you are an essential contributor to our team, working across various projects with responsibility for delivering high-quality outputs. You will support project leads in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary, international organization.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesConducting and/or guiding and mentoring junior consultants on trial data analysis and evidence synthesis projects and performing quality control of project deliverables Developing project reports and other deliverables Adhering to project budgets and timelines Supporting client interactions and outreach to ensure client satisfaction Assisting with requests for proposals and supporting growth of the business through the development of strong client relationships Effectively managing relationships within OPEN Health and with external stakeholders Supporting the development of, implementation, and maintenance of internal processes and quality standards Keeping abreast with the latest developments in the field Disseminating and integrating new methods into the business Contributing to thought leadership and publications Experience, Skills, And QualificationsMaster’s Degree or PhD in any relevant science, such as health economics, econometrics, economics, pharmacy, epidemiology, statistics or medical sciences Experienced within the field of HEOR, with hands-on experience in trial data analysis and/or evidence synthesis, and familiarity with analysis positioning in the context of health economic modelling, reimbursement dossiers, and health technology assessment submissions Experience with contributing to data analysis and/or evidence synthesis projects, including: Bayesian network meta-analysis, including non-proportional hazard methods and meta-regression Population-adjusted indirect treatment comparisons, including matching-adjusted indirect comparison, simulated treatment comparison, and multi-level network meta-regression Survival analysis, including flexible and innovative methods not limited to landmark survival analysis and methods for incorporating external data Utility analysis to inform health economic models Bespoke statistical modelling of clinical trial patient level data to inform health economic models Analysis of surrogate endpoints Intellectual curiosity and independence, to include the ability to self-start and self-teach Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) along with the ability to question the status quo Ability to clearly communicate complex (statistical) methods to other team members and external stakeholders Proactive, responsive and able to balance shifting priorities Team player, but also able to work independently Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Full proficiency in MS Office programs: Excel, Word, PowerPoint Experience with statistical software: R (version control, RMarkdown and Shiny would be an advantage), STAN (or equivalent MCMC simulation software) Travel RequirementsInternational and domestic as required for team and client meetings/conferences as required by business needs About OPEN HealthOPEN Health unites deep scientific knowledge with wide-ranging specialist expertise to unlock possibilities that improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing. Working in partnership with our clients, we embrace our different perspectives and strengths to deliver fresh thinking and solutions that make a difference. OPEN Health is a flexible global organization that solves complex healthcare challenges across consulting, HEOR and market access, scientific communications, patient engagement, and creative omnichannel communications.What we offer:As a global organization, OPEN Health is committed to supporting our employees and their families through a comprehensive benefits programCompetitive pay, generous paid vacation and holidays, and health insurance programs across all our locations Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path An active and growing commitment to bettering the communities our employees call home through our Corporate Social Responsibility program The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work If we sound like the sort of business environment in which you would thrive, then we would love to hear from you.

title: Sensory Science Internship
description: Do you want to gain experience in sensory panel leading and sensory project management? Are you looking for the best place to hone your skills and learn how a sensory lab functions?Apply now to join the team at MMR!MMR is a global leader in guiding innovation for clients within the food, drink and personal care sectors. We advise many iconic global brands, as well as up-and-coming innovators. Our culture is vibrant, fast paced, yet friendly and supportive. Our work practices embody both scientific rigor and creative drive, leading to innovation in research methods and techniques to facilitate our clients’ creative business thinking.We are looking for Sensory Interns to join MMR’s passionate and vibrant team and work on site with our teams and client based in Utrecht, Netherlands.This is an exciting role where the Sensory Intern will lead research project(s) and get integrated in the day to day life of the panel, including panel session preparation, sensory moderation, panel performance analysis and monitoring to fulfil our clients’ needs and fit their KPIs. You will also be part of our MMR global sensory team, with constant opportunities for training and mentoring, and learn from our 60+ experienced sensory scientists. As Sensory Intern your main responsibilities are: To support the team in place in preparing the sensory panel sessions, to ensure smooth delivery of sensory research and consistently deliver high quality descriptive analysis dataHandle tasks in the lab such as:Sample labelling and preparation for sessionsLab equipment / consumables managementScheduling of the sessions and communication to sensory panelistsTo prepare panel sessions on the provided sensory software as neededTo regularly recruit and train new panelists to keep panel numbers at a required levelYou will shadow the MMR Panel Leader and learn to analyse panel performance in order to guarantee the quality of the data as well as spotting needs for improvement and putting in place appropriate training plans To ensure that clients are kept up to date with project progress, and receive and understand draft lexicons and topline results whenever appropriate To work together with our on-site team and client teams to advice and develop new sensory methodologies to address our business and consumer challengesTo lead specific research project(s), in order to improve ways of working and approach to leading sensory panels efficientlyRequirementsRequirements / Profile:Currently following a Master’s level cursus with a component of Sensory / Consumer ScienceKnowledge of Sensory / Statistical Analysis -QDA, Similarity/Thurstonian testing, Post hoc, PCA, MFAFluent written and spoken Dutch and English Experience with sensory software and data analysis (Eye Question, R and XL Stat…) is a plusExcellent organizational skills and the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced environmentStrong collaboration and communication skills Ability to work well within a teamAble to work independentlyA plus: being a foodie who is passionate with food and cookingWe’ve placed passion, honesty, curiosity, positivity and commercial orientation at the center of our corporate values – do they fit what you’re looking for in your next career move? If so, you will flourish in MMR’s environment, with the autonomy to express yourself and the tools to really connect with clients.If you are looking to expand your experience and skills and have a great attitude then we have a unique opportunity for you to learn and grow at an exciting time within our team.BenefitsMMR is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

title: Data Visualization Specialist
description: We are Leads.io — the world’s #1 tech-driven lead generation agency. Leads.io is on the search for a Martech Specialist to complement our dynamic work environment. Your expertise in advertising technology, web tracking, and 1st party data will be instrumental in creating high-impact lead-generation strategies. With a determination to become an ever-better growth catalyst for our clients, we are on the lookout for fresh faces to join our team! Do you have what it takes to join Leads.io?About The RoleJoin the new and growing Business Intelligence team at Leads.io. Transform large sets of marketing and social media data into easy-to-use, communicative dashboards that help teams make data driven decisions. Find key insights and shape how teams understand these large datasets.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain data visualizations, dashboards, and BI reporting for business units across the organizationIdentify and communicate key trends to business units and stakeholdersCollaborate with teams to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs)Manage, organize, and update datasets for use in Tableau and other data visualizations and reportsSupport ongoing reporting and data request needs Requirements2+ years of experience as a data analyst or doing data visualizationProficient with creating Tableau dashboardsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsFamiliarity with SQL and/or Tableau Prep (or other ETL / data prep tool)Familiarity with marketing and social media analyticsExperience with Salesforce or other CRM systems a plusBenefitsWhat’s in it for you?25 holidays per year with 8% holiday payHybrid working/working from home allowanceAn open and inclusive culture that fosters personal growth and initiativeKnowledge sessions hosted by internal and external expertsDaily lunches at the officeFlexible working hoursProvided equipment (Macbook, mouse/keyboard)Access to mental health support through OpenUp is offered anonymously and without costThe opportunity to work fully remotely for up to a month per year from a location of your choiceExcited? Wait until you see our cultural values!✨ Trust – At Leads.io, we emphasize accountability and transparency, setting the foundation for genuine partnerships.✨ Own it – Ownership entails having pride in both your work and yourself. We each aim to take a personal initiative in improving our business, so being the best version of yourself is the best-case scenario for us.✨ Grow smart – Our vision is to become a global frontrunner in lead generation. We are committed to continually scaling our business whilst also growing as individuals in the process.✨ Thrive as a team – We believe that teamwork is a key ingredient to obtaining outstanding results. While holding personal work ethics in high regard, we also encourage a working environment that is both social and more enjoyable through teamwork.Our recruitment process is designed to ensure the best fit. It comprises a phone meeting to discuss qualifications, followed by two interviews for cultural alignment, between the 2 interviews an assessment for technical skills will follow. If successful, we will extend a formal offer. Upon acceptance, you'll embark on your exciting journey with Leads.io.Ready for your new challenge? Apply now, and we will be in touch with you soon!

title: Internship – Plastic Ingestion Research
description: MISSION TO METRICSIn our mission to rid the world’s oceans of plastic, we rely on a thorough understanding of the global plastic pollution problem and its impact on marine life. The Environmental and Social Affairs team at The Ocean Cleanup aims to ensure the net positive environmental and social impact of The Ocean Cleanup's operations by investigating the risks and benefits of cleaning up plastic pollution in rivers and on the high seas. An important research aspect is to investigate how marine life in the Great Pacific Garbage Patch (GPGP) is affected by plastic accumulating in these offshore waters. To this end, the team is researching plastic ingestion by fish and other marine life in the GPGP. You will be responsible for analyzing the plastic ingestion by fish collected from the GPGP in our laboratory in Rotterdam. Taking on the responsibility for the sample analysis and working independently in the laboratory is an important part of this internship. The success of the project relies on delivering high-quality data to achieve the objective of determining the extent, impact, and sources of plastic ingestion in the GPGP."Come join our diverse team and help us better understand the impacts of plastic pollution on marine life in the Great Pacific Garbage Patch. Your findings are crucial to quantify the net environmental benefit of our offshore cleanup operations.”, Matthias Egger, Head of Environmental and Social Affairs.ResponsibilitiesResponsible for analysis of plastic ingestion in fish in our laboratory in Rotterdam and delivering high-quality data on the amount and type of plastics present in these samples.Other Responsibilities IncludeCollecting quantitative data on the fish characteristics (morphometrics) Fish dissections to extract the complete gastrointestinal tractFamiliarizing yourself with the different techniques used to extract and analyze plastics from fish and other marine speciesUsing Raman and FTIR spectroscopy to identify the polymer types of the extracted plasticsConducting data analysis, interpretation, presentation, and documenting everything in a report Professional QualificationsBachelor's degree in (marine) biology or a related field, with preferably post-graduate science education Successful completion of marine science courses is a plusExperience with laboratory protocols, procedures, and safety measures Experience with biological research in the laboratory Ability to clearly present and explain the results of complex research to scientists is a plus Fluent in English PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONSAble to quickly get the essence of a technical challenge and investigate the most relevant/important aspects to get to a solution. Able to perform well in a fast-paced and challenging environmentComfortable with the demands of laboratory work Ability to work independentlyCurious, creative, and determined to deliverStrong organizational skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsIntrinsic motivation to work on our ambitious and meaningful goalADDITIONAL DETAILS Starting from January/February 2024Duration: 6 monthsNote that the candidate needs to be enrolled at a University (MSc program) during the internship. If applicable, the internship can be combined with a MSc thesis project.

title: Quantitative Risk Analyst - ST
description: As a Medior / senior quantitative risk analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring that the bank makes informed, data driven decisions. You will work with the business to understand the data they generate in their day-to-day activities. The aim is to unlock the intelligence contained within this data using the best quantitative methods and techniques. You will coach team members while developing new credit risk models, and will evaluate and improve the performance of existing credit risk models. Here, you can apply your leadership and quantitative skills and experience on various datasets and business challenges, and make a positive impact for the bank and its customers. You will be responsible for delivering important project goals, working together with junior and experienced risk analysts.RequirementsYour profileDo you have leadership skills and the ability to motivate team members in order to successfully complete projects?Are you thoroughly knowledgeable in credit risk or other financial risk modelling areas?Do you have a strong quantitative education in an area such as mathematics, econometrics, actuarial studies, or physics?Are you experienced in programming languages suited for doing statistical and data analysis, such as Python, SAS, R, and/or MATLAB?Do you have at least 6 years of work experience in quantitative analysis, preferably within risk modelling in banking and finance?And! Do you want to further develop your skills in quantitative risk modelling? Can you apply your skills to derive meaningful, robust, data driven models to guide business decisions? Do you work well within a team? Can you take the lead to ensure the successful delivery of projects while coaching team members?Credit Risk QuantRWA Calculation ExperienceExperience with SAS RWA CalculatorRIB Experiance is a Plus

We look forward to hearing from you!

description: We are seeking a motivated and analytic individual to join our team as a Remote Digital Data Analyst. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting and analysing large data sets, making data-driven decisions, and presenting findings to management.Responsibilities Collect and analyse large data sets from various sources Interpret data and identify trends and patterns Create reports and visualisations to communicate findings Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights Continuously monitor data for accuracy and completeness Identify areas for improvement and make recommendationsRequirements Proficient in SQL, Excel, and data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI Strong analytic skills with the ability to interpret complex data Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Attention to detail and accuracyIf you are a self-starter who is passionate about data and enjoys problem-solving, we encourage you to apply. This is an entry-level position with room for growth within the company.To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter highlighting your qualifications and why you would be a great fit for this position. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Scientist
description: About PacmedAt Pacmed we develop world leading AI-based decision support software for intensive care doctors. It’s a hugely exciting area where we’re breaking boundaries every day. We’re looking for a data scientist who’s excited to work with hospitals on implementing our product. We have currently implemented our software in our first ICUs and have the ambitions to scale across the Netherlands and beyond.What This Role Is All AboutAs Data Scientist in the Implementation & Care team, you work closely with the hospitals to implement our software. The team as a whole is on a mission to reduce the time it takes to implement our product significantly by the end of 2024, and as you are working with our clients directly, your work is an integral part of reaching that goal.Next to Brian (Implementation Manager) and Ewoud (Adoption Specialist), we have another Data Scientist on the team: Mattia, who broadened his skillset to include the engineering capabilities needed for implementations. In this role, we hope you are excited about going through a similar learning curve!One thing you can be sure of, every day you’ll be working with enthusiastic and mission-driven people who are passionate about using technology to revolutionize healthcare!What Would Be Expected Of YouWork with our customers to ensure the timely, within budget and at quality standards integration of Pacmed Critical in the hospital ICT infrastructure. You need to be excited about working with customers directly!Proactively supporting hospital partners throughout the implementation process, and contributing to meeting the overall project planning.Learning how to set up, test, and ensure quality of integrations, including:Setting up the Azure environment for hospitals, safe network connections, real-time data connection, and single sign-on.Embedding and integration of Pacmed Critical in the front-end of the hospitals EPD/PDMS.Critically assess areas of improvement/automatization of the current development process, suggest ways to improve it and coordinate with the other relevant teams in Pacmed for their implementation.Contributing to the training of the machine-learning (ML) models behind Pacmed Critical, their testing and deployment to the hospital IT environment.Responsible for the technical aspects of the customer support provided to hospitals in which Pacmed Critical has already been implemented.The perks of working at PacmedWhy Pacmed is a great place to workWe're a dynamic startup committed to improving healthcare globally.We’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for our team.We’re a talented bunch of people dedicated to helping each other grow.We foster a culture of kindness and respect.We're a team of ambitious and fun-loving people, with regular team eventsThe profile we’re looking forMust-havesThere is no need to apply if you don’t meet these requirements, sorry!Fluency in DutchCommunication, presentation and consultancy skills. This is a client-facing role, so you need to be excited about that!Desire to become proficient in the production deployment of ML models. The candidate is expected to quickly gain expertise in the technologies currently in use at Pacmed, e.g. data warehousing, ML DevOps, containerisation, automatized integration and deployments (CI/CD) and Cloud infrastructures.Experience in data science, data wrangling, machine learning and data visualization. Ability to set up a supervised learning ML model and interpret its results.Should-havesWe hope you bring these things as well, but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes.Previous experience in a client-facing role.Proficiency with Python and common data-science packages (e.g. scikit-learn, pandas, etc.).Experience with IT integrations, networking and deployments.Experience in process optimization.Collaborative & team player.Nice-to-havesThese are things that would make your profile jump out!Previous experience in data engineering (see third bullet point in the “Must-have” section).Previous experience with version control software.Previous experience in software development.Medical knowledge or previous work experience in the medical field.At Pacmed, we think there is strength in diversity. Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Pacmed encourages you to reconsider and apply! Building responsible AI requires diverse perspectives, equitable practices, and integrity every step of the way. This is our commitment.We’re looking forward to meeting you!

title: BI Analyst
description: Are you passionate about data and do you believe in the future of online marketplaces? Would you like to work in a fast-growing and international scale-up? Then join our ambitious team as a BI-analyst!About The JobAs a Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll be an integral part of our mission to "Make lives easier." Your role will revolve around shaping the strategies for one of our prominent brands, Moving24 or Homedeal, by leveraging data to inform decisions that drive business success.In this dynamic position, you won't be confined to IT; instead, your background in business and economics will shine. You will collaborate closely with multifunctional teams, playing a pivotal role in fostering data-driven decision-making processes, spotting market trends, and delivering invaluable insights that facilitate both business expansion and operational optimization.If you're a business-savvy individual with a knack for economics and a passion for transforming data into strategic insights, we encourage you to join us in making lives easier and shaping the future of our brands.We ask you toCollaborate seamlessly with departments such as marketing and product development, employing your expertise to gather, process, analyze, and present data that addresses critical business queries and offers actionable recommendations. Cultivate and manage dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), ensuring stakeholders are regularly updated. Contribute to the collection, cleansing, and preprocessing of raw data from diverse sources to guarantee data precision and completeness. Articulate data-driven insights and conclusions to influential stakeholders, guiding our business in the right direction. This is youYou thrive in working autonomously with minimal oversight and validation. Handling substantial, intricate projects and taking charge of smaller projects solo is second nature to you. You boast a track record of successfully collaborating within cross-functional teams and thrive in an ever-evolving environment. Your exceptional problem-solving abilities enable you to translate intricate data into practical, actionable insights. You're well-versed in data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI. Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation is part of your skill set. Familiarity with cloud-based BI solutions (e.g., Google BigQuery) is a valuable asset. Knowledge of ETL processes and tools would be an added advantage. Salary Expectation: 51,800eu - 64,800euUnfortunately we are unable to sponsor visa or assist with relocation for this role. We will only consider candidates already living in the Netherlands.*We give youThe opportunity to co-create the world's largest marketplace within a flat, entrepreneurial organization with a bright and diverse team of over 60 colleagues from across the globe. Skydreams is fully bootstrapped and pioneering online marketplaces since 2006. In the heart of Utrecht lies our beautiful office - vibrant, cozy, and recently renovated - where you can enjoy great conversations and energy from fellow Skydreamers. Pick your healthy dose of fresh fruits, snacks, a fridge full of sodas and juices, and an endless supply of great coffee (vegan options too!).You also have the flexibility to work from home in our hybrid environment. To make sure you perform to the best of your abilities, we provide you with a brand-new laptop (Mac or Lenovo), NS-Business card, and a great budget to personalise your home office. Plus, you will be given learning and development possibilities to accelerate your skills and talents.We offer a competitive salary, 28 holiday days as well as a superb pension plan. We have free mental health care and monthly massages. 100% paid parental leave for both parents, working from a different country for a bit so you can explore. We have ski-trips, epic christmas parties, and a culture that leaves little room for big ego's. The perks are endless. We try to have benefits for whatever stage you are in your life!We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply, and we are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported.

title: Quantitative Trader, Amsterdam
description: Are you a recent graduate with high ambition, ready to take initiative as a part of an environmental finance scale-up? Are you ready to develop cutting-edge trading strategies using your excellent quantitative skills? Would you like to get the chance to implement and automatize financial solutions into the tradable environmental markets? Then this role might be perfect for you!About UsOTC Flow is a leading trading company specialized in trading across European and local renewable power markets. We provide liquidity in virtually all financial-environmental instruments in Europe, China and the US. We are currently expanding our business with on-exchange trading on the European carbon, power & gas market and we are looking for the highly-skilled and motivated quantitative trader to join our ambitious and dynamic team.About The RoleWe are seeking the most talented candidates with a strong quantitative educational background to join our trading team. As a Quantitative Trader, you will be responsible for developing and implementing sophisticated trading strategies in the carbon, power, and gas markets to optimize risk-adjusted returns.Main ResponsibilitiesQuantitative Analysis: Conduct in-depth quantitative analysis of the carbon, power, and gas markets using advanced mathematical and econometric models. Identify trading opportunities, market trends, and price patterns to develop profitable strategies;Risk Management: Evaluate and manage trading risks to ensure the overall stability and profitability of the trading portfolio. Employ risk management techniques to mitigate market exposure and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements.Market Research: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the carbon, power, and gas markets, as well as relevant economic and geopolitical factors that influence market dynamics;Optimization & automation: build and maintain trading models using programming languages like Python;Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including traders, data scientists, and analysts, to contribute to the overall trading strategy and decision-making process.Functie-eisenAbout youYou hold a quantitative Master’s degree in Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Physics, or other related with outstanding grades;Relevant experience in on-exchange trading of power, gas, or carbon is a must (at least an internship);Experience gained in financial markets (either study or work);Advanced knowledge of Python and SQL;Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills;Ability to work in an accurate and structured way;Fluent in English;You like to set up things from scratch.Functie-voorstelWhat we offerA fast-growing, international working environment where every day can be an opportunity to learn;A competitive remuneration package with discretionary bonus options;Direct exposure to Management, with a chance to help drive the strategic roadmap of a fast-growing company in the environmental space;After the first 6 months, we intend to offer you an indefinite position, including an attractive remuneration package including bonus scheme;Free lunch & snacks;Travel expenses covered (OV/Swap-bicycle plan etc.);25 vacation days;Social events & activities with a fun team, including company trips (London/Ibiza).What's nextIf we have just described your profile, do not miss out on this opportunity.The Recruitment Process Is As FollowsSubmit your application with your CV and university grade list;We will get to know you better through a pre-screening interview;We will invite you for an interview with the hiring manager.Please note that sometimes there are slight changes to this process.We believe that an inclusive work environment will encourage growth as a company, as a team and as individuals. We will therefore consider all applicants because we want to promote an inclusive work culture that is accessible to all.5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55wer

title: Process Engineer, Energy - Tilburg
description: What To ExpectThe process engineer will implement, develop, and optimize production methodologies in the manufacturing operations of Tesla. This engineer will be responsible for optimizing product flow through the factory by implementing process optimization that may include tool/fixture selection, line layouts, ergonomic study, material presentation, and other relevant factors. He/She will interface with design, test, and quality engineering to solve problems, improve manufacturability, and implement continual improvement. He/She will sustain products with cost reduction and yield improvements. In addition, the process engineer will work with quality to compile and evaluate data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specificationsWhat You'll DoDevelop and improve line layouts, including material flow, waste reduction, and ergonomics, utilizing Lean Manufacturing best practices. Drive changes through Production Change Approval process.Champion continuous improvement projects (CIP) to maximize yield, capacity, and capability.Create and maintain Manufacturing Instructions, Process Flows, PFMEA’s, Control Plans, and associated processes. Develop and train sustaining technicians, assist in the training of operators as needed. Manage activities for process sustaining technicians to support day to day coverage of production line, including developing and documenting appropriate rework procedures.Enable data driven operational and financial decisions through predictive insights into tool and process performance, including integration of factory data systems and use of software such as MySQL, Python, R, JMP, Minitab, Tableau and Ignition.Utilize structured problem solving techniques such as DMAIC, Ishikawa, Five Why (5W) and Eight Disciplines (8D).Responsible for diagnosing issues found during the part (re)manufacturing process and drive corrective action back to source, resulting in root cause identification and elimination.Leading a small team of Engineering Technicians.What You'll BringBS degree in engineering or equivalent in experience.Experience developing and improving Process. Good understanding of Bill of Materials, Manufacturing Execution System, Specification Management, Change Management.Data collection and analysis experience. Ability to develop data driven root cause analyses and solutions.Strong problem solving skills and an aptitude for learning systems quickly. Able to utilize structured problem solving techniques such as DMAIC, Ishikawa, Five Why (5W), Eight Disciplines (8D) or Statistical Process Control. Able to resolve high level performance issues into addressable actions.Exceptional capacity for managing simultaneous activities, competing priorities and challenges. Strong ability to work and communicate effectively with global teams and peers within a manufacturing and engineering organization. This includes excellent communication skills: written and verbal.Creative capacity for developing new ways to do things better, cheaper, faster in alignment with the Tesla approach to revolutionary product development.

title: Research Data Analyst
description: A fantastic opportunity has arisen with a Asset Management organisation within their R&D department.The role of analysts in this department is to learn and apply the company principles to investments and support the asset class specialists for the operation of the models.As an Analyst you will gain multiple opportunities to learn in depth end-to-end investment processes for multiple asset classes and grow into becoming a specialist over time.As a Research Data Analyst, Amsterdam, You WillPerform key tasks related to data management and analysis of financial indicators and operating the models for the assigned class.Carry out research run models for portfolios and securities trading and compute performance.Provide the data in clear format to be utilised by the business.The Successful Data Analyst Will HaveDegree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Economics of Mathematics (Master's are advantageous)Prior professional work experienceExperience with Python/ SQL/ Matlab/ R or other math based programming languagesWillingness to be on-site 5 days per week.As The Data Analyst, You Will ReceiveCompetitive Base salary up to €60,000BenefitsBonusMorgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Quality engineer
description: BedrijfsomschrijvingAn extensive recruitment & selection process, including an assessment, is part of the procedure within Reell.Once you have proven your suitability, you will immediately be employed by Reell.FunctieomschrijvingReell Precision Manufacturing, based in Elsloo, is a leading company specialized in the design and production of precision mechanical components and systems. They provide tailor-made solutions for various industries, including the automotive, aerospace, electronics and medical sectors. You are in contact with the location in the USA to create advanced solutions/technologies in the manufacturing industry.Reell provides a perfect product fit for customer applications. Reell's patented technology is widely used in consumer electronics, automotive, aircraft interiors, medical technology, workstation furniture, kiosk/data terminals, and architectural lighting industries.As Quality Engineer, you are primarily responsible for representing Reell in a fair, genuine, and trustworthy manner. You contribute to positive, energizing, and rewarding environments for all Coworkers. You apply stakeholder management with other Reell facilities, Functional leaders, and coworkers to contribute ideas, vision, energy, and passion. Also, ensure that the customers are receiving products that meet or exceed their expectations. You use problem-solving techniques and work habits to diagnose and resolve issues. You also deploy data-driven decisions.You are taking care of Engineering changes and Corrective and Preventive actions (CAPA) You develop continuous improvement plans and applies quality tools and methods like Lean and Six SigmaYou participate in New Product Development teams, provide product development deliverables as assigned, and participate in project gate review activities.You are the contact person regarding supplier development, and quality issues for clients and suppliers and initiate, prepare and review items such as 8D reports.You are cooperating with the metrology lab to determine measurement methods and access and correct measurement correlation issues. You prepare and conduct Gage Repeatability and Reproducibility (Gage R&D) and apply Process Failure Mode Effect Analysis (PFMEA)Functie-eisenBachelor Degree (Mechanical/Industrial Engineering preferred). Minimum of two years Quality Engineering experience in a manufacturing organization. Working knowledge of and experience with Production Part Approval Process (PPAP).Experience in in applying quality tools and methods such as: PFMEA, Process Control Plans, Measurement Systems Analysis, which includes Gage R&R studies.Working knowledge of any ISO9001-based Quality Management System, including ISO9001, International Automotive task Force (IATF) 16949 and ISO13485.Experience with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T).Experience with SPC and related software.Understanding of sampling plan methodologies.ArbeidsvoorwaardenMarket conform salary depending on years of working experience between 4000 and 5500 Gross a monthNice environment with an open family culture

title: Renewables International Graduate Programme - Europa
description: Erste Platzierung in Deutschland, Großbritannien, Italien, Polen, Schweden, Niederlande oder Dänemark Start zum 1. September 2024, Vollzeit, befristete für 18 MonateWie sieht die Energie der Zukunft aus? Bei RWE haben wir ein klares Ziel: Klimaneutralität bis 2040 durch umfangreiche Investitionen in innovative Technologien, den ständigen Ausbau grüner Erzeugungskapazitäten und talentierte Nachwuchskräfte. Dafür suchen wir die nächste Generation von qualifizierten und ehrgeizigen Absolventen wie dich!Lass uns gemeinsam die Energie von morgen gestalten – werde ein aktiver Teil der Energiewende und des #TeamRWE! Was wir bieten: Der Einstieg in deine Karriere Unser 18-monatiges Renewables International Graduate Programme bietet dir die Möglichkeit, vertiefende Einblicke in das Business zu erhalten, ein eigenes internationales Netzwerk aufzubauen und dein Wissen in anspruchsvolle Projekte einzubringen. Unser Ziel ist es, dir einen umfassenden Überblick über die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette von RWE zu geben. Nach erfolgreichem Abschluss des Programms besteht die Möglichkeit, unbefristet ein volles Teammitglied zu werden.Du wirst an drei Rotationen in verschiedenen Unternehmensbereichen teilnehmen.Außerdem hast du die Möglichkeit, maximal 6 Monate im Ausland zu verbringen - außerhalb deines Startlandes. Bewirb dich bitte nur auf eine der beiden Stellenausschreibungen (Europa oder USA) entsprechend deines gewünschten Startlands.Darüber hinaus wirst du während der gesamten Dauer des Programms von einem Mentor unterstützt und deine Entwicklung wird durch Schulungen, Peer-Coaching usw. weiter gefördert. Wen wir suchen: Talente für die Gestaltung der Energiewende Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Masterstudium im Bereich Ingenieurwesen oder Naturwissenschaften (Physik, Geowissenschaften, Geoinformatik, Umweltwissenschaften, Ozeanographie usw.)Außerdem punktest du mit ersten Berufserfahrungen, idealerweise im Bereich der erneuerbaren Energien.Du bringst Leidenschaft für erneuerbare Energien mit und hast den Wunsch, ein aktiver Teil der Energiewende zu sein.Du verfügst über ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten zur komplexen Problemlösung, kombiniert mit einem strategischen und zukunftsorientierten Mindset.Du bist für deine Neugier, Offenheit für Veränderungen und den Mut, den Status quo in Frage zu stellen, bekannt.Du bist zur Eigeninitiative sowie zur Umsetzung eigener Ideen und Konzepte motiviert und hast ein hohes Maß an Selbständigkeit.Du besitzt die Fähigkeit zur Interaktion und Zusammenarbeit in multikulturellen Teams und hast einen Sinn für Vielfalt und Integration.Du verfügst über verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, andere europäische Sprachen sind ein Plus.rwe.com/karriere rwe.com/graduates Von hier aus profitierst du von vielen weiteren Benefits – Neugierig? Dann klick hier!Jetzt mit wenigen Klicks bewerben: Anzeigencode 83903, Bewerbungsfrist 15.12.2023.Hast Du Fragen? Kontakt im Recruiting: renewables_graduates@rwe.comWir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Behinderung, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. #inclusionmattersNatürlich findest du uns auch bei LinkedIn, Twitter und Xing.RWE steht für Wandel, Innovationskraft und Nachhaltigkeit. Als einer der global führenden Stromerzeuger aus Erneuerbaren Energien wollen wir bis 2040 klimaneutral sein und der Welt ein nachhaltiges Leben ermöglichen. Hierfür suchen wir Macher, die gemeinsam mit uns eine nachhaltige und sichere Energiezukunft schaffen wollen.

title: Client & Commercial Lead - Modeling and Meta-analysis
description: Reports to:MMA Executive DirectorJob SummaryThis new role within the modeling & meta-analysis (MMA) team is a hybrid role between consultancy and business development (BD). We are looking for experienced HEOR consultants (with working knowledge in economic modeling, data analytics and evidence synthesis) who are keen to focus more on business development (BD) activities to support sales growth for new and existing clients. We have an excellent team with many exciting and innovative projects ongoing, and the successful candidate will be able to support the team in selling these innovations to our clients. Since this is a new role within our team, the successful candidate must be a self-starter with excellent interpersonal skills and a proactive attitude.We firmly believe that engaging in meaningful business development (BD) conversations with our clients necessitates an intimate understanding of MMA’s service offerings. Therefore the expectation is that, at least initially, the successful candidate will invest ~50% of their time into MMA project work and ~50% of their time into BD-related activities (proposal writing, pitches, business intelligence, etc.).Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesProject related:Carrying out cost-effectiveness model development and adaptations (decision tree, Markov modelling, Partitioned survival modeling, micro-simulation) Performing budget impact model development and adaptations Conducting meta-analysis and indirect treatment comparisons Analysing trial data Reporting and presenting research findings to our clients BD related:Being the go-to person for MMA senior staff to provide business intelligence for new and existing MMA service lines and products Qualifying MMA leads and RFPs and championing the triage process to ensure our best proposals are submitted for the right opportunities Supporting the coordination of proposal development as needed, particularly for large projects, and engaging with colleagues from other teams on key opportunities to ensure OPEN Health addresses the client’s needs Delivering credential presentations, pitches and opening discussions with new prospective clients Working together with our central BD function to identify promising new opportunities for existing and new clients keeping in mind the strengths and gaps of the MMA team’s capabilities and knowledge Supporting BD and commercial acumen for MMA (senior) colleagues including training on best practices for proposal writing and pitches Providing information and interpretation on sales performance to the MMA operational leadership team Experience, Skills, And QualificationsPrior experience writing proposals, responding to RFPs and pitching proposals/bid defences Exceptional presentation skills and the ability to present complex information to non-technical audiences Excellent verbal & written communication skills Experience in economic modelling and/or meta-analysis with a consulting company Documented track record for the design and implementation of cost-effectiveness analyses, budget impact analyses, meta-analyses, or other mathematical models Experience with programming languages (R, WinBUGS, VBA, etc.) Strong analytical and organizational skills, including the ability to prepare relevant summaries of complex materials Highly organized and able to prioritize and balance role workload and demand that aligns with the delivery of agreed targets and plans. A master’s degree or PhD in relevant (health-)economics, public health, epidemiology, mathematics, statistics, or medical field Travel RequirementsInternational and domestic as required for team and client meetings/conferences as required by business needs About OPEN HealthOPEN Health unites deep scientific knowledge with wide-ranging specialist expertise to unlock possibilities that improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing. Working in partnership with our clients, we embrace our different perspectives and strengths to deliver fresh thinking and solutions that make a difference. OPEN Health is a flexible global organization that solves complex healthcare challenges across consulting, HEOR and market access, scientific communications, patient engagement, and creative omnichannel communications.What we offer:As a global organization, OPEN Health is committed to supporting our employees and their families through a comprehensive benefits programCompetitive pay, generous paid vacation and holidays, and health insurance programs across all our locations Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path An active and growing commitment to bettering the communities our employees call home through our Corporate Social Responsibility program The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work

title: Senior Director - Modeling and Meta-Analysis
description: Job SummaryThe Senior Director is a team player with the ability to build and maintain good relations with all levels of the team, working to define and execute the practice strategy. They will provide end-to-end delivery of projects and provide innovative solutions.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesTaking responsibility and actively engaging in proposal design and writing, from a etc)Prior experience writing proposals, responding to RFPs, and managing project teamsStrong analytical and organizational skills, including the ability to prepare relevant summaries of complex materialsExceptional presentation skills and the ability to present complex information to non-technical audiencesAbout OPEN HealthOPEN Health unites deep scientific knowledge with wide-ranging specialist expertise to unlock possibilities that improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing. Working in partnership with our clients, we embrace our different perspectives and strengths to deliver fresh thinking and solutions that make a difference.OPEN Health is a flexible global organization that solves complex healthcare challenges across HEOR and market access, medical communications and creative omnichannel campaigns.What we offer:As a global organization, OPEN Health is committed to supporting our employees and their families through a comprehensive benefits programCompetitive pay, generous paid vacation and holidays, and health insurance programs across all our locationsOngoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path An active and growing commitment to bettering the communities our employees call home through our Corporate Social Responsibility programThe opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve health outcomes and patient wellbeingDiverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to workIf we sound like the sort of business environment in which you would thrive, then we would love to hear from you.

title: Creative Marketing Manager
description: Voor ons marketingteam zijn we op zoek naar een Creative Marketing Manager om ons gepassioneerde team van content & community managers en projectmanagers aan te sturen. Jij bent dé early adapter! Met een digital-first mindset en een data gedreven aanpak ben jij constant op zoek naar innovatieve manieren om de wereld van (muziek)marketing te veroveren. In deze inspirerende rol overzie je de marketingcampagnes van onze lokale en internationale artiesten en ben je verantwoordelijk voor de algehele digitale en content strategie gericht op streaming.Als sparringpartner van de Marketing Director weet jij precies waar de kansen liggen én hoe we deze kunnen vertalen tot innovatieve marketing concepten. Je bent de drijvende kracht achter het team en schakelt op dagelijkse basis met interne en externe stakeholders om creatieve campagnes te creëren, die niet alleen de connectie tussen fans en artiesten versterken maar ook anderen inspireren. Daarnaast ben je in staat je campagnes te analyseren en deze ook financieel te verantwoorden.Wat je gaat doenEen greep uit de taken waar jij je mee bezig gaat houden:Je overziet alle marketing campagnes, waaronder streaming marketing, de content & influencer strategie en digitale marketing voor het Sony Music roster. Je stuurt een deel van het Marketing team (7 personen) aan en bent een drijvende kracht, zowel op inhoudelijk als op persoonlijk niveau. Je analyseert campagnes op basis van diverse databronnen en stuurt bij waar nodig. Je maakt data gedreven keuzes om de digitale strategie te optimaliseren en het succes van campagnes te vergroten. Je werkt samen met experts en haalt expertise in huis op het gebied van gaming, new tech en data, om deze om te zetten tot marketingcampagnes. Je volgt de ontwikkelingen binnen het digitale landschap en de muziekindustrie. Deze zet je om tot kansen voor onze artiesten. Je bent in contact met alle interne stakeholders, zoals het data team, de A&R afdeling, de internationale labels van Sony Music, het promo team en finance. Je deelt nieuwe inzichten en best practices van onder andere social platforms (TikTok, YouTube, Meta, Snapchat) met het team. Wie ben jij? Je bent iemand met een ongekende passie voor muziek. Je brengt structuur, hebt een hands-on mentaliteit en bent in staat om prioriteiten te stellen. In de afgelopen jaren heb je meerdere digitale projecten geleid, en je kan feilloos onderbouwen waarom je bepaalde data gedreven keuzes hebt gemaakt. Daarnaast ben je communicatief sterk en weet je het team en stakeholders mee te krijgen met jouw visie.Je bent een strategische, commerciële denker en sterk in creative concepting, waardoor je het team kunt aansturen en verder helpt met inhoudelijke ideeën. Je bent een natuurlijke verbinder en hebt in de afgelopen jaren een sterk netwerk opgebouwd in de media- en/of entertainmentwereld. Je motiveert en inspireert anderen, en bent altijd op zoek naar nieuwe mogelijkheden om voorop te blijven lopen.Daarnaast heb je: Minimaal 10 jaar ervaring in marketing, met aantoonbare ervaring in digitale campagnesMinimaal 2 -3 jaar ervaring in een leidinggevende functieHBO werk- en denkniveauVaardig in Nederlands en Engels, zowel mondeling als schriftelijkWat bieden wij? Je komt terecht in een team van gepassioneerde collega's en krijgt de kans om te werken bij één van de grootste internationale muziekmaatschappijen. Ons kantoor is gevestigd in de iconische A'DAM Toren waar we elke dag werken met prachtige artiesten. Met onder andere 35 vakantie- en ATV-dagen, een internationaal netwerk, volop kansen om je te ontwikkelen en muzikale extra's zoals evenementen, festivals en concerten creëren wij een dynamische en inspirerende werkomgeving.Wij vertegenwoordigen in Nederland de muziek van onder (veel) meer Adele, Beyoncé, BLØF, Bruce Springsteen, Calvin Harris, Doja Cat, Eefje de Visser, Gavin James, George Ezra, Justin Timberlake, Kygo, Lost Frequencies, Mariah Carey, Nielson, Pharrell Williams, P!nk, Racoon, Rosalía, Suzan & Freek, The Kid LaRoi en Travis Scott. Sony Music geldt binnen de muziekwereld als innovatief koploper op het gebied van streaming services en heeft een lange historie in de muziekindustrie. Ons Benelux-team bestaat uit 70 gepassioneerde collega's, die toegevoegde waarde leveren aan artiesten, muziekliefhebbers en alle betrokkenen achter de schermen.We begrijpen dat je wellicht niet aan álle genoemde criteria voldoet. You know what, dat doen wij ook niet! Als je jezelf uitgedaagd voelt moedigen we je aan om nu te solliciteren! We zoeken momenteel een Creative Marketing Manager, binnen ons SME functiehuis krijg je de titel van Head of Digital.

title: Data Analyst
description: Powering our sustainable future, togetherWe live in an era where electric mobility is “the new normal.” Whereas over the past decade, electric vehicles were only for the few, today they are for everyone. Welcome to the electric era. Enter EVBox.Founded in 2010, EVBox empowers forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing flexible and scalable electric vehicle charging solutions. With its offering of residential, commercial, and fast charging stations, as well as scalable charging management software, EVBox ensures that electric mobility is accessible to everyone.We believe in a future where daily transportation is emission-free and sustained by smart charging infrastructure. That’s why we’ve made it our goal to accelerate the adoption of electric mobility by bringing the most accessible and scalable charging solutions to the world. However, the transition from gas to electric cars will change a great deal of what we know about transportation.The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company. Today, EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States, with hundreds of driven professionals from different wals of life working for us.About UsAt the Everon Platform Organization within EVBox, we empower forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing top-notch EV Charging management solutions.Our engineers build new products, enhance existing solutions and resolve many interesting challenges on a daily basis. This work is delivered in a culture that emphasizes ownership and excellence. Everyone is empowered to make bold decisions and take responsibility for the solutions they build.About The RoleAs a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team to expand the data capabilities of the Everon platform. We leverage the vast amounts of data from our global network of customers and charging stations to build high-quality data sets, generate valuable insights, and create innovative data products. We build and run data services and pipelines that validate and enrich incoming data, and provide convenient and secure access to teams across the organization. Our aim is to empower our customers and deliver a delightful user experience by responsibly leveraging data, learning from insights, growing our knowledge, and paving the way towards a sustainable future.In This Role You WillAnalyze transactional and operational data, leveraging data analysis and models to unlock actionable insights, identify business improvement opportunities, and provide recommendations to enhance performance and efficiencyDesign, execute, and interpret experiments to validate hypotheses, drawing detailed and impactful conclusions to drive innovation and optimize delivery processesCollaborate closely with various teams, aligning on data strategy and KPIs. Engage with stakeholders to collect requirements, deliver insights, and ensure clear communication of findings, recommendations, and progressProvide and support tools and data visualizations to stakeholders to empower their data-based decision-making processDevelop data-driven business insights to find opportunities and recommend the prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiativesBeing able to define and design business value from raw data and implement data models with an abstraction level close to the business domainsEnhance the data landscape by collaborating with peers to ensure data logging and data pipelines' availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliabilityAbout YouYou hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other related quantitative fields4+ years of experience in roles such as Product Analyst, Data Analyst, or in other data analysis-focused functionsAdvanced SQL expertise and strong Python proficiency for data analysis and modelling. Experience working with dbt is a plusExperienced with dashboarding/data visualization platforms such as Grafana, Tableau, Looker, or similarAbility to deliver on tight deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detailProven track record of handling large datasets, extracting insights, and summarizing key learnings and takeawaysProven aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using dataBenefitsAt EVBox, we believe that when people feel valued and rewarded their potential is unlimited. We offer competitive salaries and review remuneration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. We promote within, offering learning and development opportunities, and we also provide the following benefits, as standard:A very diverse workforce and an open culturePrivate pension contribution25 vacation daysHoliday Swap (2 days) - ability to swap out a public holiday for a paid vacation dayCommuting allowanceUp to 3 days remote working, including working from home allowance of EUR 2 net per day (in consultation with your manager)Budget of 600 Euro to set up your home officeAbility to work remotely from anywhere outside of the Netherlands for 4 weeksAccess to learning platforms and personal development budgetAcross our 8 locations, more than 700 EVBoxers work together to provide electric vehicle charging solutions that help businesses move forward. Are you ready to join them? Hit apply.We at EVBox aim to take down historical and structural barriers that stand in the way of our employees. The chargers we manufacture are built for the sustainable future we believe in. We commit to sustained action in tackling processes and practices that systematically penalize our employees. Our DEI efforts are designed not just for the present, but create long-lasting change in the future of our industry. We continue to learn and dismantle the roadblocks that our people face in order to create positive outcomes for all.We believe in an equitable, diverse and inclusive environment where everyone, no matter their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, identity, religious belief, education or ability, feel valued and respected. We embrace diverse life experiences and heritages and ensure that all voices are valued and heard.Do you want to get to know us even better? Then pay a visit to our Career page, blog or check out our social media channels: LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter.EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read about how EVBox processes your personal data here.EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read here how EVBox processes your personal data.

title: Quantitative Researcher | Amsterdam | C++ | HFT | Up to €250,000 + Bonus
description: Job Title: Quantitative Researcher (C++ | HFT)Client: Elite Buy Side FirmSalary: Up to €250,000 + performance-based bonusesLocation: Amsterdam Our clients are looking for a Quantitative Researcher for our Amsterdam-based office who will join one of our Buy Side teams to analyse the global markets, create and optimise profitable trading strategies. It is a chance to join a group of the highest-regarded talent around!This team has an unlimited tech budget, promotes a great culture, and is made up of incredible like-minded individuals.Benefits:Exceptional professional growth opportunities in a tech-focused company, allowing you to enhance your skills at an accelerated pace.Access to state-of-the-art technologies, enabling you to work with advanced tools and frameworks.Highly competitive bonuses and a comprehensive benefits package that surpasses industry standards.Rapid career progression and exposure to diverse technologies.Basic knowledge of Machine learning techniques.Key Requirements:Degree in math, physics, computer science or another quantitative field.Strong knowledge of python, C++.At least 3 years of experience as a Quantitative researcher in a leading firm.Ability to conduct original research.Strong written and verbal communication skills, enabling effective collaboration and information sharing.Demonstrated enthusiasm for ongoing learning and a proactive attitude towards adopting new technologies.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, adaptable, and high-pressure environment, delivering results efficiently.If you are interested, or for more information, contact clee@hunterbond.com

title: Research Software Engineer - Modeling and Meta-Analysis
description: Reports to (Associate) Director Modeling and Meta-AnalysisJob SummaryAs a Research Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in developing robust, innovative software solutions for statistical analysis, simulations, and intuitive dashboard reports. Your work will help drive patients' access to novel healthcare interventions across the globe.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop, and maintain software applications for statistical analysis and simulations in the field of health economics and outcomes research. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand research requirements and translate them into scalable, efficient, standardized, and user-friendly software solutionsEnsure the accuracy and reliability of statistical algorithms, contributing to the credibility of research findingsCreate interactive and visually compelling dashboard reports to communicate research findings effectivelyCollaborate with user experience (UX) designers to enhance the accessibility and usability of interactive reportsImplement best practices for code review and version control to maintain a high standard of software qualityExperience, Skills, And QualificationsMaster’s Degree or PhD in any relevant science, such as health economics, econometrics, economics, pharmacy, epidemiology, statistics, medical sciences, or computer scienceProficient in R and familiar with the tidyverseExperience with version control systems, preferably Git (and GitHub)Comfortable with models and statisticsYou’re passionate about writing reproducible, efficient, tidy, readable, and testable codeSelf-starter, autodidactExperience with survival analysis, network meta-analysis, simulation, health-economic modeling would be preferableExperience with web development, D3.js, a JavaScript framework (preferably Vue.js) and TypeScript would be preferableTravel RequirementsInternational and domestic as required for team and client meetings/conferences as required by business needsAbout OPEN HealthOPEN Health unites deep scientific knowledge with wide-ranging specialist expertise to unlock possibilities that improve health outcomes and patient wellbeing. Working in partnership with our clients, we embrace our different perspectives and strengths to deliver fresh thinking and solutions that make a difference.OPEN Health is a flexible global organization that solves complex healthcare challenges across HEOR and market access, medical communications and creative omnichannel campaigns.What we offer:As a global organization, OPEN Health is committed to supporting our employees and their families through a comprehensive benefits programCompetitive pay, generous paid vacation and holidays, and health insurance programs across all our locationsOngoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path An active and growing commitment to bettering the communities our employees call home through our Corporate Social Responsibility programThe opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve health outcomes and patient wellbeingDiverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to workIf we sound like the sort of business environment in which you would thrive, then we would love to hear from you.

title: Project Manager Operations
description: Are you a talented Project Manager Operations looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity to make a difference? Join our team and help bring our online platform for clean energy systems to the next level. Located just steps away from Rotterdam Central Station, our office gives you amazing views from the 26th floor of the Millennium Tower. If you are ready to take your career to the next level and make a positive sustainable impact, apply now!Company ProfileSkoon is a young and mission-driven company that was founded six years ago with the goal of making clean energy systems accessible and affordable to everyone, everywhere. Skoon is committed to sustainability and supports the transition to a low-carbon economy. We offer a central platform that connects users with suppliers of clean energy systems, such as mobile batteries, hydrogen generators, solar panels and many more. These energy systems are used to power temporary applications such as construction sites, events and film sets, as a clean alternative to diesel generators.We have developed world’s first online marketplace on which clean energy systems are traded ‘Airbnb style’. Additionally, our rental management software tool supports owners of energy systems to enable data-driven and scalable operations. Creating a network of clean energy systems positions us for our long term mission: being the flexible layer of the electricity grid.Skoon values a healthy working environment, personal development and career advancement. We have a highly skilled team and a large expert network that can help you grow and succeed professionally. We are dedicated to creating a fun, positive, and supportive working environment that encourages creativity and innovation. Skoon is growing internationally and we work in a diverse team.Candidate profileWe are looking for a motivated team player, comfortable with working in a dynamic start-up environment, able to solve problems quickly and in a diligent manner. We seek someone who is always hunting for efficiency increase and automation, in close collaboration with other team divisions. We value a strong sense of personal and professional engagement to our team, product and mission.Job DescriptionYou will:Manage complex operational challenges with regards to logistics, customs, etc.Perform stakeholder management of clean energy rentals between suppliers and users on our marketplaceOptimise workflows to improve the efficiency and autonomy of our rental processSupport the sales team by solving technical and operational challengesMonitor live rentals to analyse for efficiency gains and manage risksWe are looking for someone who;Has relevant working experience in the field of operations and/or energy rentals. A solid understanding of energy and electricity is a plus.Has experience in stakeholder management and working with deadlinesIs able to communicate smoothly, pragmatic and effective with customers and team membersIs patient, calm and in controlIs detail-oriented, organised and capable of managing multiple energy projects simultaneouslyHas a problem-solving mindset with the ability to earn trust from all stakeholders involved in energy rentalsIs aware of the clean energy market and has a desire to learn and continuously improveIs able to speak, read, and write English and Dutch at a professional level Is always seeking efficiency gains by improving and automating workflowsIs able to speak, read, and write English at a professional levelWe encourage you to apply even if you might not possess all above-mentioned qualifications, your enthusiasm for the role is most important.We offer you;A competitive salaryTravel expensesLearning and development budgetLaptopModern office on the 26th floor with an amazing views in Rotterdam CentreFlexible work environments (currently working hybrid)A scale-up mentality with opportunities to grow (professionally and personally)Access to a gym located at the same building as the officeOn-the-job training and coachingMany young, enthusiastic, and motivated colleaguesFun team activitiesYou will work in an organization that is in high growth mode, with development opportunities and room for your own input. We take care of you both physically and mentally, since health is an important value to us. Every day will be a day where you can learn, grow, and make a meaningful impact while having fun with your colleagues.IMPORTANT NOTICE:Recruiters: We’re focussed on getting clean energy to everyone and unsolicited acquisition can be distracting. Please help the environment and only contact our HR team regarding our vacancies.Candidates and Interested Parties: If you have questions or need more information, please reach out to our HR team at hr@skoon.world.Thank you for helping us keep a smooth and sustainable hiring process!

title: Analytics Intern
description: We are looking for an Analytics Intern to join our team at VonWood and help us bring the wood industry into the 21st century.We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Analytics Intern to join our team. The intern will collaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes. They will be responsible for improving and updating our low-code application in Retool, building new workflows, identifying meaningful insights from large data sources, and designing, developing, testing, and implementing appropriate data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will be proactive, open-minded, and have a strong interest in data analysis and visualisation.What wood you do?As an Analytics Intern you willCollaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes;Identify meaningful insights from large data sources; interpret and communicate insights and findings from analyses and experiments to product, service, and business stakeholders;Scrape, analyse and dashboard external data;Design, develop, test, and implement appropriate data-driven solutions through data analysis and visualisation.Why wood you?We are a fast-growing startup in Amsterdam. Besides being part of a young, fresh, and energetic team of over a dozen colleagues (you’ll be in good company), we can offer you the following:An international, ambitious startup culture with a sustainable touch;An inspiring environment of brilliant, fun, and creative professionals;Continuous learning and growth opportunities beyond your field of expertise;An internship compensation of €450 gross per month;Making a difference, by making the world more sustainable;Possibility to work from home;Convenient location near the business heart of Amsterdam (‘Zuid-As’) and Olympic Stadium.We are looking for ambitious individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments. We are building complex software solutions with a modern tech stack.Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Information Management, Business Analytics and Management, Information Science, Data Science, Data Engineering, or related fields;Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written);Strong attention to detail and a structured way of working;Proactive, open-minded, and flexible personality;Proficient in SQL;Some programming experience in python or a similar language;Bias towards action - We learn by building things, not by talking about building things;

title: Research Consultant - Modeling and Meta-Analysis
description: Research Consultant – Modeling and Meta-AnalysisReports to Associate Director Modeling and Meta-AnalysisJob SummaryAs a Research Consultant at OPEN Health, you are an essential contributor to our team, working across various projects with responsibility for delivering high-quality outputs. You will support project leads in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary, international organization.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesConducting and/or guiding and mentoring junior consultants on trial data analysis and evidence synthesis projects and performing quality control of project deliverablesDeveloping project reports and other deliverablesAdhering to project budgets and timelinesSupporting client interactions and outreach to ensure client satisfactionAssisting with requests for proposals and supporting growth of the business through the development of strong client relationshipsEffectively managing relationships within OPEN Health and with external stakeholdersSupporting the development of, implementation, and maintenance of internal processes and quality standardsKeeping abreast with the latest developments in the fieldDisseminating and integrating new methods into the businessContributing to thought leadership and publicationsExperience, Skills, and methods and meta-regressionPopulation-adjusted indirect treatment comparisons, including matching-adjusted indirect comparison, simulated treatment comparison, and multi-level network
