By combining cutting edge methods and technologies, state-of-the-art facilities, and talented researchers, we help maximize our clients’ success. We are located in Leiden, the Netherlands, and collaborate closely with the University of Leiden and the clinical departments of the LUMC. CHDR stands for scientific quality. We stand for deepening, innovation and collaboration. Employees and test subjects feel at home at CHDR. We deliver top quality in clinical research and are constantly innovating. CHDR employs more than 350 people and we conduct an average of 45 studies per year. By working closely with colleagues, you make use of each other's specialisms so that our customers receive the right service and you and CHDR develop further.Founded in 1987Present in the sector of Informatiediensten.The average age is 37.Currently working in 1 office.

description: Role : AWS Python Data EngineerLocation : Hague, NLDuration : 6 Months ContractWork Model : Hybrid (Weekly 2 Days Onsite) Must be at least B2 Level Dutch SpeakerJob Description: Must Have:AWS, Python, CICD, SQL• Candidate with good work experience on below skills: • SQL Server (Must have) • Data analysis skills• Data modeling skills • Data Build Tool (DBT) • Airflow• AWS Serverless architecture• AWS services (RDS, Lambda using NodeJs/Python, ECS, S3, Athena, API Gateway etc.) • Understanding of AWS network infra (Nice to have) • CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Gitlabs and AWS Native tools• Infrastructure as Code AWS CDK / Terraform / etc., AWS CloudFormation (Nice to have) • Python (Expert Level)• PySpark , C# Data Bricks (nice to Have) • Asset management domain knowledge - is big plus• * Should have 5-8 years of experience • * Good communication

title: BI Consultant
description: Heb jij passie voor data, ervaring met Microsoft BI producten en wil je een maatschappelijke bijdrage leveren door deze kennis in te zetten in de zorg? Dan is de rol van BI consultant bij Bince iets voor jou!Ben jij een ervaren professional in BI en heb je binnen de zorg kennis opgedaan van data en processen? Dan ontvangen we graag je CV. Een uitgebreide motivatiebrief is niet nodig, we gaan graag met je in gesprek om je te leren kennen.FunctieomschrijvingAls BI Consultant bij Bince ga je aan de slag binnen een team met diverse BI specialisten. Samen met je collega’s en onze opdrachtgevers in de zorg bouw en implementeer je een state-of-the-art BI-oplossing, daarbij maak je gebruik van Microsoft BI producten. Met jouw dienstverlenende instelling, gedrevenheid en communicatieve vaardigheden pas je perfect binnen ons team.Dit ga je doenJe fungeert als projectleider en kennispartner bij de klant, houdt doorontwikkeling en kansen bij de klant in de gaten en zorgt intern voor coördinatie en begeleiding van collega's.Je bouwt samen met collega's uit het team aan mooie BI-oplossing met behulp van Power BI (DAX) en Azure (SQL).Wij detacheren niet en hebben een state-of-the-art BI-oplossing dat wordt gerealiseerd met Microsoft BI producten en volledig in de cloud draait waarmee we deze op afstand voor onze klanten kunnen beheren. Dit betekent dat je veel met collega’s in teamverband werkt aan gerichte oplossingen voor onze klanten. We hebben korte lijnen in een team met diverse senior BI specialisten.Bince is Microsoft Gold Partner en Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider. Je wordt door ons en Microsoft opgeleid en bijgeschoold in de Microsoft stack.Wij vragenMinimaal HBO werk- en denkniveauErvaring in of affiniteit met de zorgsectorErvaring met de BI stack van MicrosoftAffiniteit met Microsoft Azure en Microsoft Power BIJe houdt de laatste ontwikkelingen in de gaten en ziet kansenPositieve instelling en pragmatischCommunicatief vaardig en een goed gevoel voor mensenGoede beheersing van de Nederlandse taalWoonachtig in het noorden of oosten van NederlandWij biedenBince wil samen de zorg slimmer maken. De zorg is echter altijd in ontwikkeling, net als de techniek waarmee we werken. Door te blijven leren en ontwikkelen, zorgen we dat ons team de kennispartner kan zijn voor onze klanten. Daarom zijn er allerlei ontwikkeltrajecten die je kunt volgen, bijvoorbeeld in de Microsoft stack.Over BinceBij Bince ga je aan de slag in een open, vriendelijke werkomgeving waar medewerkers veel met elkaar gemeen hebben, vooral de passie voor de zorg en techniek. De loyaliteit en betrokkenheid is groot. In onze organisatie ligt de nadruk op de lange termijn voordelen van continue leren en verbeteren. Dat ligt uiteraard ook in lijn met onze missie: Samen de zorg slimmer maken.Onze kernwaarden: coöperatief, realistisch en gedreven.Hoe nu verder?Ben jij geinteresseerd in bovenstaand profiel voor BI Consultant? Bince ziet graag jouw sollicitatie tegemoet! Door middel van het klikken op de solliciteerbutton kom je in een overzichtelijk sollicitatiescherm waar je met jouw CV kan reageren op de vacature van BI Consultant.

title: Data Engineer
description: Data Engineer - Amsterdam - NederlandstaligGebruik je passie voor Data Pipelines, Data Modellen en Data Contracts om het proces van ontwerp tot implementatie te verzorgen voor verschillende klanten en landen. Denk aan automatisering, architectuurpatronen en metadata. Sluit je aan bij een revolutionair bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in AI en Data-oplossingen, waar je volledig kunt duiken in de wereld van Data Engineering en een impact kunt maken!Wie ben jij?Sterke technische vaardigheden in Python en SQLBij voorkeur ervaring aan DatabricksComfortabel met voor een klant staan en verantwoordelijkheid kunnen pakkenBekendheid met tools voor data science-software en cloud computing-platforms.Sterke documentatievaardigheden, bekendheid met het Agile ontwikkelingsproces, en bewezen vermogen om projectplannen en traceerbare taken voor te bereiden en te communiceren.Echte teamspiritVloeiende beheersing van Nederlandse en Engelse taal Gemotiveerd om een jong, dynamisch, ambitieus, maar vooral leuk team te versterken!Ben jij een voortdurende leerling, gepassioneerd om altijd op de hoogte te blijven van het Data & AI-landschap? Solliciteer nu!

title: Research Data Analyst
description: A fantastic opportunity has arisen with a Asset Management organisation within their R&D department.The role of analysts in this department is to learn and apply the company principles to investments and support the asset class specialists for the operation of the models.As an Analyst you will gain multiple opportunities to learn in depth end-to-end investment processes for multiple asset classes and grow into becoming a specialist over time.As a Research Data Analyst, Amsterdam, You WillPerform key tasks related to data management and analysis of financial indicators and operating the models for the assigned class.Carry out research run models for portfolios and securities trading and compute performance.Provide the data in clear format to be utilised by the business.The Successful Data Analyst Will HaveDegree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Economics of Mathematics (Master's are advantageous)Prior professional work experienceExperience with Python/ SQL/ Matlab/ R or other math based programming languagesWillingness to be on-site 5 days per week.As The Data Analyst, You Will ReceiveCompetitive Base salary up to €60,000BenefitsBonusMorgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Data-analist
location: Son en Breugel, North Brabant, Netherlands
description: Vacature: Data & BI Analist bij Lekkerland Nederland B.V.Onze opdrachtgever -Lekkerland Nederland B.V. - is dé specialist voor consumptie onderweg in vier Europese landen. In 2022 werden er circa 74.000 verkooppunten in Europa bediend, met een jaaromzet van 14 Miljard. Sinds 2020 maakt Lekkerland onderdeel uit van de Duitse REWE Groep met een jaaromzet van 84 miljard. In België is REWE actief onder de naam Conway.Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol bij het benutten van de waarde van data binnen de organisatie. Je bent bedreven in het vinden van het perfecte evenwicht tussen business en IT. Je verzamelt de behoeften van gebruikers, vertaalt deze naar functionele ontwerpen en datamodellen.In nauwe samenwerking met de Data Engineer implementeer je het datamodel, waarna jij de Power BI-dashboards bouwt die je presenteert aan de stakeholders. Als onderdeel van het opkomende BI-team streven we ernaar om snel een gewaardeerde partner van de business te worden. Jij draagt bij aan het verwezenlijken van deze ambitie.Taken en verantwoordelijkheden:Het in kaart brengen van de behoeften van eindgebruikers en deze vertalen naar een rapportagemodel.Het ontwikkelen van het Power BI-datamodel en de bijbehorende dashboards.Zorgen voor goed onderhoud, beheer en documentatie van BI-producten.Een belangrijke rol spelen bij het opzetten en bevorderen van het gebruik van BI binnen de organisatie. Je denkt actief mee in het proces, stelt kritische vragen en doet verbetervoorstellen.Jouw profiel en DNA:Je beschikt minimaal over een relevante afgeronde HBO-studie;Je hebt hebt werkervaring als Data Analist met MS Power Platform in complexe Azure omgevingen.Je beschikt over de certificering “Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst” (PL-300) of bent bereid deze te behalen.Goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden.Flexibele en servicegerichte instelling.Aanbod:Een boeiende en uitdagende functie in een informele werkomgeving.Ruimte voor jouw professionele input en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.Een salaris range van EUR 3.500,- tot EUR 5.500,- op basis van een fulltime dienstverband.Een fulltime dienstverband, deelname aan de pensioenregeling.Mogelijkheid om gebruik te maken van collectieve korting op aanvullende zorgverzekeringen.8% vakantiegeld.De mogelijkheid om via ons keuzemodel een deel van je brutoloon in te ruilen voor netto vergoedingen.Flexibele werkmogelijkheden, inclusief de mogelijkheid om deels vanuit huis te werken.Toegang tot fysiotherapie.Reageren via Scope Data:Scope Data heeft exclusiviteit voor deze opdracht. Heb je interesse in deze unieke uitdaging, mail dan je reactie en CV naar info@scopedata.nl met referentie NS-LL0109. Voor meer informatie bel ons gerust. Het telefoonnummer is 078 - 8200 362 of 06 -27 55 22 26.Wij nemen alleen sollicitaties in behandeling van kandidaten met een vaste woon- en verblijfplaats in Nederland.Please notice: We only accept job applications from candidates with a permanent place of residence in the Netherlands. This position is not suitable for candidates with a (TWV) work visa.Scope Data: voor professionals en oplossingen in Data & Analytics - Consultancy, Projectmanagement, Interim Services, Werving & Selectie. Alle rechten voorbehouden.

title: Junior/Medior Data Analist, Amsterdam
description: Als Junior/Medior Data Analist krijg je de kans om aan de slag te gaan bij een snelgroeiende dynamische energieleverancier in Nederland. Onze opdrachtgever is vastbesloten om de overgang naar klimaat neutrale energie te realiseren. Ze streven naar duurzamere klantportefeuilles en investeren in duurzame energie.Als een ervaren Data Analist, ligt jouw verantwoordelijkheid in het analyseren en interpreteren van complexe datasets. Je vertaalt deze gegevens naar waardevolle inzichten en oplossingen die van grote betekenis zijn voor onze klanten. Dit werk verricht je binnen een team van data-analisten, waarbij jouw rol tevens bestaat uit het opstellen van rapporten en presentaties om deze inzichten effectief over te brengen aan zowel klanten als collega’s. Jouw passie voor data en de veelzijdige toepassingen ervan maken jou van onschatbare waarde voor de toekomst van onze opdrachtgever.StandplaatsAmsterdam, op kantoor en gedeeltelijk hybride vanuit huis.SalarisSalarisindicatie van €3.000,- tot €4.000,- bruto per maand. Afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring, met kans om door te groeien.Wij zoekenJe hebt minimaal 1 tot 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist;Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, SQL en Python;Kennis van de energiesector is een pré;Je hebt sterke vaardigheden op het gebied van statistiek, databaseontwerp, data science technieken en data management principes;Je hebt uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.Wij biedenMarktconform salaris o.b.v. kennis en ervaring; De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken;Een opleidingsbudget ter ondersteuning van jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling; Een laptop van de zaak;Een uitdagende baan bij een sterk en dynamische organisatie; Regelmatig sociale activiteiten met het team ter ontspanning; Een jaarcontract met uitzicht op een vast contract. Als Data Analist focus je op het analyseren van complexe gegevens, waaronder financiële en actuariële informatie, om waardevolle inzichten te genereren. Je vertaalt deze inzichten in heldere presentaties en rapporten, die fungeren als essentiële instrumenten om jou, als klant, te informeren en te adviseren. Samen met je collega-data-analisten en business analisten werk je nauw samen om projecten succesvol af te ronden binnen de gestelde deadlines.Als adviseur deel je niet alleen grondige analyses, maar bied je ook concrete oplossingen aan op basis van je expertise in data-analyse, gegevenslogistiek en data-management. Je blijft voortdurend op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen in data-analyse en de energiesector. Je werk is dynamisch en uitdagend, waarbij elke werkdag uniek is. Dit is jouw kans om te blijven leren en te werken in een omgeving die constant evolueert.Je wordt verwelkomd in een prettige, kleinschalige omgeving met korte communicatielijnen en een informele sfeer. Hier zul je je snel thuis voelen. Achter de schermen van de energie-industrie bevindt zich een wereld vol IT, data en processen, waarin onze opdrachtgever echt impact maakt. Maar het is niet alleen maar hard werken. Integendeel, naast vakinhoudelijk sparren houden ze ook van af en toe een borrel of een feestje.Reageer direct!Ben je enthousiast geworden over de functie Junior/Medior Data Analist? Graag ontvangen we je motivatiebrief en cv. Je kunt deze sturen naar via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina.. Voor meer informatie kun je bellen naar Masora Lilipaly, bereikbaar op 020-2117610.Functie-voorstelAls Data Analist focus je op het analyseren van complexe gegevens, waaronder financiële en actuariële informatie, om waardevolle inzichten te genereren. Je vertaalt deze inzichten in heldere presentaties en rapporten, die fungeren als essentiële instrumenten om jou, als klant, te informeren en te adviseren. Samen met je collega-data-analisten en business analisten werk je nauw samen om projecten succesvol af te ronden binnen de gestelde deadlines.Als adviseur deel je niet alleen grondige analyses, maar bied je ook concrete oplossingen aan op basis van je expertise in data-analyse, gegevenslogistiek en data-management. Je blijft voortdurend op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen in data-analyse en de energiesector. Je werk is dynamisch en uitdagend, waarbij elke werkdag uniek is. Dit is jouw kans om te blijven leren en te werken in een omgeving die constant evolueert.Je wordt verwelkomd in een prettige, kleinschalige omgeving met korte communicatielijnen en een informele sfeer. Hier zul je je snel thuis voelen. Achter de schermen van de energie-industrie bevindt zich een wereld vol IT, data en processen, waarin onze opdrachtgever echt impact maakt. Maar het is niet alleen maar hard werken. Integendeel, naast vakinhoudelijk sparren houden ze ook van af en toe een borrel of een feestje.Reageer direct!Ben je enthousiast geworden over de functie Junior/Medior Data Analist? title: Data Analyst
description: Rethink What You’re Capable Of With Kevin.Are you ready to make fundamental change and do something radical? We’re rebuilding payments how they always should have been – at pace. So whatever your experience, you’ll use it in ways you never have before. We’re pioneers who embrace uncertainty to do things no one has before. At kevin., you’ll create first-of-a-kind breakthrough solutions alongside other highly skilled people from many industries and backgrounds. We need people who take ownership and build with freedom. You’re the expert in what you do, so we won’t limit you with our expectations. If you bring courage and determination, we’ll surround you with other inspirational people and give you the freedom to exceed what you thought you were capable of. The opportunities at kevin. are unlike anywhere else. You just have to grab them and build your different.As our new Data Analyst, you will:Be the person to go to with all the data-related questions for different departments such as Finance, Compliance, People, etc.Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to find answers and solutions to different issues that the business is facing.Present findings to the relevant parties with possible solutions.Create possibilities to track the performance of different domains using Tableau, SQL, and other tools at the disposal.Collaborate with Data Engineers to load and model the data so it can be used for further analysis and dashboarding.Explore data sets to identify data-related issues and collaborate with different teams to have them fixed.Contribute to making data a cornerstone in the decision-making process.What you need to be successful:2 years minimum of experience in a Data Analyst role.Experience working with Tableau is the must (1- 2 years minimum).SQL experience in writing complex queries.Understanding how ETL’s works.Reward and benefits - What’s on offer at kevin.:We only hire the very best talent from across Europe and beyond. It’s a competitive landscape so our salaries and benefits are equally competitive. Our comprehensive benchmarking means our remuneration for this role ranges from €3300 to €3900, based on your experience and competence, but if you’ve got something extra-special to bring to the table, let’s talk!For many people, the most valuable benefit of working at kevin. is the opportunity to make fundamental change, create first times and build with freedom as part of the team creating a world of payment possibilities. Alongside this, we have a range of financial, non-financial and cultural benefits on offer.Core benefits:Competitive salary (Routinely benchmarked against latest industry data)Private Health InsuranceAdditional vacation plus local public holidaysUp to 90 days per year of working from anywhere in the worldFantastic opportunities for progression and promotion as the business grows (25% of our employees were promoted in the last 12 months)Future stock option opportunities based on individual and business performanceNon-financial benefits:Work on cutting-edge technologies with the latest tools and modern tech stackApple MacBook and accessoriesTravel insurance for use when travelling for business purposesSubsidised secure parking*Free on-site gym*Free lunch, snacks, and hot/cold drinks*Sports and social activities, including free tennis lessons*Global company eventsWork with experts from across Europe and beyondBe part of a diverse and multinational business with 30+ nationalitiesBenefits may vary by location.About Kevin.kevin. is the payments reset no one saw coming. We exist to free partners from the pains of legacy payments, so we can build a world of payment possibilities together. We’ve rebuilt the infrastructure to make transactions more direct, efficient, and secure – for digital and physical sales. Our first-of-a-kind payments scheme changes the game for businesses without changing the way people pay – even in-store.Our multi-tenant payments acceptance network is white-label, brand-agnostic, and free from intermediaries. It gives partners sole control of their payments so they can unlock more value with new services, better conversion, and strengthened customer loyalty. We’re experts from many places working with regulators, banks, payments services providers, and major retailers to build a world of payment possibilities together. Rethink what you’re capable of with kevin.kevin. is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
description: Working as a Data AnalystAs our Data Analyst, you are responsible for preparing and providing actionable management information to all OCD NL stakeholders and to provide accurate, complete and an up-to-date status regarding the planning and utilization of our resources.As our Data Analyst, you must support the OCD management team to execute our business strategy, by providing them with business information and insights needed. You advice stakeholders on possibilities with data analysis and are able to build and maintain Power BI and other management dashboards and reports.You understand our existing IT systems and resources that carry various sorts of data and are able to validate and use these data to provide information and advice.Key Responsibilities:You and your team ensure that the MD, the department heads and the different teams have access to the accurate and complete management information needed for their roles. You also provide with new and surprising insights leveraging data analysis capabilities.You maintain our Power BI environment, including all dashboards and reports for OCD NL.You work together with our Global business intelligence teams, Global IT teams, the Global Business Analyst and bring best practices to the Dutch organization.You keep up to date with the latest developments, best practices and certification requirements on business intelligence.You understand the interests and responsibilities of various stakeholders and proactively bring new ideas, advice and insights to them.What we expect of youYou have at least a university or HBO degree.You have at least 3 years of experience in the field of Data Analytics.You are an ambitious person with an innovative mindset.You have strong Power BI skills.You are able to translate business needs & requirements into KPI’s, graphs and other management dashboards.You are fluent in Dutch and English.You have an entrepreneurial spirit.You are a team builder and have a strong drive to grow our business.You do not a have a 9 to 5 mentality and take price in coaching and growing your teams.What you can expect from usBe taken care of - We offer you an attractive Salary & Bonus, 28 vacation days plus two business closing days; in addition, you have the option to purchase additional vacation days. a quality pension, company smartphone & laptop, group insurances plans, and a travel allowance. So, you do not have to worry about a thing!Never stop learning - We want to be the best in what we do and therefore we provide training, certifications and learning opportunities for every employee so you continuously enrich your skills.Transparency - Communication is key! So, we organize company and team meetings on a regular base, so everyone is informed properly.Do what you love - Enjoy flexibility with 2 days a week working from home and 3 days a week working with your team in our state of the art, brand new offices with parking, a variety of events, sport at work and lots of activities. We spend more time at work then we do at home, that is why it is important that everyone feels at home. And we make sure you do!Snack to your heart's desire - At Orange Cyberdefense we keep it healthy. So, you can enjoy an assortment of fresh fruit and healthy snacks. For those with an occasionally sugar dip, there are sweet snacks available.Reputable brand - You will join an internationally, growing company with over 25 years’ experience in the industry. This makes us experts in what we do. We have an international presence and yet local teams to assist our customers.The good life ...An assessment and screening are part of our process.🔥 Are you interested? Then jump in!Orange Cyberdefense are equal opportunities employer, welcoming applications from all people, regardless of their race, sex, disability, age, religion, or sexual orientation.

title: Data-analist
description: Vacature HR IT Data AnalistWie zijn wij?Consultday: HR Tech, made Easy. Consultday bestaat sinds 2016 en helpt organisaties hun HR afdeling en HR beleid te transformeren met behulp van HR Technologie.Onze werkwijze is gebaseerd op de inzet van onze inhoudelijke expertise volgens een realistische aanpak, waarbij transparantie en heldere communicatie essentieel zijn in het traject.Onze klantenkring wordt steeds groter en diverser, waardoor we ook veel nieuwe projecten mogen opstarten. Dus… we moeten onze organisatie uitbreiden met meer collega’s.In het kader hiervan zoeken wij een HR Data Analist die mooie en interessante opdrachten wilt uitvoeren en verder onderdeel wilt zijn van onze top Consultday team.Wat ga je doen?Door de opkomst van HR Cloud, krapte op de arbeidsmarkt, globalisering en nog vele andere maatschappelijke factoren is de Transformatie van HR essentieel voor organisaties.Als HR Data Analist ga je een actieve rol spelen in zowel nationale als internationale projecten op het snijvlak van HR en IT. Je gaat helpen met het oplossen van HR-vraagstukken en bijdragen aan de implementatie van nieuwe HR (Tech) oplossingen. Dit alles om te komen tot de optimale inrichting van de HR-functie en de beste passende toepassing van HR Technologieën. Afhankelijk van jouw kwaliteiten, ervaring en ambities kan je denken aan rollen op het gebied van:• Dashboarding & reporting• Data conversie• Reconciliatie & audit• Applicatieontwikkeling• Ontwikkeling HR toolingSamen stippelen we de route uit die het beste bij jou past en voor onze klant.Hoe werken wij?Samenwerking is essentieel in het HR Tech ecosysteem waar wij deel van uitmaken. Ook verandert werk, de behoefte van medewerkers en werkgeverschap. Daarom hebben wij gekozen voor een samenwerkingsvorm die wij community-based working noemen. Daarbij is de onderliggende contractvorm niet bepalend om onderdeel te zijn van Consultday. Consultday bestaat uit een combinatie van eigen medewerkers, midlancers en exclusief verbonden freelancers. Elke vorm heeft zijn eigen arbeidsvoorwaardelijke voordelen en het gaat er om wat het beste bij jou als persoon past!Wie zoeken we?Je bent resultaatgericht, ambitieus en je houdt van een dynamische werkomgeving. Verder heb je sterke analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden. Je kunt complexe vraagstukken snel analyseren en bent creatief waardoor je tot een scherpe oplossing komt. Je bent op de hoogte van de laatste technologische ontwikkelingen op het gebied van HR en IT.Het HR-werkveld is voor jou gesneden koek, en je deelt graag jouw kennis met collega’s en klanten.Wat je nog meer met je meebrengt:• WO / HBO werk- en denkniveau en je beschikt over minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring. Hierbij heeft ervaring als consultant onze voorkeur;• Kennis van BI Tooling als PowerBI, Azure, Tableau en ClikView, bij voorkeur in relatie tot HR vraagstukken. Kennis en ervaring met andere BI toolings is ook van harte welkom;• Je bent een teamspeler en kan tegelijk zelfstandig opereren binnen een project of een afdeling en hierin optreden als kennishouder op het brede vlak van HR-data;• Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden;• Genereren van ideeën, identificeren en uitwerken van nieuwe oplossingen;• Je hebt gevoel voor organisaties, sociale verhoudingen en culturele verschillen. Je voelt je snel thuis in een nieuwe werkomgeving;• Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse EN Engelse taal.Wat kunnen wij bieden?Wij bieden jou een dynamische en innovatieve omgeving waarin je bij gaat dragen aan de toekomst van HR bij aansprekende opdrachtgevers. Daarnaast bieden wij zeer goede arbeidsvoorwaarden en opleidingsmogelijkheden, afgestemd op jouw individuele behoeften. Samen met getalenteerde en ervaren collega’s dagen we je uit, word je ondersteund, werken wij hard en doen we gave dingen. Waarbij natuurlijk veel wordt gelachen! Sporten vinden we ook leuk en doen regelmatig mee met allerlei sport evenementen… voetballen, viking run, padellen, etc. Samen vormen wij het DNA en de toekomst van Consultday.Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Abdoel Montacir via abdoel@consultday.nl of stuur een DM via LinkedIn. Ben je overtuigd? Stuur dan je CV naar Abdoel Montacir of solliciteer direct via LinkedIn!

title: Data Intelligence Analyst
description: Data Intelligence Analyst | Water Sustainability | Rotterdam| €70,000Water scarcity is a real social problem faced with many countries world-wide. Access to clean & fresh drinking water is a luxury to those who do not have this benefit. Are you an individual who is passionate about this? Would you like to work for a non-profit organisation who is working to make water drinkable and accessible globally? In this job, what you do makes a difference and has a global impact. We need someone who has this drive and is a Data specialist to make a positive impact.About you:Dutch speaking (Professional/native)Data modelling & analytics expertAzure cloud experienceDevOps experience (nice to have)PowerBIConsultancy experienceDaxYour perksSalary based on your experience31 days holidayPensionHybrid & Flexible workingFitness benefitsHow do I apply?If this is the next challenge you would like to embark on, click apply now.We are interviewing throughout this week, secure your chance promptly.If you would like to know more or have any questions feel free to reach out to me:Drop me an email: Mousumi.Choudhury@opusrs.comAlternatively, if you prefer a chat call me on 02074487258Business Intelligence Analyst | Water Sustainability | Rotterdam| €70,000

title: Data Analyst
description: Do you want to be part of the grocery revolution? At Picnic you get the chance to join a young and forward-thinking startup culture, where everything you do matters. With a data-driven approach and an incredible service, Picnic strives to make grocery shopping simple, fun, and affordable for everyone. Known for our just-in-time supply-chain and a unique last-mile delivery strategy, we have become one of the fastest-growing companies of the Netherlands.🏢 Where you fit inPicnic is data-driven and complex – from pricing strategies, forecasting, warehouse automation, to the ever-expanding growth of our company, we are constantly faced with new challenges and opportunities…that’s where you come in!We are on the hunt for graduates who are looking for their next full-time opportunity and can present their understanding of what drives consumer behavior and operational efficiency. As a Graduate Data Analyst, you’ll glean actionable insights from large data sets - but your eyes won’t be glued to data all day! You also offer entrepreneurial, realistic, and practical business opportunities.Have a forward-thinking idea? Tell your team, modify it, evaluate, experiment, and then make a real impact in our company!🔥 What Challenges Await YouDrive implementation and improvement of projects from kick-off until the final whistleDesign, implement and evaluate numerous experimentsOptimize tools, systems and business processes for greater business impactRelentless focus on creating habit-forming product ideas.🔍 Who you areYou combine first-class analytical skills with a creative and problem-solving mindset. You don’t only see numbers in data sets, but you see opportunities.As an innovative thinker you constantly generate your own ideas. You’re also ambitious – you come up with smart solutions, not easy ones.Superior presentation and communication skills allow you to convert complexity into digestible information for your team. You are confident and take ownership of your projects, but also collaborate with and motivate your colleagues!RequirementsYou have a Master’s degree in Engineering, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or an equivalent quantitative studyYou have 0-3 years of internships or work experience in fast paced environments, start-up, scale up or business consultingYou have excellent Excel and data analysis skills; Ideally knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and Python Your communication skills allow you to convert abstract plans into digestible information in English🍩 Picnic perksIn our modern Amsterdam office, you will have the freedom to experiment and evolve your own projects as well as the chance to test them on real customers. You will be part of an international team of ground-breaking entrepreneurs, brilliant engineers, and data wizards that work with desire and dedication each day.We offer you training in both professional basics, such as 'presenting with confidence' and 'impactful feedback', and hard skill workshops, such as a SQL and Python training. We also offer Dutch language classes for our international colleagues.Are you looking for an experience abroad? We also offer you the opportunity to join our office in Düsseldorf.-Please submit your application in English-

title: Analytics Engineer (L5) - Globalization
description: At Netflix, our mission is to entertain the world by connecting our members to an extensive library of stories from all over the globe. We are revolutionizing international storytelling as we deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to 200+ million members across 190+ countries in 30+ languages.The Globalization Data Science and Engineering team is at the forefront of removing language barriers and providing a stellar member experience to all our members regardless of their language preferences. We are responsible for the translation and cultural adaptation of all aspects of member interaction, including beautiful localized user interfaces, subtitles, and dubbing of award-winning Netflix originals.EMEA is a significant center for our broader Studio and Creative Production teams. We are looking for an experienced Analytics Engineer based in our Amsterdam office to join our growing EMEA team. In this role, you will design and develop analytic tools and systems to create more member value via localization expansion and optimization. You will partner with a talented cross-functional team of engineers, scientists, product managers and domain experts to shape localization strategy and deliver business impact.ResponsibilitiesAct as strategic partner for stakeholders and cross-functional collaborators to identify business opportunities and enhance business strategies with automated data solutionsDrive the direction and execution of your work, which span from developing scrappy analytic tools to designing scalable analytic systemsPartner closely with other engineers and scientists to improve foundational data models and accelerate productization of data insightsShare your innovation and collaborate with the broader community to strengthen analytics enablementBecome a regional expert on Globalization Data Science and Engineering, helping educate and connect with regional officesAbout YouProven track record of designing and developing scalable analytic tools and systemsHigh proficiency in standard tech stack (e.g., Python, SQL, Spark) and common data visualization tools (e.g., Streamlit, Tableau)Familiar with fundamentals of Machine Learning and Statistical Inference as well as data engineering best practices5+ years of relevant experiences with building data products powered by big dataExceptional communication and collaboration skills coupled with strong business acumenComfortable with ambiguity; able to take ownership, and thrive with minimal oversight and processNetflix culture resonates with youNetflix cultureNetflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Analytics Engineer, Strategy and Competitive Intelligence
description: Brief info about VintedVinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.Information about the positionAs a Competitive Intelligence Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, executing, and maintaining our competitive intelligence data processing and insight creation, gaining insights into the market landscape, growth and developments. You’ll be fueling our strategy with up to date market intelligence. This is a role that requires a strong understanding of data processing and data quality management, and we are looking for someone with an independent mindset, able to collaborate across functions and teams.Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithmsIn this position, you’llArchitect, build, and maintain automated scripts and data workflows to process web data into strategic insights. Monitor data pipelines, identify anomalies, and troubleshoot data quality issues in a timely manner with different internal and external stakeholders. Conduct root cause analysis to identify the source of data issues and work towards long-term solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Science, Engineering, and Strategy, to understand data needs and insights to be delivered, as well as managing external data providersPerform analysis to enrich the data with strategically relevant insights, creating data visualizations and reports to effectively communicate data quality insights to stakeholders, performing root cause analysis in case of issues in production processesDesign and maintain data quality metrics and KPIs, providing insights into data accuracy and completeness. Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that may impact data quality. Ensuring that you and other end-users are able to optimally use the data models - drive optimization, documentation, training, and monitoring of best practicesAlso, we work with Looker to disclose our data to the teams, experience in Looker is a nice-to-have. Proactively identify and drive opportunities to make Data Science and Analytics within Vinted even more impactfulAbout YouProven experience: typically 2+ years (of working experience or alternative activities resulting in a similar level of proficiency) with data collection and monitoring as an Analytics Engineer, Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer or equivalentFluent in SQL and Python. Working experience in a programing language like Java, Scala or similarExperience with DBT (data build tool) and Google Cloud Platform (incl. BigQuery) are an advantageExperience developing and maintaining data processing systems at scale and being able to make architectural decisions taking into account aspects like scalability, efficiency and reliability. Experience with data modeling. Excellent attention to detail. We are looking for someone who understands the value of documentation and clean, tidy codeIndependent working, capable of setting up, running and maintaining data processes without much supportStrong communication & collaboration skills - able to build and maintain multi-functional relationships with various teams across the business as well as translate business needs into technical solutionsExcellent at communicating in spoken and written EnglishAdvantage: Interest and experience in competitive intelligence Work perksThe opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 days of paid annual leaveNewest MacBook modelsMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appFrequent team-building eventsHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furnitureA daily lunch allowanceClassPass (Gym Membership subsidy)Frequent team-building eventsPension plan with total contribution of 12%, 8% by the Company and 4% by employeeA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedAn NS mobility cardThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly officeWorking at VintedIndividual Learning BudgetVinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.Hybrid WorkWe’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.Equal OpportunityThe Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.The salary range for this position is € 47,900 - € 64,860 gross per year.

title: Data Engineer BI
description: Nice to know (you)Het doel van Data & Analytics is om bij te dragen aan het beschikbaar en betrouwbaar maken van data door de hele Schiphol organisatie. We gaan ervoor: het creëren van de meest duurzame en hoogwaardige luchthavens ter wereld. Je werkt nauw samen met het multidisciplinaire team bestaande uit onder andere: Developers, Business Analisten en Product Owners. Connecting your worldIn deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van verschillende datawarehouses/lakehouses voor de verschillende domeinen binnen Schiphol. Zo verbind jij Nederland met de rest van de wereld. Hoe jij hierbinnen resultaten behaalt? Dat is aan jou. Bij de Schiphol Group vertrouwen we op jouw talenten zoals de manier waarop jij heel precies te werk gaat. Jouw talenten zet je als Data Engineer BI om naar actie om de volgende doelen te bereiken:Bijdragen aan het beschikbaar en betrouwbaar maken van data door de hele Schiphol organisatie. De architectuur verbeteren door het implementeren van nieuwe backend toepassingen. Het beschikbaarheidsniveau van alle data hoog houden. Dat kan variëren van data over bagage, retail, vluchten, passagiersstromen, etc. About Schiphol GroupMet 3.000 trotse collega’s zetten we een extra stap om Nederland zo goed mogelijk te verbinden met de rest van de wereld. Vernieuwen, veiligheid en samenwerken staan daarbij voorop. Samen geven we meer betekenis aan reizen en leveren een bijdrage aan economie en maatschappij. Al meer dan 100 jaar. In Nederland en daarbuiten. Wist je trouwens dat:… Schiphol Group eigenaar en exploitant is van Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport en Lelystad Airport? We hebben ook een meerderheidsbelang in Eindhoven Airport. … er op Schiphol in 2021 266.967 vliegtuigbewegingen waren?… je als Data Engineer BI de business area IT & Data versterkt?About The TeamDe IT & Data-organisatie bouwt het vliegveld van de toekomst. Dit doen we met slimme digitale oplossingen, tools en applicaties. Met de nieuwste technologie houden we het vliegveld draaiend. Ons fanatieke team werkt aan data-driven verbeteringen van onze processen, reizigersstromen en informatievoorziening. Zo helpen we mee aan de best mogelijke beleving. Voor reizigers, klanten en medewerkers. Op én rond het vliegveld.You've got thisVoor deze functie kan je hoofd- en bijzaken van elkaar onderscheiden en verbanden leggen. Ook kun je geconcentreerd en met aandacht werken. Verder heb je:Tussen 2 en 5 jaar ervaring als Data Engineer binnen het DWH domein en Dimensioneel en Data Modelleren. Aantoonbare ervaring binnen Microsoft Azure. Aantoonbare ervaring met SQL/ETL. Aantoonbare ervaring met Azure Data Factory/Azure Synapse. Ervaring met Agile werken. You get thisOp basis van meegebrachte kennis en ervaring wordt een inschatting gemaakt t.a.v. niveau schaal 12 (medior) of 13 (senior)14,4 diversiteitsuren. Die uren kan je gebruiken om op een feestdag naar keuze (extra) vrij te zijn. Deelname aan het pensioenfonds ABP. 180 vakantieuren. Een NS-Business Card die reizen met openbaar vervoer van en naar het werk helemaal vergoedt. Dit zijn nog maar een aantal van onze arbeidsvoorwaarden die horen bij deze functie (op basis van een 36-urige werkweek). Schiphol Group heeft jou nog meer te bieden. Ga voor het totale overzicht van alle arbeidsvoorwaarden naar Arbeidsvoorwaarden van Schiphol | Schiphol (werkenbijschiphol.nl).Choose your destinationWat zijn jouw talenten? Welke dromen heb jij? Wat is jouw verhaal? We zijn benieuwd naar jou en nodigen je graag uit om te solliciteren. Solliciteren kan door jouw motivatie en cv met ons te delen via de sollicitatiebutton hieronder.Jouw sollicitatie naar deze functie van Data Engineer BI ontvangen we graag vóór 31 oktober. Heb je vragen over het sollicitatieproces? Stel deze aan Mark Blesma, recruiter via mark.blesma@schiphol.nl. Voor meer informatie over solliciteren bij Schiphol Group: www.werkenbijschiphol/procedure. Voor de veiligheid van onze reizigers en collega’s maakt een AIVD-veiligheidsonderzoek (VGB B-Burgerluchtvaart) altijd deel uit van het proces.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: Wat je gaat doenIn deze rol werk je nauw samen met het hele data team en de rest van de organisatie. Binnen het data team werk je samen met Data Engineering, Data analisten en Data Scientists om te zorgen dat wij data zo effectief mogelijk in kunnen zetten. Voor de verschillende afdelingen binnen onze organisatie ontwikkel je de belangrijkste data modellen en data producten voor ieder domein, samen met data analysten en engineers.Je zorgt dat ons data platform best in class is op gebied van data kwaliteit en bepaalt, samen met het team, standaarden & implementeert best practices.Tot slot werk je aan educatie, je deelt in de organisatie deze standaarden en zorgt dat anderen hier efficiënt mee kunnen werken.In deze functie krijg je de mogelijkheid om analytics engineering binnen onze organisatie te ontwikkelen en jezelf te ontwikkelen als analytics engineer.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: About us; iconic brand, tiny companyPolaroid was founded in 1937 by one of the most seminal innovators of the 20th century, Edwin Land. His motto was, “don't undertake a project unless it is manifestly important and nearly impossible.” In 2008, Polaroid shuttered its last factory, but a group of diehard fans came together as The Impossible Project to save instant film. Over 10 years later that start-up acquired what was left of Polaroid and today we’re again a small group of people passionate about empowering creators to change the world in the name of Polaroid.What we are building; tools for creatorsThroughout its 80-year history, Polaroid was at its best when we made tools for people to express themselves, push boundaries and move culture forward. In the next decade, we are getting back to this purpose. We're not solving small problems, and we're not addressing a small market; our goal is to make products that will make the world more meaningful and human.The roleWe are seeking a detail-oriented and technically skilled individual to lead our digital analytics implementation and manage our customer data platform (CDP) initiatives. This dual role requires expertise in setting up, maintaining, and troubleshooting web analytics tracking systems, along with engineering and integrating customer data platforms.Responsibilities:1. Implement, manage, and troubleshoot web analytics tracking systems using tools like Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.2. Collaborate with various teams to understand their tracking and data needs, ensuring accurate and effective implementation.3. Test, validate, and debug tracking setups to ensure data accuracy and integrity.4. Identify and resolve tracking, data integrity, and CDP-related issues.5. Design, deploy, and manage CDP systems to centralize customer data, ensuring it's accessible and actionable for marketing initiatives.6. Assist in setting up and maintaining Google Analytics accounts, views, properties, Google Tag Manager containers, tags, and CDP integrations.7. Create and maintain technical documentation related to web analytics tracking implementation and CDP processes.8. Assist in data analysis, report generation, and offer insights from both web analytics and CDP data.9. Train team members on tracking tool setup, CDP usage, and best practices.10. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.Requirements:1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field plus 3 years commercial experience2. Proven experience in implementing and maintaining web analytics tracking systems and CDP platforms.3. Strong understanding of digital marketing, web analytics, and customer data management.4. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, and relevant CDP technologies.5. Familiarity with data layer concepts, structures, and data integration methodologies.6. Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail.7. Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Preferred:1. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and major CDP platform certifications.2. Experience with other tag management systems, web analytics tools, and CDP integrations.3. Knowledge of SEO, SEM strategies, and data privacy regulations.If you apply for a position at Polaroid, we will process your personal data. Please see our Job Applicant Privacy Policy for more information about how we handle personal data of job applicants. https://www.polaroid.com/privacy-policy

title: Analytics Engineer - Partner Analytics
description: How do you make our customers happy? At bol.com, we are dedicated to making daily life more convenient for our customers. We do that via our own retailer as well as via the 51.000+ selling partners. As Analytics Engineer, you build the data analytics foundation for the partner business of bol.com. That takes more than analytical and engineering skills; it also requires you to be a team player and understand a platform business. Right up your alley? Welcome aboard! The biggest challenge Bol.com excels at data-driven decision making. Analytics teams support product & business teams in providing direction, setting up experiments and monitoring processes. With state-of-the-art tools, processing power and high-quality data sources we transform Terabytes of data on a daily basis. The challenge we are facing is; how do we make sure all these data transformations are of high quality?The Analytics Engineer curates the data so that data analysts in teams can do their work more effectively. Analytics engineers improve data quality by bringing the rigor of software engineering to our analytics code while, at the same time, bringing a deep business understanding into the data transformation process.What You Do As Analytics EngineerAs Analytics Engineer, you’ll land in a central data & analytics team which is on a mission to make sure all decisions across our partner business teams are data-driven (>100 colleagues). Your team (~10 colleagues) focuses on several mission-critical topics such as building an integral view on our partners using different data sources, monitoring the quality of our partners, understanding and targeting our valuable partners at the right time and experimenting with new business solutions.You will support your colleagues in the analytics team to create high quality data pipelines. Clean Code principles such as test-driven development, meaningful names, small functions, DRY, are what you practise and preach. You ensure data transformations are tested, documented, monitored, logged, performant and adhere to our security & privacy policies. Next to that, you will be involved in some data heavy projects like developing and maintaining some of the bol.com KPIs. You use tools and concepts like; Git, CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, Python, SQL, Airflow, dbt , data testing, monitoring and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards. You develop, monitor and safeguard the partner business KPIs, and consult with colleague Data Analysts. You use your strong communication skills to train and support your colleague Data Analysts in the ways of the Analytics Engineer through pair-programming and workshops. You’re an ambassador for our analytics platform and help colleagues take a more data-driven approach, for example, by modelling and creating highly valuable datasets. Why you can make the difference Because you’re an enthusiastic team player who lives and breathes software engineering & analytics. You combine solid technical skills with the ability to translate abstract problems into specific code improvements. You enjoy discussing insights with colleagues and are open to feedback. You inspire your team to reframe challenges as opportunities.3 reasons why this is (not) for you - Passive You have a hard time forming and expressing your opinion. Your contribution in meetings is generally limited to shaking your head and nodding - Output over outcome Your work ends when you complete a feature – who cares how users experience it - Conservative You're not curious to new techniques and methods and rely on one-trick-pony power #safetyfirst + High quality code & data You have a background in software engineering and a deep interest in analytics (>2 years experience) + SQL, dbt, Git & Python SQL, dbt, Git & Python are your home away from home + Sharing is caring You like to share your knowledge and experiences with others It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: Job TitleAnalytics EngineerJob DescriptionNote For candidates residing in India, the work location will be Pune and for candidates residing in the Netherlands the work location will be Veghel.Are you a data enthusiast, passionate about converting raw information into valuable and actionable insights? Do you thrive on collaborating with technical and business stakeholders to shape the future of data-driven solutions? If your answer to these questions is “yes”, then look no further than Vanderlande!We’ll give you the opportunity toWork in a highly motivated, global team of Data & Analytics enthusiasts.Play a crucial role in advancing the maturity of the Data Platform, contributing to delivery of analytical products and services offered by our department to the Vanderlande organization.Work within a cloud based architecture based on Data Mesh principleYour ResponsibilitiesAs an Analytics Engineer at Vanderlande you'll be at the forefront of driving data-driven solutions and shaping the future of our organization by working on the data platform. Your key responsibilities will involve translating business needs into functional requirements, designing and developing data products, pipelines, and reports, and analyzing data to solve use cases resulting in optimized business processes and fact-based decision-making.As being part of a cross functional full-stack team, together with your colleagues you are responsible for the creation and delivery of an end-to-end solution to our business stakeholders. In this role, you are a tech-savvy, action-oriented, and collaborative colleague who can wear multiple hats - part Data Engineer, - part Data Analyst and even though you have an area of expertise, you can fulfil each of those roles up to a certain point.On a day-to-day basis, you will focus on creating and maintaining data products, data pipelines using Python, PySpark and SQL, and dashboards using tools like Qlik, or Power BI. Working in an Agile environment, proactively contributes to scrum events ensuring seamless coordination with the team and swift adaptability to changing priorities. They thrive in a fast-paced, iterative development environment, where constant feedback and continuous improvement are key.In this role, youTranslate business needs into functional requirements providing essential information on business use cases.Translate functional requirements into thorough and feasible data products, analytics solutions and dynamic dashboards;Utilize Python, PySpark, SQL, or R for data retrieval and manipulation.Develop, test, and maintain data products, pipelines by the use of the Azure stack and Databricks, ensuring data reliability and quality.Design and implement architectures for efficient data extraction and transformation.Work on creating and maintaining landing zones in the data platform.Actively participate in and contribute to Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) practices, ensuring smooth and efficient development and deployment processes within the data platformIntegrate data pipelines and reports into testing frameworks, allowing for rigorous performance testing and validation to ensure seamless performance.Monitor and maintain data pipeline stability, offering support when required.Analyze, interpret, and visualize data to drive business process optimization and fact-based decision-making.Create, deploy, and maintain interactive dashboards and visualizations using Qlik or Power BI.Perform a comprehensive analysis and proactively implement solutions to assess and enhance data quality and data reliability.Actively participate in delivery execution on the Data PlatformYou are eager to improve yourself and strive for continuous enhancement of processes and development within the data platform.Stay updated with the latest developments in the analytics field and share knowledge with the team.Your departmentThe Central Data & Analytics department is tasked with extending, operating and further maturing the data platform of Vanderlande. We provide Data & Analytics related products and services to Vanderlande, primarily catering to internal customers, but supporting our digital service portfolio. Following a hub & spoke model, we establish centralized standards that are then adopted and implemented by decentralized teams within the business.At the heart of our efforts lies the Data Platform, the core product we are diligently enhancing. This Azure cloud enabled platform based on the Data Mesh principle empowers us to deliver valuable Data Products by transforming, processing, combining, and enriching data from various source systems, ultimately creating a reliable source of truth for our customers. To enable efficient data analysis and visualization, we actively govern, and maintain the Vanderlande Qlik Servers and Power BI Premium capacity. In addition, we provide templates, establish a clear workflow, and foster a community of experts.Our work centers around our Federated Governance model, with the Central Data & Analytics Organization as the hub serving the spokes. Our scope encompasses Data Governance, Platform Operations, Core Platform Development, and Full stack Development. The technologies we use span across the Azure stack and Databricks ecosystem, ensuring seamless integration and optimal utilization of resources.By utilizing advanced analytics techniques and the latest technology, our focus on innovation empowers us to continuously improve and innovate the Data Platform.Operating as a scaled Agile organization, we embrace the SAFe Agile framework and work collaboratively across different teams, all united by a common backlog and shared roadmap. This approach allows us to be highly adaptable, continuously adjusting to the evolving strategic needs of stakeholders within Vanderlande.Your Qualifications And SkillsIf you’re an experienced, enthusiastic and versatile Analytics Engineer, you will bringMinimum bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).0-3 years of prior experience working as an Analytics Engineer or in a similar role .Ability to work effectively as part of a cross-functional international full stack team, collaborating with other developers, and stakeholders.Practical experience in writing code in Python, PySpark, SQL, or R for data retrieval and manipulation is a strong preference.Demonstrated experience and proficiency in working with Azure Stack and Databricks is required for this role.Proficiency or interest in using DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration, continuous delivery (CI/CD), and automated deployment of data products and data pipelinesStrong communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Enthusiastic, proactive, driven, and actively seeking opportunities for personal development and growth.Demonstrated curiosity and commitment to staying updated with the latest trends, tools, and best practices in the data & analytics field.Familiar with agile methodologies and thrives in its dynamic and collaborative environment.Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or Qlik is plus.What We OfferPlease note working conditions differ per country. The conditions in this vacancy are applicable to the Netherlands.In this challenging and responsible position, you will have the chance to make a significant contribution to industry-leading projects and be connected to our dedicated people and customers. We offer a position in an informal, international and professional working environment with a lot of opportunities for personal development. By joining our profitable and growing company you will be able to reach your goals and focus on your future.On top of your fixed salary, you will receive the following secondary benefits40 vacation days (20 statutory days and a flexible budget worth 20 days).Flexible working hours.A hybrid workplace (40% working from home and 60% in the office).Commuting allowance, including full reimbursement of travel by public transport.Working from home allowance.Collective pension scheme and discount on health insurance.On-site company health centers with a gym, physiotherapists and occupational therapists.Vanderlande Academy and training facilities to boost your skills.A variety in Vanderlande Network communities and initiatives.And a great company restaurant and coffee bar with barista.Our CompanyVanderlande is the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports – from London Heathrow to Singapore Changi – and in the parcel market, for main players such as UPS and FedEx. Furthermore, we are also a leading supplier of solutions for warehousing giants, such as Walmart, which seamlessly integrate innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services.If you aspire to a position of responsibility – and want to make a difference by facilitating the delivery of what matters most to consumers, passengers and businesses – then the next step on your path to global opportunities is to join Vanderlande. As part of our network and unique culture of freedom and flexibility, you will be connected to our dedicated people, build strong relationships and rise to the challenge of industry-leading projects.You will grow, take ownership and make every day better as you continue on the road to success with your spirit of adventure – and fulfil your ambitions for personal development through our Academy. Vanderlande will give you the necessary knowledge, tools and support, so that together we have the confidence and ability to exceed our customers’ expectations in over 100 countries.To achieve our collective goals, you will have a hands-on role working in a positive environment to deliver tangible, state-of-the-art products and improve the competitiveness of our highly visible customers. As an integral part of our team, you will have the enthusiasm and be driven to reach our destination before your next journey with Vanderlande begins…Your applicationIf the role of Analytics Engineer appeals to you, then please apply now by completing the application form, and uploading your CV and covering letter.

title: BI Engineer Industrial Automation
description: In het kortData intelligence, business intelligence en data science & analytics zijn niet meer weg te denken uit onze huidige samenleving. Door voortschrijdende technologie neemt de stroom van waardevolle data – en daarmee de mogelijkheden voor slim gebruik van data binnen organisaties – in hoog tempo toe. Als BI Engineer Industrial Automation zie je het als een uitdaging om stapsgewijs de datastroom te structureren en de behoefte van onze klanten te vertalen naar intelligente oplossingen. In deze functie ben je primair verantwoordelijk voor het opbouwen van rapportage mogelijkheden met behulp van data visualisatietools en dataplatformen (Bijv. Power BI, Tableau, Inmation, AVEVA Datahub), en de resultaten weergeven in gemakkelijk te begrijpen, interactieve dashboards. Je ontwikkelt ad-hoc query’s,rapportages en dashboards op basis van requirements. Met de resultaten ga je data-analyse gebruiken om samen met de key-users van de klant prestaties te meten, hypothesen te testen, inzichten te ontwikkelen en aanbevelingen te doenDit vind je leuk om te doenOphalen, uitwerken en ontwikkelen van vereisten voor KPI-rapportage en -analyse;Schrijven en onderhouden van ETL-processen voor het extraheren en voorbereiden van data;Creatieve en praktische oplossingen toepassen om rapportageactiviteiten te automatiseren;Effectief communiceren met alle niveaus van interne en externe stakeholders;Verzamel de benodigde data, koppel ze en visualiseer ze.Hier herken je jezelf inMinimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie;Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van query’s en nieuwe rapportages;Bekend met Power BI, Tableau of Plantweb Optics, AVEVA Datahub;Kennis van datamodellering & -transformatie;Sterke communicatievaardigheden;Kennis van Asset Administration Shell, AutomationML is een pre;Ervaring binnen het industriële werkveld is een pre;Certificering als Certified Data Professional (iccp) is een pre.Wie zijn wij?Als ervaren leverancier van oplossingen voor industriële technologie wil ICT Netherlands de wereld elke dag een stap slimmer maken. Onze toegewijde technische professionals voorzien klanten van diensten op het gebied van consultancy, softwareontwikkeling, projectmatige oplossingen en managed services.Wat bieden wij?13e maand: elk jaar een extra maandsalaris;29 vakantiedagen: met de vrijheid om dagen toe te voegen of te verkopen;Hybride werkwijze: een goede balans tussen thuis en kantoor;Pensioenregeling: een goede regeling voor uw oude dag;Leaseauto: of een vergoeding voor uw eigen auto;Onkostenvergoeding: een netto bijdrage in de werkkosten;Training: houd je kennis op peil in onze ICT Academy;Boekbudget: koop een boek of hard- of software voor jezelf.Heb je interesse in deze vacature, neem dan contact met op met Esther Blok via esther.blok@ict.nl of 088-9082000. Wij maken alvast een bureau voor je vrij!

title: Data Visualization Engineer
description: Optiver are looking for a skilled Data Visualization Engineer to design, develop and implement solutions for our trading teams in Amsterdam and globally. The successful Engineer will bring a strong technical capability as well as an approach that will enable them to integrate with our high-paced trading teams, collaborate with trading stakeholders to formulate requirements and create innovative visualizations and tooling on the trading floor.WHO WE ARE:Our Amsterdam office is where it all began. Over 35 years ago, Optiver’s business started with a single trader on the floor of Amsterdam’s European Stock Exchange. Since our 1986 founding, Optiver’s Amsterdam office has grown into one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. Our culture reflects the Dutch capital city’s progressive, innovative and inclusive nature. With its unique spirit, Amsterdam is the ideal hub for our teams to trade a wide range of products from listed derivatives to cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign exchange.WHAT YOU’LL DO:You will work on creating and maintaining data visualizations and UI applications that are used by traders to form trading decisions and to interact with other Optiver systems.The goal of the team is to provide users with highly responsive, flexible and reliable tools that can be used to monitor the state of global financial markets and to control our internal strategies. The impact of the work you will do spans across multiple different teams and levels of the organization. Apart from creating user interfaces and their backends, the UX team also owns and develops internal frameworks and standards describing how to create user interfaces within the company.As a Data Visualization Engineer you can expect to:Create web based data visualizationsWork closely with traders, developers and other stakeholders to discover requirements and design solutionsDesign and build data processing pipelines used during data pre-processing stagesContribute to the UI framework and ecosystem used across multiple teams within the companyBe involved in a very short feedback loop and see your products having actual impact on daily work of their usersWork on data and UI optimization problemsHelp members of other teams create and optimize data visualizationsWHO YOU ARE:Trading applications need to be reliable and robust, therefore we look for developers with a strong engineering mindset that can work in a highly dynamic environment while creating simple and solid solutions. Those solutions must integrate well with the broad ecosystem of Optiver data sources and backend services.In terms of skills and qualifications we're looking for:A degree in computer science or a related fieldStrong knowledge of PythonExperience with creating data visualizations and user interfacesExperience with creating web applications and working with distributed systemsFamiliarity with one or more of the following technologies: Plotly Dash, Bokeh, React.js, SQL, C++, JavaScript, HTML/CSSStrong communication skillsProblem solving mindsetEagerness to learn(including financial and trading knowledge)ProactivenessWHAT YOU’LL GET: The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 different countries.Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 paid vacation days, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary.HOW TO APPLY:If you’re interested in taking your career to one of the most exciting trading floors in Europe, please apply via the form below. While we love how bilingual our teams are, be sure to write your CV and motivation letter in English. We’re eager to learn all about your background and interests, which means applications lacking a motivation letter sadly will not be reviewed. But if we think you could be a good fit, you’ll hear from us sooner than you might expect!More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy. In the event of questions, feel free to contact our Recruitment team at recruitment@optiver.com.Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role. DIVERSITY STATEMENT: As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued and respected, because we believe our best work is done together.Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

title: Data Engineer
description: Hungry for a challenge?That’s good, because at Just Eat Takeaway.com (JET) we have abundant opportunity or as we say, everything is on the table. We are a leading global online food delivery marketplace. Our tech ecosystem connects millions of active customers with hundreds of thousands of connected partners in countries across the globe.Our mission? To empower every food moment around the world, whether it’s through customer service, coding or couriers.Job OverviewAs a Mid-Level Data Engineer at Just Eat Takeaway.com, you will be instrumental in advancing our data-driven initiatives. In this role, you'll focus on optimizing our hub and spoke data architecture, ensuring efficient data management and contributing significantly to our e-commerce success. You will play a key role in enhancing our data processes and infrastructure, directly impacting decision-making and customer satisfaction.Key ResponsibilitiesDesign, build, and maintain efficient data pipelines and ETL processes in alignment with our hub and spoke data architecture.Maintain high standards of data quality and integrity, resolving data-related issues.Collaborate with various teams to identify and fulfill their data requirements.Develop and maintain robust data models, metadata, and comprehensive documentation.Continuously explore new data technologies and tools to improve our data infrastructure.Mentor junior data engineering staff and foster a culture of knowledge sharing.QualificationsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.At least 2 years of experience in data engineering, preferably within an e-commerce environment.Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases.Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or Java.Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark).Expertise in data modeling, warehousing, and ETL processes.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.Excellent communication skills and a collaborative approach.At JET, This Is On The MenuOur teams forge connections internally and work with some of the best-known brands on the planet, giving us truly international impact in a dynamic environment.Fun, fast-paced and supportive, the JET culture is about movement, growth and about celebrating every aspect of our JETers. Thanks to them we stay one step ahead of the competition.Inclusion, Diversity & BelongingNo matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colorful selves to work every day.What else is cooking?Want to know more about our JETers, culture or company? Have a look at our career site where you can find people's stories, blogs, podcasts and more JET morsels.Are you ready to take your seat? Apply now!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: 【About Tencent】Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life of people around the world. Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen China, our guiding principle is to use technology for good. We are not only a major video game publisher in the world, we also produce other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe. We offer a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth.【About Level Infinite】 Level Infinite is a global gaming brand dedicated to delivering high-quality and engaging interactive entertainment experiences to a worldwide audience, wherever and however they choose to play. It operates from bases in Amsterdam and Singapore with staff around the world. To learn more about Level Infinite, visit www.levelinfinite.com, and follow on Twitter,Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.Responsibilities:1. Responsible for the development of the IEG Global advertising platform.2. Responsible for the design and implementation of the cloud data platform part of the advertising platform.3. Responsible for the technical support and technology exchange with game studios.Requirements:1.Bachelor degree or above, majoring in computer science, engineering or related fields.5+ years of working experience, 3+ years of data development experience.2.Experience in SQL and at least 2 programming languages: Python, Scala, Java, etc. and complies with coding standards and technical design.3.Deep understanding of big data tools: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Flink, etc.Experience in Spark, Flink or related application development.4.Ability to build cloud data platforms on common cloud platforms such as Azure, GCP, AWS, etc. 5.Excellent communication skills and good teamwork spirit . Active learning and love of sharing. Experience in open source project maintenance is preferred.[DEI Statement] Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Tencent: Diversity, equity and inclusion are important, interdependent components of our workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

title: Junior Data Engineer
