description: Wat je gaat doenAls Junior Data Engineer bij de Bijenkorf word je onderdeel van één van de grootste en meest data-geïnformeerderetail organisaties van Nederland. Jouw toekomstige team is verantwoordelijk voor de ontwikkeling en het beheer van het data platform van de Bijenkorf. Deze omgeving biedt ondersteuning aan alle door data gedreven beslissingen binnen de Bijenkorf organisatie. Jij zal meebouwen aan eenâ¯best in class-oplossing, die ervoor gaat zorgen dat de Bijenkorf de meest data-geïnformeerde e-tailer van Nederland wordt en blijft.Het Data Engineering team is verantwoordelijk voor het fundament van ons Data Platform op GCP.Dit houdt in:Het ontwikkelen van betrouwbare en schaalbare data pipelines (ETL/ELT in Python). Het definiëren van standaarden voor ons Data Platform. Het ontwikkelen van hoogwaardige data producten en tooling kijkend naar performance, code kwaliteit, data validatie en data governance. Het bouwen van dataproducten en -tooling volgens kwaliteitsprincipes zoals codekwaliteit, datavalidatie, data governance en vindbaarheid.Het delen van learnings en best practices met het data team. Samenwerken met interne teams rondom data vraagstukken. Spotten van kansen voor het verbeteren van ons data platform en deze implementeren. Er is veel ruimte om mee te beslissen binnen het domein van Data Engineering over standaarden, manier van werken en met welke technologieën. Je bent een sparringpartner voor Data Analisten, Data Scientist en andere stakeholders voor de beste aanpak voor diverse Data vraagstukken. Je werkt aan het data platform voor de gehele organisatie en werkt met een breed scala aan domeinen zoals o.a. supply chain, winkels, ecommerce, marketing/sales, klantdata ect.Je gaat werken met Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Composer/Apache Airflow), Python, Terraform

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: At Henkel, you can be a game changer and craft your career. Unleash your entrepreneurial spirit by bringing your ideas to life within a global team. Our leading brands and technologies, along with our high-performing businesses will provide you with countless opportunities to develop your skills and explore new paths. Your career at Henkel will contribute to a more sustainable future, while you grow within our vibrant, diverse culture of trust and belonging. If you're up for challenging the status quo, join our team of pioneers and make your mark on the future with us.Do you dare to make an impact? Your Role Act as lead analytics engineer designing & developing analytical solutions and datasets for end users. Data modeling experience in a way that empowers end users. Organize and transform data in a meaningful way and provide additional context so that it is ready for analysis. Design, develop and use tools, algorithms, and processes for data analysis and data visualization to generate reports to be used in decision making of end users. Write production-quality ELT code with an eye towards performance and maintainability. Live software engineering best practices (e.g., building testing suites and CI pipelines). Design, build, and enhance tools and techniques for our DataOps approach such as automatic code generation, automatic data validation and maintenance of development, test and production environments. As an Architect, be part of a team of data professionals in the Data & Analytics department, guide the team with your expertise and extend and deepen your knowledge by strong collaboration within the team. Actively participate in cross-functional teams using agile methods to deliver high quality data products at a fast pace. Ensure documentation related to datasets and analysis is maintained as well as ensure that everyone on the data team uses the same language and definitions. Collaborate with our platform team to discover opportunities to improve our systems, enterprises, and processes to have high-quality data. YOUR SKILLS Master’s degree in computer science, software engineering or a related subject. Minimum 5 years of working experience in cloud data ecosystems; covering data ingestion, data modeling, and data provisioning to consumers and downstream systems. Experience in ETL/ELT design, data and interface specifications, quality assurance and testing methods. Experience in building robust, scalable, high-quality data products in iterations and integrating them into existing and new data-pipelines. Power BI design experience (e.g. Dashboard building; Adhoc reporting etc.). Experience with agile methodologies in a professional development environment (CI/CD) and code versioning tools, such as Git, SVN, etc. Excellent coding skills in relevant languages for Microsoft Azure environment (e.g. SQL, Python, DAX) Azure DevOps knowledge would be an advantage. Fluent in English. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to gender, origin, culture, mindset, generation, disability, religion and sexual orientation.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: What are you going to do?Are you ready for a data challenge? Enza Zaden is currently on a mission to be the most data savvy and data driven breeding company in the world and therefore we’re looking for you, an Analytical Engineer. You will be responsible for building and maintaining data models and helping the data consumers to create value with data.Inside Enza Zaden, we are working with the Azure stack, so it’s important that you are know you’re way around with the Azure services. You will design, develop, build, test and maintain a stable analytical data platform and data products that reside on the Enza zaden data platform (e.g., data models, common dimensions, reports and dashboards). Your challenge is to standardize and automate data service and products as much as possible. This we do at Enza with an Agile mindset and approach.Furthermore, you will continuously improve the analytical data services to guarantee the optimal usage of the platform (e.g., data reliability, efficiency and quality) and make sure the products stay future proof (life cycle management). Next to that, you’re monitoring and reporting the usage and costs of the analytical data products. In close contact with other analytical engineers within Enza you make sure the analytical data products applies to security (e.g., user and data access management) and design rules of Enza Zaden together with the architecture department.Moreover, you are communicatively strong to give support and advice to the data consumer about the optimal usage of the analytical data products and possibilities. You define, communicate and support best analytical & reporting best practices across Enza Zaden. As analytics engineer you communicate with the Data, Reporting and Analytics Teams and other stakeholders to meet the business requirements that you translate to a solid solution. Finally you like to share, educate and inform other data professionals and stakeholders about the data platform, data services and available tooling.In this role you will work closely in an agile environment with our Data, Analytics & Reporting (DAR) managers and DAR/ SDP Data & Platform team members. Together you will share knowledge, best practise and ensure all requirements are aligned.Sometimes you will work together with external partners to possibly review and asses external vendors with solutions that are relevant to the assigned domain and of course to ensure keeping up to date with trends and developments.Your powerIn our professional team full with passionate engineers we are looking for an Analytics [MB1] Engineer who has multiple years’ experience with data modelling and data transformation. You know how to build and manage reports and dashboards too. You also now how to communicate well with stakeholders to translate their requirements to actionable pieces of work.To Meet The Job Requirements, Youhave a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience with data modelling and transformationexperience with managing Business Intelligence environments and know how to use the software and develop best practices like versioning, testing and continuous deployment.team focused approachproficient in English and Netherlands, both written and verbalare currently living in the Netherlands. Working from home is possible, but we expected you to work at Enza Zaden office in Enkhuizen for at least two days per weekTechnologiesMicrosoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900)Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals (DP-900)Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate (DP-203)SQLDatabricksData Build ToolData VisualisationDAXGitOur powerEnza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties. And produces and sells its seeds all over the world. We have made an animation to explain to you properly (and as briefly as possible) what we do.The purpose of our work? To offer everyone worldwide access to healthy and varied vegetables. With more than 2500 passionate colleagues all over the world, we work together every day on the vegetables of tomorrow.Would you like to know more about Enza Zaden as an employer? Then take a look at the Careers & Learning or visit our profile page on LinkedIn.ContactPlease, send your application to our Recruitment department, via the Apply now! button.More InformationSander Schoe, Recruiter, tel +31 6 2136 8907, s.schoe@enzazaden.nl

title: Data Engineer
description: Working at the heart of the energy transition and supporting the terminals to become a data-driven organization.is well underway to become a digital and data-driven organization. We are investing heavily in the data foundation as well as speeding up the utilization of data. For years, we have been standardizing our business processes across our terminal network, modernizing our application landscape, started governing and modelling our data, and implementing new cloud-based integration-, and data analytics platforms. More and more data is utilized in customer portals, data sharing platforms with partners in the logistic supply chain, and for advanced analytics & AI.In a brand new department within Global IT, the Data and Analytics Office, all data capabilities needed to support the data journey are centralized, ranging from Data Engineers & Data Scientists to Data Quality experts and Data Architects.As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the preparation and delivery of our data towards our data consumers, including collection/ingestion and integration of data from various internal and external data sources, into the different data stores and systems optimized for reporting and analytics. Examples are our cloud-based data lake (AWS S3), enterprise data warehouse (Snowflake) and data virtualization & catalogue (data. world).Furthermore, we are in the process of implementing an ambitious data analytics architecture, where we are translating our business strategy and requirements to new data technologies.One of your first assignments will be the migration of our current data integration solution into a modernized data integration technology.We are looking for a (medior) Data Engineer to help us in our journey towards becoming a data-driven company.RequirementsAs a data engineer, you will:Develop and maintain data pipelinesManage our data lake for reporting purposesBuild collectors (Lambda, DMS, Spark or Glue) and processes in AirflowConfigure and manage tools like Cloudformation (CDK)Use support tooling such as Gitlab (CI/CD)Focus on the technical implementation of use cases and required tools on a new data platformBe involved in the data standards and initiatives that we have set for our customersIn this role, you have the autonomy to, together with your team, decide how to maintain the data lake as you want it. You will be working with a variety of use cases and different data sets and will be continuously working on maintaining and keeping the platform alive. The report that you will deliver have an impact: they are used for sales and forecasting reports and enable our colleagues to work efficiently. You will be taking on various cases, as well as finding answers to questions like these:How can we incrementally develop a data platform that enables the most optimal development of use cases?How can we most efficiently develop a use case on the data platform and incrementally enhance the data platform to accommodate new use cases from our colleagues and our organization?

title: Senior - Data Engineer (Opportunity based in Barcelona)
description: Please Note: Great opportunity to relocate for a role based in Barcelona, Spain.About Gartner IT:Join a world-class team of skilled engineers who build creative digital solutions to support our colleagues and clients. We make a broad organizational impact by delivering cutting-edge technology solutions that power Gartner. Gartner IT values its culture of nonstop innovation, an outcome-driven approach to success, and the notion that great ideas can come from anyone on the team.About the role:Gartner is looking for a Senior Data Engineer focused on development of integrations/infrastructure leveraging Data Factory/Synapse for our People Technology Projects. The role would primarily focus on conducting data analysis, developing/supporting high performance data ingestion pipelines, data modelling, dashboarding and collaborating with business teams to create scalable solutions as per business requirements.What you will do:Design, test and implement high performance data ingestion pipelines from multiple sources using Data Factory, DatabricksCollaborate with architects and business/data science teams to create scalable Azure based solutions as per business requirements. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management. Develop data models and schemas in our data warehouse that enable performant, intuitive analysis. Provide expertise and leadership regarding cloud Architecture for infrastructure in Microsoft Azure. Recommend best practice methods for improvement and optimization of current infrastructure. Create specification documents for designs, testing and support processes. Analyze business requirements and prepare development project schedule, tasks, and estimates. Collaborate with project team members to identify issues and risks associated with the design, implementation, and delivery of project assignments. What you will need:Strong IT professional with 4 – 7 years of experience in software development for data engineering using Python, Azure/ GCP / AWS. The candidate should have strong problem-solving skills along with high on ownership and accountability. Must have:4 years of experience in Solution, Design and Development of Cloud based data models, ETL Pipelines and infrastructure for reporting, analytics, and data science. Experience working with and creating databases and Power BI dashboards using all relevant data to inform decisions. Experience working with both structured and unstructured data. Strong understanding of OOPS, Design principles and Distributed systems and experience of Data Structures and algorithmsExperience working in different programming languages (Java, python, scala) and version control tools (Git, Subversion)Experience working with Spark/ Hive/HDFS Experience using automated build systems (CI/CD)Good to have:Knowledge of different database technologies (Relational, NoSQL, Graph, Document, Key-Value, Time Series, etc…). This should include building and managing scalable data modelsKnowledge of TDD/BDD Experience working with different flavors of SQL and relative database systemsExperience in DevOps is good to haveWho you are:Graduate/Post graduate inExcellent communication and prioritization skills. Able to work independently or within a team proactively in a fast-paced AGILE-SCRUM environment. Owns success – Takes responsibility for successful delivery of the solutions. Strong desire to improve upon their skills in software development, frameworks, and Don’t meet every single requirement? We encourage you to apply anyway. You might just be the right candidate for this, or other roles.What you’ll get:Competitive Compensation Packages23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December. Private Medical and Dental Care. Life and Disability Insurance. Public Transport Subsidy. Ticket Restaurant Card. Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia). IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities. Spanish lessons. Pension Scheme. Tuition Reimbursement. Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Employee Assistance Program. Gartner Gives Charity Match. Relocation Assistance - a specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork. Please Note:Applications must be submitted in English. A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position. #Technology#HybridWho are we?At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE: IT), we deliver actionable, objective insight that drives smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s mission-critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.What makes Gartner a great place to work?Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join What we offer:Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.Job Requisition ID:72859By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policyFor efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: What are you going to do?Are you ready for a data challenge? Enza Zaden is currently on a mission to be the most data savvy and data driven breeding company in the world and therefore we’re looking for you, a Senior Analytical Engineer. You will be responsible for building and maintaining data models and helping the data consumers to create value with data.Inside Enza Zaden, we are working with the Azure stack, so it’s important that you are know you’re way around with the Azure services. You will design, develop, build, test and maintain a stable analytical data platform and data products that reside on the Enza Zaden data platform (e.g., data models, common dimensions, reports and dashboards). Your challenge is to standardize and automate data service and products as much as possible. This we do at Enza with an Agile mindset and approach.Furthermore, you will continuously improve the analytical data services to guarantee the optimal usage of the platform (e.g., data reliability, efficiency and quality) and make sure the products stay future proof (life cycle management). Next to that, you’re monitoring and reporting the usage and costs of the analytical data products. In close contact with other analytical engineers within Enza you make sure the analytical data products applies to security (e.g., user and data access management) and design rules of Enza Zaden together with the architecture department.Moreover, you are communicatively strong to give support and advice to the data consumer about the optimal usage of the analytical data products and possibilities. You define, communicate and support best analytical & reporting best practices across Enza Zaden. As analytics engineer you communicate with the Data, Reporting and Analytics Teams and other stakeholders to meet the business requirements that you translate to a solid solution. Finally, you like to share, educate and inform other data professionals and stakeholders about the data platform, data services and available tooling.In this role you will work closely in an agile environment with our Data, Analytics & Reporting (DAR) managers and DAR/ SDP Data & Platform team members. Together you will share knowledge, best practice and ensure all requirements are aligned.Sometimes you will work together with external partners to possibly review and asses external vendors with solutions that are relevant to the assigned domain and of course to ensure keeping up to date with trends and developments.Your PowerIn our professional team full with passionate engineers we are looking for an Analytics Engineer who has multiple years’ experience with data modelling and data transformation. You know how to build and manage reports and dashboards too. You also know how to communicate well with stakeholders to translate their requirements to actionable pieces of work.To Meet The Job Requirements, You have a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience with data modelling and transformation experience with managing Business Intelligence environments and know how to use the software and develop best practices like versioning, testing and continuous deployment. team focused approach love to brainstorm with your team and stakeholders on the ideal designs proficient in the English and Netherlands, both written and verbal are currently living in the Netherlands. Working from home is possible, but we expected you to work at Enza Zaden office in Enkhuizen for at least two days per weekTechnologies Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900) Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Fundamentals (DP-900) Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate (DP-203) SQL Databricks DBT Power BI DAX GitOur powerEnza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties. And produces and sells its seeds all over the world. We have made an animation to explain to you properly (and as briefly as possible) what we do.The purpose of our work? To offer everyone worldwide access to healthy and varied vegetables. With more than 2500 passionate colleagues all over the world, we work together every day on the vegetables of tomorrow.Would you like to know more about Enza Zaden as an employer? Then take a look at the Careers & Learning or visit our profile page on LinkedIn.ContactNick van DijkCorporate Recruiter+31 6 1544 5587n.vandijk@enzazaden.nl

title: Data analytics engineer Circular Economy | Utrecht
description: What will be your role?Data may be collected from a wide variety of public and commercial databases, literature and internet sources. The needed data sets will be specified, curated and constructed in close contact with the other colleagues who will be using these data, often in various modeling and evaluation projects. Processing, storage and visualization of the results of these evaluations may also be part of the activities.Together with the integral team of data and modeling experts this data will translate into mathematical models to make statements about the circularity of society, incl. products and processes, thus making a crucial contribution to the transition to a circular economy. These are socially relevant issues that TNO investigates in projects and consortia.We are looking for a data analytics engineer who has a keen interest in sustainability and circular economy, and has an interest in understanding the connection between the qualitative and quantitative world. Together with internal and external parties, you will shape the development and expansion of a database structure. This also means that part of your work involves writing high-quality project proposals and scientific articles with others and working closely together with scientists from the areas of circular plastics, microplastics, circular electronics and critical raw materials.What We Expect From YouEffective communication both internally and externally. With members of the project team, business consultants, and pioneers in the field at TNO. You are grounded and practical. What else do you have to offer? You hold a Msc or PhD degree in a relevant discipline, such as data science, physics, chemistry, statistics, computer science with relation to sustainability. You have proven experience with retrieving, harmonising, organising and storing large datasets. You can help to manage and set-up a data infrastructure for the data and modelling team. You are a proficient programmer, preferably in R and Python, with expertise in distributed (cloud-based) computation. Experience with agile working (Scrum & Gitlab) is a plus You have strong collaboration and networking skills and know how to connect people. You have excellent command of the English language, both spoken and written. Knowledge of the Dutch language is appreciated. What You'll Get In ReturnBesides offering a full time position (32-40 hours per week), TNO understands that every employee has different needs. TNO offers flexible terms of employment “a-la-carte”, in which you can exchange various terms of employment against each other on a monthly basis. With flexible working hours (e.g. 4x9 hours) and different leave arrangements you can create a package that serves your needs. TNO believes in the importance of both your personal and professional development. There are many possibilities to shape your own development Conferences, educations, workshops, intervision and mentoring. At TNO you are in the lead of your own career.Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 3.124,- and € 5.522,34 (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect A good pension scheme. A modern mobility policy including 100% public transport reimbursement for commuting and business travel using a Mobility Card. An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field. 28 days annual leave and 5 compensation days under the reduction in working hours scheme (ATV, arbeidstijdverkorting) on a full-time basis. Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues . That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly. Flexible working hours and the possibility of working from home. The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs. Networking opportunities and great activities organized by Jong TNO . Extensive relocation package for international candidates. Read More About Tailoring Your Benefits Package.TNO as an employerAt TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer .At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion .Within TNO, you will work in the Circularity & Sustainability Impact department. This is a versatile department with nearly 50 passionate researchers, consultants, and mathematical wizards in the field of life cycle assessments (LCA) and other impact methods. They have domain knowledge of the recycling and chemical industry and extensive knowledge of analyzing and predicting the impact of human actions on the climate and planetary boundaries. Additionally, this team helps policymakers in governments and decision-makers in companies in the transformation to a more sustainable and cleaner economy. The team you will be a part of is based in Utrecht but collaborates extensively with other teams (e.g., in The Hague, Amsterdam, Geleen and the Eindhoven region).The selection processPlease apply before December 4, 2023. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. The preliminary interview takes place on December 13, 2023. The second interview round has yet to be scheduled. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.The selection process may include an online assessment and a reference check.Has this job opening sparked your interest? Then we’d like to hear from you! Please contact us for more information about the job or the selection process. To apply, please upload your CV and covering letter using the ‘apply now’ button.

title: Sr. BI Consultant/Data Engineer
description: Werk waar je trots op kan zijnDit ga je doenVoor de energie transitie is data onmisbaar om vooruit te komen, en daar hebben we veel van bij Stedin. Vanuit deze data moet de juiste informatie opgehaald worden. Het nieuwe data landschap is continue aan verandering onderhevig en wordt steeds moderner en gaver om aan te werken. Om deze reden willen we graag een Business Intelligence Consultant/Data Engineer toevoegen aan ons team.Als BI consultant/Data Engineer vertaal je informatiebehoefte naar succesvolle data-oplossingen. Je gebruikt hiervoor onder andere ETL-technologieën van Informatica. Je helpt ook mee bij de ontwikkeling en verdere positionering van de BI- en data-dienstverlening. En helpt zo mee om voor onze bedrijfsafdelingen zoals Asset Management, Aansluiting & Vervanging, Storing & Onderhoud en de Transportketen toegevoegde waarde uit data te halen. Hiermee maken we onze dienstverlening steeds beter.Je bent in staat om nieuwe tooling en programmeertalen snel eigen te maken. Ook vind je het leuk om samen te vernieuwen, jezelf te ontwikkelen en anderen mee te nemen. En bij alles wat je doet, hou je het belang van de klant in de gaten.Jouw toegevoegde waarde?Om de energietransitie te realiseren is IT, en jij dus, onmisbaar! Stedin heeft in 2020 de stap naar de Microsoft Azure cloud gemaakt. Met producten als Databricks en tooling van Informatica zoals Data Engineering Integration (voormalig BDM) bouwen we voortdurend verder aan ons data platform. Dit doe jij in nauwe samenwerking met collega’s en andere teams zoals de Data Scientists en de Scrum teams van Stedin. Gaaf toch?Jouw sterke puntenWorden we blij vanWord jij enthousiast van het leren van nieuwe dingen? Met jouw lef, hoge energieniveau en positieve instelling zet je elke dag die extra stap! Je zoekt een plek om jouw ambities waar te maken. Een plek waar pro-activiteit verwelkomd wordt. En ja, dat vind je bij Stedin.Wat jou verder onze BI consultant/ Data Engineer maakt?Je hebt minimaal hbo werk- en denkniveau met aantoonbaar ervaring in de Microsoft Azure data services stack. Je hebt aantoonbaar ervaring met ELT/ ETL flows (ervaring met Informatica toolstack is een pré). En ervaring met Unix (shell)- en Python scripts maken t.b.v. automatisering is een pré. Je hebt kennis van databases, o.a SQL Server. En je bent bekend met best practices voor software-engineering, zoals OTAP, versiebeheer in GIT en CI/ CD. Aantoonbaar ervaring met datalake concepten zoals Databricks Delta Lake en fileformats als Parquet en Delta is een sterke pre. En je hebt ervaring met het modelleren van data conform Datavault en dimensioneel Kimball. Je hebt ook kennis van methoden en technieken t.b.v. de analyse van de bedrijfsprocessen en het doen van verbetervoorstellen. Ervaring met een Agile Scrum werkwijze, BI test automation en PowerBI zijn een pré. Goede mondelinge en schriftelijke uitdrukkingsvaardigheid in Nederlands (niveau B2 / leergierig). Een goed teamDaar hoor je bijMeteen vanaf dag één maak je deel uit van de afdeling Smart Data Solutions. Deze afdeling bestaat uit meerdere Scrum teams. In het BI Informatica team werken we op basis van DevOps. Samen met je collega’s vul je dus de rol in van zowel ontwikkelaar en beheerder. Daarnaast adviseer je de Stedin business.Wat ons bindt? De drive om samen te puzzelen en samen tot de beste oplossingen komen. Dat doen we met de Agile/SaFe methodiek. Het team wordt steeds autonomer en werkt vaak vanuit huis. Wel komen we graag minstens eens per week samen op kantoor (standplaats Rotterdam Blaak) voor inhoudelijke overleg en Scrum events.Samenwerken met andere teams? Daar hebben we de Big Room Planning voor. Een grote happening, zonder dat dit ten koste gaat van de werksnelheid. Een goede werksfeer mag daarbij natuurlijk niet ontbreken. Er is veel aandacht voor inhoudelijke én persoonlijke ontwikkeling. En reken maar dat we onze successen goed vieren. Want waar we hard werken, lachen we ook hard. Dat is de sfeer bij IT. Hoe beter de samenwerking, des te meer successen er gevierd worden. Wij dagen je uit!Mooie arbeidsvoorwaardenDie wil je hebbenDat je van ons je eigen telefoon (of een Bring Your Own Device vergoeding) en laptop krijgt, vinden we nogal vanzelfsprekend. Wat mag je nog meer van Stedin als werkgever verwachten?Alle financiële arbeidsvoorwaarden op een rij, weet je meteen waar je aan toe bent:Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden horen erbij. Zo krijg je een (maximaal) salaris van €5.800, - gebaseerd op 40 uur per week en kennis en ervaring, 24,5 vakantiedagen en bouw je prima pensioen op bij het ABP. Boven op je salaris ontvang je een persoonlijk budget van 24% (inclusief 8% vakantiegeld). Jij kiest wat je met het budget doet. Elke maand extra salaris? Of meer verlofdagen? In onze nieuwe Rekentool krijg je een alvast voorproefje van hoe jouw persoonlijk budget eruit zou kunnen zien en hoe je het zou kunnen besteden. Gezonde energie die heb je nodig. Daarom krijg je van ons ook een Duurzaam Inzetbaarheid budget van €500 bruto per jaar (bijvoorbeeld voor je sportabonnement, een hometrainer of je nieuwe sport outfit). Volgens ons Stedin@Work concept werk je 50% thuis en 50% op kantoor, wel zo flexibel. Wij zorgen voor jouw thuiswerkfaciliteiten, een thuiswerkvergoeding en reizen naar kantoor doe je met je OV vrij-abonnement waarmee je ook buiten werk onbeperkt kan reizen! Daar Komt Dit Nog BovenopWerken bij Stedin betekent werken bij een World-class Workplace. Een van de trotspunten .van onze (en jouw toekomstige) collega’s? Werksfeer. Jouw ontwikkeling staat centraal: events bezoeken met collega’s, meedoen aan kennissessies, trainingen en opleidingen volgen. Zo geven we jouw talent écht alle kans en haal jij het beste uit jezelf. Goede koffie van Heilige Boontjes. In Rotterdam kun je jouw bakkie ook halen bij onze ‘gebarista’ (onze slechthorende barista). We zijn een duurzaam bedrijf. Reis je met het OV naar je werk, dan krijg je van ons een OV Vrij-abonnement 2e klas. Dit abonnement mag je ook privé gebruiken. Kies je voor een vaste reiskostenvergoeding dan ontvang je 13 cent per kilometer (maximaal 60 kilometer enkele reis) voor de dagen dat je reist voor je werk. Met je Persoonlijk Budget kun je dit aanvullen tot 21 cent netto per kilometer. Krijg je je eigen bedrijfsauto of -bus, dan mag je deze ook gebruiken voor woon-werkverkeer. Voor zakelijk verkeer gebruiken we deelauto’s.Nu reagerenLaten zien wat je in huis hebtZin in deze baan waar je voorop loopt in de energietransitie? Genoeg te doen bij Stedin! Doe je mee? Dat doe je met de knop 'solliciteren', je CV en motivatiebrief. We kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!Wie je ook bent, wat je ook doet, bij ons ben je welkom. Want als je jezelf bent, werkt het net wat beter.Dankzij een (pre) employment screening en een assessment kunnen wij jou (en jij jezelf) nog beter leren kennen. Daarom maken deze onderdeel uit van de selectieprocedure. Het vinden van een wederzijdse match, daar krijgen we nieuwe energie van! Daarom zijn onze vacatures geen oproep voor acquisitie, we werven onze nieuwe collega’s graag zelf. Micha VisserVragen? Bel, mail of app direct met onze recruiter Michamicha.visser2@stedin.net06 13 755 379VergelijkbareVacatures Bekijk alle vacaturesTest Engineer slimme metersAls Test Engineer voer je product acceptatie testen uit aan nieuwe typen of gewijzigde slimme meters.40 uurDelftBI Consultant InformaticaAls BI Consultant Informatica vertaal je informatiebehoefte naar data-oplossingen en draag je bij aan de positionering van de BI- en data-dienstverlening.40 uurRotterdamSAP CX ConsultantAls SAP CX Consultant werk je in een hecht Scrum team om service- en salesprocessen in ons (nieuwe) Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systeem te implementeren SAP Cloud for Customer (kortweg: SAP C4). Als ervaren Consultant ondersteun en begeleid je bij de inrichting en implementatie van de CRM gerelateerde processen binnen Stedin.40 uurRotterdamSAP Financieel consultantAls SAP Financieel Consultant help je de business om het maximale uit het SAP-systeem te halen door andere systemen te migreren of te integreren samen met een technische consultant.40 uurDelft

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description: Over de functieWil je bijdragen aan de energietransitie en een duurzame wereld? En geeft het ontwikkelen van op data gebaseerde zakelijke oplossingen jou energie? Sluit je dan aan bij ons Data & Analytics team als Analytics Engineer!Over de Data & Analytics afdelingJe zult deel uitmaken van de Vattenfall BtC (Business to Consumer) Data & Analytics afdeling, die op data gebaseerde oplossingen ontwikkelt voor onze klanten en klantprocessen. De afdeling is verdeeld in drie teams voor verschillende bedrijfsdomeinen; waar data-experts en zakelijke experts nauw samenwerken om waardevolle data science-oplossingen te realiseren. Elk Data & Analytics domein team bestaat uit een Analytics Translator, Analytics Engineers en Data Scientists, en wordt ondersteund door Data- & Machine Learning Engineers van IT.De afdeling werkt verdeeld in drie teams voor verschillende bedrijfsdomeinen; waar data-experts en zakelijke experts nauw samenwerken om waardevolle data-oplossingen te realiseren. Elk domein team bestaat uit een Analytics Translator, Analytics Engineers en Data Scientists, en wordt ondersteund door Data & Machine Learning Engineers van onze IT (Informatie Technologie) afdeling.We hechten waarde aan gezamenlijke ontwikkeling in manieren van werken en het delen van best practices. Dit wordt gefaciliteerd in onze data science autoriteit en data foundation autoriteit. Als Senior Analytics Engineer lever je een belangrijke bijdrage aan de Data Foundation autoriteit.Jouw rol Als Senior Analytics Engineer weet je hoe je de wensen van onze stakeholders kunt vertalen naar de juiste inzichten uit data. Je bent bekend met de beschikbare data bronnen op ons platform en hebt proactieve ideeën voor aanvullende bronnen die ons beter van dienst zouden zijn. Samen met relevante stakeholders stem je af en creëer je de nodige data definities. Je bent een expert als het gaat om data modellering. Je kent de voor- en nadelen van alternatieve oplossingen en zoekt naar de beste aanpak in elke situatie. Je creëert relevante datasets en dashboards en coacht gebruikers over hoe ze deze kunnen gebruiken. Je bent een actief lid van de data foundation autoriteit; voortdurend op zoek naar manieren om onze data producten naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Dit kan bijvoorbeeld worden gedaan door afstemming met je collega's over verbeterde standaarden, het toevoegen van nieuwe functionaliteiten voor eindgebruikers of het delen van nieuwe kennis met alle analytics engineers. Je brengt je enthousiasme over data over op de organisatie. In deze functie krijg je de kans om met innovatieve technologieën te werken en een impact te maken!Jouw taken en verantwoordelijkheden:Vertaal de wensen van stakeholders naar duidelijke vereisten voor data producten. Creëer bruikbare inzichten voor verschillende stakeholders. Ontwikkel datasets en dashboards die gebruikers in staat stellen om hun vragen te beantwoorden. Leg op een eenvoudige manier uit hoe datasets en dashboards geïnterpreteerd en gebruikt kunnen worden door verschillende stakeholders. Breng enthousiasme over data over om de organisatie te inspireren en te betrekken. Benut data om trends, patronen en kansen voor bedrijfsgroei te identificeren. Werk samen met het team om het data model van de organisatie te verbeteren en data producten te verbeteren. Blijf op de hoogte van innovatieve technologieën op het gebied van data-analyse en gebruik ze om impact te genereren. Speel een cruciale rol in de ontwikkeling en implementatie van data oplossingen voor Vattenfall BtC. Locatie: AmsterdamJouw profielJouw profiel Als Senior Analytics Engineer ben je een sterke communicator en enthousiaste collega met een passie voor data. Je voelt je op je gemak in een breed stakeholder veld. Je bent analytisch, resultaatgericht en werkt graag in een wendbaar team. Daarnaast ben je proactief op zoek naar nieuwe oplossingen en standaarden om mee te werken.Daarnaast voldoe je aan de volgende criteria:Een afgeronde HBO/WO-opleiding. Minimaal 7 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol. Meerdere jaren ervaring in een omgeving met grote hoeveelheden data. Zeer sterke Transact-SQL-vaardigheden. Ervaren professional als het gaat om Data Modeling en Dimensional Modeling. Sterke rapportagevaardigheden met Microsoft Power BI of vergelijkbare tools. Gewend om te werken met CICD, testen en code-reviews. Ervaring met de Agile manier van werken - Scrum. Gewend om te werken aan grote projecten of met een breed stakeholder veld. Extra informatieWij bieden Wij bieden je naast een marktconform salaris goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, die je zelf voor een deel kunt samenstellen. Ook zijn er veel mogelijkheden je vakinhoudelijk en persoonlijk te ontwikkelen.Daarnaast kom je terecht in een moderne, dynamische en plezierige werkomgeving. Bij Vattenfall heerst een hechte teamcultuur waar tegelijkertijd volop ruimte is voor eigen initiatief.Standplaats van deze functie is Amsterdam, hybride werken is op dit moment de norm. We hechten bij Vattenfall veel waarde aan een goede werk-privé balans, wij blijven dus samen kijken hoe wij hier als werkgever aan bij kunnen dragen.Solliciteren / Meer weten? Klinkt dit interessant? We zien jouw sollicitatie graag uiterlijk 7 december tegemoet. Voor vragen over de functie en/of het proces kun je contact opnemen met Tessa Beerling, Corporate Recruiter, tessa.beerling@vattenfall.com.Bij Vattenfall zijn wij ervan overtuigd dat diversiteit een grote bijdrage levert aan onze organisatie. Daarom streven wij constant naar een harmonieuze balans tussen onze medewerkers op het gebied van leeftijd, seksuele geaardheid, geloofsovertuiging, genderidentiteit, (arbeids)beperking en culturele of etnische achtergrond.De veiligheid van Vattenfall en haar medewerkers is essentieel. Daarom maakt een pre-employment screening deel uit van het selectieproces. De screening is gebaseerd op de rol die je gaat vervullen binnen Vattenfall. De screening wordt uitgevoerd door een derde partij, Validata.We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie!Over onsVattenfall is een Europees energiebedrijf met ongeveer 20.000 werknemers werkzaam in diverse landen. Al meer dan 100 jaar houden we ons bezig met het electrificeren van industrieën, het leveren van energie aan de huizen van mensen en het moderniseren van onze manier van leven door innovatie en samenwerking. Vattenfall wil een fossielvrij leven mogelijk maken binnen één generatie. We lopen voorop in de transitie naar een duurzaam energiesysteem. Om dit ambitieuze doel te kunnen bereiken zijn wij op zoek naar getalenteerde personen die naast hun passie voor hun eigen rol ook een sterke teamspirit hebben en willen bijdragen aan het ondersteunen van een betekenisvolle bedrijfsmissie.

title: Junior Data Engineer – Young Engineering Professional Program
description: Interested in a job in IT and contributing to a better world? Discover your best self with the Young Engineering Professional Program.You and your futureDuring the Young Engineering Professional Program (also known as YEPP) at Rabobank you work on your career one day a week by following a technical track, or you work on your personal development. You develop talents you didn’t know you had and we are given the space to discover for yourself what you are good at and what you like. And then? Everything you learn in the training courses can immediately be put into practice, because the other 4 days you work in your starter position as a Junior Data Engineer. Under the guidance of experienced colleagues, you will become a specialist in your field in no time. In addition, in the program you will work together with the team on 2 business challenges on themes such as sustainable agriculture or the cooperative energy transition.In the Working Capital & Trade Finance area you will help Rabobank to become "The global F&A connector" in the integrated value chain. You will develop a platform where we can plot prospects and clients in the value chains and can directly see the peer analyses with the main competitors. By creating such automated insights into the client’s working capital scenarios, including benchmarking and peer group comparisons, we can add value to the interaction with our clients which can make the difference in a pitch.ExamplesKeep the data model aligned with business interests by adding, updating or deleting elementsCombine data analysis with visualizations to create insights in the Client’s working capital position and insights in relevant impacts in relation to industry, geography, rules/regulations, weather etc. Develop data ingestion pipelines and data structuring through the use of Azure Databricks and Azure DataFactoryEnsure that our code (infrastructure as code, ELT logic) always stays up to date and reliable.Safeguard the security of the data and processes we have to prevent potential damagePracticalLength: Young Engineering Professional Program: 18 monthsAfter which you will continue to work with us as Junior Data EngineerHours per week: 40Your development To become the specialist in your professional field, in the Young Engineering Professional Program 1 day a week you mainly attend training courses that that support your talent development. The courses are often given by experienced colleagues or trainers with a track record. You build your network, gain valuable experience and develop skills which will be of use to you later in your career.Learning From Each OtherDevelopment is our top priority. Because the best way to learn is by doing, through mistakes and successes. At Rabobank we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. To develop talents you never thought you possessed. To specialize in a professional field or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During the Young Engineering Professional Program you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with young professionals.“YEPP provided a great place to learn IT while gaining insights into Rabobank and it's way of working. I have been able to strengthen my existing IT skills, and learn about new topics with a strong network of other young professionals to share with.” - Alastair Grant, YEPP Developer VCV.Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.You and your talenta bachelor or master degree, or an equivalent working / thinking levelaffinity with software development, and already some experience with dataexcellent proficiency in Englishfeedback makes you strongerlearns from mistakesadaptive to changing situationsfocus on the solutionThis Is What We Offer YouMost of all, we offer you an 18 month long rich learning experience, while you advance your career towards an expert in your fieldA gross monthly salary in function scale 7A combination of working from home and at the officeA personal development budget of € 1,400-This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Junior Data Engineer based on a 40-hour working week.You and the job application processWe believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.So get in touch straightaway:Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Clemens Schinkel, Corporate Recruiter via Clemens.schinkel@rabobank.nl.A technical assessment and/or a personality assessment is part of the selection process.Interviews will be held via MS Teams or at our office in Utrecht.A security check is part of the process.We respect your privacy.

title: Jr Machine Learning Ops Engineer
description: Op het hoofdkantoorBij Albert Heijn werken is niet zomaar een baan. Het is werk met betekenis. Je werkt in een informele cultuur samen met een bevlogen team dat graag voorop wil blijven lopen en verschil wil maken. Met jouw unieke talent maak je impact op het leven van al onze klanten. Je leert van experts in hun vakgebied en we helpen je jouw loopbaan vorm te geven. Je kunt bij ons flexibel werken, zowel vanuit huis als op ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Een baan bij Albert Heijn is niet alleen een baan voor nu, maar ook voor laterWat betekent dit voor jou?You’re finished work for the day, you’ve pushed your code, and it’s been reviewed and merged, you need to pick up some groceries on the way home. You bike to your local Albert Heijn and you think to yourself with a smile that the forecasting model that you and your team just deployed is already running behind the scenes to make sure that your favorite products are fresh and available! As you walk through the refrigerated aisles you pick up a bargain - some salad leaves that have been dynamically marked down to 70% off to make sure they sell before they expire and are wasted – again by a data science model running behind the scenes. You walk past the bakery department and think about the optimization that is running to help the bakers bake the right number of croissants tomorrow morning. Stepping out onto the street you think to yourself that it’s not just your local store – these models are running in more than a thousand stores across the Netherlands and Belgium. Furthermore, it’s not just the stores, the models your team builds are running in the supply chain and for online orders – ensuring efficient packing and delivery!Does a job with such tangible impact at such scale motivate you? Do you want to use your skills to solve a wide set of practical and challenging problems?We're looking for talented curious young people to come and strengthen our Operations Analytics and Data Science team!As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer at AH Technology, you will:Work on different aspects of our in-house machine learning solutions including software engineering, data engineering and automationCollaborate with product owners, analysts, data scientists and engineers to deploy and continually improve machine learning modelsSupport the team in following software engineering and MLOps best practices, for example by reviewing code and automating deployment and model management tasksContinually improve your coding and machine learning skills with the guidance of senior members and through participation in trainingWho you are:You have an MSc in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related disciplineYou enjoy writing pythonic, clear, extendable, testable code, and can apply Software Engineering best practicesYou can build a data pipeline using SQL, Spark, Pandas, or other relevant tools for transformation of relational dataYou are familiar with the concepts of version control and continuous integration and deliveryYou know the fundamentals of Machine Learning and StatisticsKnowledge of the following topics would be a plus:ContainerizationCloud platformsREST APIsFor more information about AH Technology, you can also visit https://blog.ah.technology/At AH Technology, we aim to grow, and that is only possible if you grow with us.That is why you get access to best-in-class guidance and inspiring training to shape your development and career.As we work together to build on our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week):An inspiring head office in ZaandamA competitive salary up to € 60K - gross a year. (excl. holiday allowance)A profit distribution on top of your salary25,5 vacation daysAn ADV budget choice in which you can decide whether you spend it on extra days (+19,5 days), discounts or pay-outsFlexible working hours and the possibility to work from homeAn excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%Courses from our Albert Heijn Data AcademyAttractive discounts on various insurance policiesA travel allowance or a Traject OV-chip card for traveling to and from ZaandamA MacBook M1/M2 Pro and iPhone 1410% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per yearData Talent TrackLearning and personal growth are core values of our department. Our Data Talent Track is a one and a half year program available to our young analysts and data scientists. It consists of soft and hard skills training that helps you develop your professional skills. Courses on communication, on personal leadership and on writing better code. You’ll also get a chance to help out in the store for a day or help build the ideas of the future in a Hackathon.Want to know more?Follow this link: https://nl.linkedin.com/posts/noortje-van-genugten_ahtechnology-dataanalytics-albertheijn-activity-7062341484271792128-9AK0ApplyDo you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop on board and join us on our expedition. Apply via the button on this page. We ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:Why do you think you will be successful in this position and what kind of technical skills do you bring with you for this role?What is one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop?Want to know more before you apply for our role at AH Technology? Peter Dirks, Talent Acquisition Partner Data Science & Analytics, is happy to tell you everything about this vacancy via peter.dirks@ah.nl

title: Senior Data engineer
description: Data 3-5 jaar/years Eneco - Rotterdam €70.000 - €90.000 32 - 40 uur Solliciteer directYou will have the opportunity to work on complex ingestion issues with cutting-edge technologies such as Azure Data Factory, Kubernetes, Snowflake.You will become part of the frontrunner in the energy transition, where you contribute to a more sustainable future by building on the growth and development of Eneco's integration platforms.You get the opportunity to make Eneco a digital first company.Why choose for Eneco?Why choose Eneco? We want to accelerate the energy transition. With our ambitious ‘One Planet plan’, we have made it clear that by 2035, we aim to be the first energy company to become CO2-neutral. No more reliance on natural gas! The entire Netherlands is making the switch. Towards smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable energy. Everyone has their own reasons for doing so. Some want to contribute to a better climate, others switch because their neighbors are doing it, or because they find joy in saving energy, and we're doing it now!At Eneco, we want to help everyone to take the next sustainable step. And we are looking for the best people who can make that possible. People who are enthusiastic about our mission of 'sustainable energy for everyone' and who want to further develop their talents at Eneco. We want everyone to be able to participate effortlessly in the energy transition. This can only happen if we better assist our customers, remove barriers for them to become more sustainable by listening and understanding their true needs.Digital innovations help the market align supply and demand and make it as easy as possible for users. Data plays a crucial role in this. From the Data & Technology Services department, we are working to make Eneco a data-driven organization that bases its decisions and actions on customer, product, asset, and market data.What You’ll DoIn Data & Technology Services, the Data Services department is responsible for executing data projects for the Business and fueling the growth of data capabilities by acting as an incubator for the development of data products.As Data engineer you have an essential role in transforming Eneco's projects into stable, robust productionized data driven applications. The data engineer deeply understands how data pipelines behave in production, and uses this knowledge to enable implementation, optimization, and maintenance of complex data flows. You are an enabler who plays a pivotal role in the 'democratization' of data: you help to retrieve, store, transform and disclose data for use in data driven solutions.Is this about you?You get energy of solving complex issues with ingestions, but you do not lose sight of being able to properly maintain the ingestions. Where necessary, you coach your colleagues in realizing and maintaining ingestions.At least 5 years of relevant work experience in a Data Engineering role.Academic work and thinking level.Experience in continuous integration and continuous delivery, Snowflake or other data cloud solutions, SQL, Databricks, Docker, Azure Data Factory, Airflow, Python.Knowledge of concepts/components such as warehouse, data lake, data mesh, data vault, data fabric, and streaming solutions.You’ll be responsible forBuilding and maintaining data pipelines, note that this may require working in the evening or weekend.Stay up to date with the latest technologies to deliver the most efficient solutions for the business.Support the team in learning new technologies.Advice the organization in the best suitable solution to retrieve, store, transform and disclose data.This is where you’ll workData & Technology Services has multiple departments the Data Services department has two teams - a Data Management Services team and a Data Product Services team. You will be part of the Data Product Services team that assist the business in using the various parts of the Enterprise Data Platform effectively to create customer and business value.What We Have To OfferGross year salary of between €70.000 and €90.000 Including 8% holiday allowance, a good pension and parental leave.FlexBudget on top of your gross salaryHave it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice - it's up to you.Personal and professional growthEneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.Hybrid working, at home or in the officeYou work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.Working at Eneco is for everyoneOur customers are diverse, and so are we. More than 3,000 Eneco-talents ensure an open, pleasant culture in which everyone can grow and thrive. In this way we create the ideal situation for creative insights and innovative solutions. And we can use that to achieve our ambitious mission: to be climate neutral by 2035. You know what the fun is? We can never have enough talent at Eneco. So get in touch and apply.Together towards climate neutralityAsk a colleague about our joint mission and you will hear it again and again: Eneco wants to be climate neutral by 2035. Everyone works together to realize this ambition. We help customers switch to sustainable energy with good advice and smart, affordable products. We develop wind farms, install large solar roofs and invest in heat networks. We see opportunities everywhere. Are you in?This Is How The Application Procedure GoesWant to know more about this job function?Do you want to know more about this vacancy? Marcel van der Voort, our Manager Data Product Services, will be happy to answer your questions at 06 3401 9293. For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Mark van Dommelen, Recruiter Data & Technology at: 06 2918 5218.We do not appreciate acquisition in response to this advertisement.Questions About The Application ProcedureFeel free to contact our recruiter:Mark van Dommelen+31629185218Stuur een e-mailWith this job opening, we want to recruit a new Eneco colleague ourselves. This is not a call for acquisition.

title: Data engineer
description: Binnen DPD zijn wij experts in het vervoeren van pakketten. In deze functie zorg jij ervoor dat onze digitale pakketten snel en efficiënt kunnen worden vervoerd. Jij zorgt ervoor dat data efficiënt uit bron systemen ontsloten wordt en vertaalt deze data vervolgens naar bruikbare datasets. Verder zorg jij ervoor dat deze datasets voor de juiste mensen beschikbaar zijn. Het data platform geldt als ‘single source of truth’ en is (op termijn) te gebruiken en begrijpen door de business zelf.Om ons data platform zo efficiënt mogelijk te houden ben jij continu op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen binnen jouw vakgebied. Jij onderzoekt waar mogelijkheden zijn om ons data platform verder te ontwikkelen en zorgt ervoor dat deze vervolgens ook worden geïmplementeerd.Jouw werkomgeving?Het team bestaat, naast jou, uit 2 BI Specialisten, die met hun gezonde nieuwsgierigheid scherp zijn op de eigen en elkaars data-analyses en de beste resultaten uit de analyses willen halen. Je rapporteert aan de business intelligence lead. We vinden naast hard werken gezelligheid ook belangrijk en vinden het fijn om met elkaar samen te werken.Wat neem jij mee?hbo/wo werk- en denkniveau (technische bedrijfskunde, informatiekunde, informatica of vergelijkbaar);Een goed inzicht in bedrijfsprocessen en datastructuren en kennis hiervan om door middel van transformatie bruikbare informatie te maken;Adequate kennis van SQL, Microsoft Azure, en Databricks;Goede communicatieve vaardigheden op alle niveaus (Nederlands en Engels);Flexibel in een dynamische omgeving;Gedrevenheid, initiatiefrijk en gewoon durven: door jouw nieuwsgierigheid wil je tot de kern van analyses te komen. Het creatieve vermogen om ‘out of the box’ te kunnen denken is jouw tweede natuur.Ons aanbodGa Je Aan De Slag Bij DPD Nederland, Dan Kom Je Te Werken In Een Informele, Afwisselende En No-nonsense Organisatie. Waar Ambitie, Klantbelofte En Duurzaamheid Centraal Staan En Waarin We Veel Waarde Hechten Aan Samenwerken Aan De Realisatie Van Onze Doelen. Natuurlijk Wil Je Weten Wat Dit – Naast Een Heleboel Werkplezier – Betekent In De Overige Arbeidsvoorwaarden. Bij Ons Kun Je Rekenen Op Een passend salaris van € 3.195,26 tot € 5.199,90 afgestemd op de functie, jouw ervaring en expertise;25 vakantiedagen, aantrekkelijke pensioensregeling met een eigen bijdrage van slechts 3.55%;Opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden;Werken in een gezellig, informeel en ambitieus team;Flexibiliteit in werktijden;De mogelijkheid om thuis te werken (hybride: 50% vanuit huis en 50% op kantoor, maar meer op kantoor werken is natuurlijk ook mogelijk).Samen verder?Ben jij dé Data Engineer waar we naar op zoek zijn en wordt je enthousiast bij het lezen van deze vacature? Solliciteer dan via onze carrière pagina naar de vacature data engineer bij DPD Nederland in Oirschot!Een screening van jouw diploma en een VOG maken onderdeel uit van onze sollicitatieprocedure. Een selectieassessment kan onderdeel uitmaken van de procedure. Heb je vragen over de inhoud van de functie of de wervingsprocedure dan kun je contact opnemen met Irene Keur, corporate recruiter, bereikbaar via 06-29677416.Wie zijn wij?Het moment waarop de bezorger aanbelt met een pakket, is altijd een hoogtepunt. Het dagelijks wereldwijd bezorgen van miljoenen pakketten aan gelukkige ontvangers is onze missie. Dat doen we binnen Geopost, met zo'n 122.000 onbezorgde medewerkers. DPD Nederland is onderdeel van het internationale Geopost, dat weer directe familie is van het Franse Groupe La Poste. En als grootste pakketverzender van Europa verzenden we vrijwel alle landen in de wereld, waarbij we binnen Europa de pakketten verzenden vanuit het eigen netwerk en depots. Daardoor kunnen wij een unieke performance leveren. We bereiken vanaf Eindhoven zelfs in één dag 700 kilometer!DPD Nederland heeft 12 vestigingen en ons hoofdkantoor is gevestigd in Oirschot. Iedere dag zetten onze medewerkers zich in om de klantbelofte waar te maken. Er gaat een indrukwekkend proces schuil gaat achter het bezorgen van pakketten. Onze cultuur kenmerkt zich dan ook door een can-do-mentaliteit. We pakken niet alleen pakketten graag aan, maar ook de uitdaging. De sfeer in onze organisatie is informeel en de communicatielijnen zijn - net als onze bezorgtijden -kort.Innovatie en duurzaamheid zijn centrale thema's binnen de strategie van DPD. We nemen onze verantwoordelijkheid, zowel naar onze klanten als onze collega's en de samenleving waarin we leven. Continu optimaliseren wij onze processen en dienstverlening, dat doen we data gedreven en op innovatieve wijze. Hierbij hechten wij veel waarde aan het samenwerken in de realisatie van onze doelen.Kijk voor meer achtergrondinformatie over onze organisatie op www.dpd.nl.DPD verwerkt persoonsgegevens ten behoeve van het sollicitatieproces. Voor meer informatie, raadpleeg onze privacyverklaring.Acquisitie en doorplaatsing van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld

title: Data Engineer
description: At D2X we are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Amsterdam office. Are you a problem solution-seeker and do you have a genuine desire to craft clean and correct code? Then keep reading!About D2XAt D2X we are driven to become the first regulated derivatives exchange for the digital asset industry in Europe. Our mission is to bridge the gap between Tech and Finance and to facilitate the institutional adoption of digital assets through derivatives. We recently raised our seed funding round, and we are looking for exceptional talents with an entrepreneurial drive and an interest in the digital asset space to join our fast-growing team.Working for D2X means being independent, creative, and adaptive. Our culture of innovation and accountability creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career.Technology at D2XDigital assets trade round-the-clock, 365 days a year. Therefore, we are constantly seeking the most advanced technology to offer a fast and reliable trading interface. Rust allows us to achieve that in a productive way. Developing, testing and optimizing our codebase is the bread and butter of our Engineers.Your ResponsibilitiesData Pipeline Development: Design, implement, and maintain end-to-end data pipelines for collecting, processing, and storing large volumes of financial data from various sources, including market data feeds, trade records, and user activityData Modeling and Warehousing: Develop and optimize data models and data warehousing solutions to support real-time and scheduled analytics, reporting, retention and business intelligence needsScalability and Performance: Architect and manage systems that can handle high-frequency trading data, ensuring low latency and high availability through stages in entity lifetimesInfrastructure Management: Manage and improve data storage, processing, and analytics infrastructure, running both on-premises and in the cloud (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Implement robust monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and resolve data pipeline issues and performance bottlenecksSecurity and Compliance: Ensure data security and compliance with industry and regulatory standardsRequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related fieldProven experience (5+ years) as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced environmentStrong knowledge in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousingExperience with real-time data processing and streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka, Flink)Proficiency in SQL and NoSQL databasesExperience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)Knowledge of financial markets and trading systems is a plusExperience with a Systems Programming Language (e.g. C, C++ or Rust)Excellent problem-solving and communication skillsExperience working collaboratively in a fast-paced, startup environmentBenefitsEnergetic, Collaborative & Fun Work environmentGenerous base salary compensation with bonus post-launchStock Option PlanBike compensated by the company, up to EUR 749Gym membership, up to EUR 35Dynamic, international, innovative, and respectful work environment – employees are at the core, we value every person and encourage initiativePremium office space with rich amenities in AmsterdamHybrid working mode with 4 days a week at the office and 1 day a week from homeWe welcome applicants from all over the world. We believe in diversity and inclusivity and are committed to creating a welcoming and supportive environment for all of our employees. We will support the right candidate with their visa application process. Where applicable, we will provide assistance with the 30% ruling application to help ensure a smooth transition to working and living in the Netherlands.Are you up for the challenge? We would love to get to know you! Apply directly here: https://d2x.bamboohr.com/careers/55

title: Data Engineer
description: Sluit je aan bij onze AI & Data Engineering Squad en help bij het oplossen van complexe bedrijfskundige problemen in de fascinerende wereld van Big Data en Analytics!Wil je deel uitmaken van een divers team met meer dan 20 Data en Machine Learning Engineers en een klantenportfolio met merken als ASML, Shell, IKEA, KLM, SPAR, FC Utrecht en nog veel meer? Sluit je dan aan bij onze AI & Data Engineering Squad!Bij LINKIT vinden we zelfontwikkeling erg belangrijk! We faciliteren kennisdelingssessies tijdens onze tweewekelijkse Club Days, zorgen dat je evenementen en trainingen bij kan wonen, we hebben een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget en 10% van je werktijd ben je niet voor de klant aan het werk, maar ben je samen met jouw collega's om kennis te delen en van elkaar te leren. Je komt te werken in een professionele, laagdrempelige, leuke en innovatieve omgeving waarin je in korte tijd je technische en soft skills verder kunt ontwikkelen!Jouw Purpose & ImpactHet risico op blessures voor topsporters minimaliseren, de e-mobiliteit in de regio verbeteren, voedselverspilling verminderen, enorme besparingen realiseren met predictief onderhoud; dit zijn slechts enkele voorbeelden van waar je aan kan werken. Kortom, onze Data Engineers werken zeker aan betekenisvolle en uitdagende projecten.Wie zoeken we?Technische vaardigheden• Ervaring met het ontwerpen en implementeren van Big Data-technologieën on-premise• Het ontwerpen, bouwen en oplossen van problemen en bewaken van complexe ETL/ELT-pipelines (Batch & Streaming).• Ervaring met het Hadoop-ecosysteem, frameworks/gedistribueerde verwerkingsengines (zoals Spark, Flink en Snowflake), programmeertalen (Java, Scala of Python), containers (k8s) en omgaan met/ het maken van API's is een pré.Niet-technische vaardigheden• Het LINKIT Explorer DNA: nieuwsgierig, onderzoekend en gedreven om jezelf te ontwikkelen.• Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Engineer, of in een vergelijkbare functie.• Bachelor- of masterdiploma in Computer Science, Big Data of Wiskunde is een pré.Wat we biedenEen LINKIT Explorer – Eindeloze mogelijkheden om te evolueren, excelleren en inspireren!Evolve: 10% van je tijd voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en kennisdeling, nog eens 10% voor innovaties, een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget en de mogelijkheid om (internationale) kennisevents te bezoeken.Excel: bereik meesterschap door de begeleiding van onze tech mentoren en betrokkenheid bij een breed scala aan projecten en klanten.Inspire: deel je kennis via presentaties, artikelen, hackathons, open source commitment, word tech mentor voor onze junioren.Salaris & voordelenWinstaandeel.Flexibel pensioentarief.De keuze tussen een leaseauto, of een mobiliteitsbudget en een OV-businesscard.iPhone en MacBook Pro of Microsoft Surface Laptop.Gratis bedrijfslunch.Veel teamevenementen en een wellbeing platform.Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget.25 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld.SamengevatHoera! Het is een match als…Je het leuk vindt om te werken en experimenteren met verschillende tools en concepten voor dataverwerking en data-orkestratie.Je regelmatig je horizon wil verbreden door voor verschillende opdrachtgevers te werken en daarmee nieuwe werkwijzen, perspectieven en nieuwe mensen leren kennen.Over LINKITEen geweldige plek om te werkenLINKIT is een open en informele organisatie waar we streven naar het realiseren van onze doelen en ambities. Mensen zijn gemotiveerd en helpen elkaar en successen worden gevierd. Daarnaast organiseren we graag leuke dingen! Van kook- en yogaworkshops tot mountainbike- of kickboksclinics, fiets- en motortochten, vriendschappelijke padelwedstrijden, voetbaltoernooien, skitrips, retro game-avonden, noem het maar op. Wat je achtergrond of interesse ook is, we staan open voor iedereen.LINKIT is een solution provider en dankzij 25 jaar ervaring een kennisgedreven strategisch IT Partner. Onze IT Squads op het gebied van AI & Data Engineering, Cloud & IoT, Full stack Web development, UX/UI, Low-code en Quality assurance bouwen in-house oplossingen en leveren consultants en teams voor top-500 bedrijven en overheden. Daarmee hebben we een grote diversiteit aan opdrachtgevers en projecten en brede expertise. Kortom, eindeloze kansen en mogelijkheden om jezelf te (blijven) ontwikkelen!Interesse? Solliciteer nu; ontwikkel, excelleer en inspireer bij LINKIT en groei uit tot de ultieme Explorer!

title: Analytics Engineer
description: About The JobAt Salonized, our Data Analytics team is responsible for building a BI platform that helps business teams get access to clean, accurate, well-modeled and intuitive data.As a Analytics Engineer, you will play a key role in shaping our data strategy, owning and improving our modern data stack, and delivering data models to fuel our reporting systems.Our newly formed stack consists of Stitch for data ingestion and dbt Cloud for transformation and orchestration. We store and process the data on AWS redshift, and use Tableau and Hex for reporting.You will be joining an enthusiastic team of analysts, and reporting to one of our Engineering Managers.How You Will Have An ImpactDesign and implement clean, ready-to-use data martsOwn the organisation’s data definitions and make them discoverable and understandable by people outside the data teamWork closely with Finance, Marketing, Growth and product teams to understand and bridge their analytical silosSet the standard for great engineering practices and advocate for data quality, testing and documentationCollaborate with Backend Engineers to ensure that the source data is architected with data in mind, flagging and helping to resolve data discrepanciesWith the help of the Cloud Engineers, monitor the health of our stack and set up observability, monitoring and alerting toolsYour superpowersFull proficiency in SQL and dbtGood understanding of data modeling techniques (preference towards dimensional modeling)Experience with analytical data warehouses (preferably Redshift), including query optimisationExperience working with reporting tools (Tableau/Looker)Comfortable with GitExcellent team player with strong business orientationNice to HaveExperience with Redshift administration (understanding cluster types, performance tuning, access management, cost optimisation)Experience with CI/CD and Github ActionsExperience working in a Cloud Environment (preferably AWS)Experience with a scripting language (preferably Python)Experience with TerraformWhat We OfferA competitive salary based on your experience;Free & delicious lunch every day in the office.Career opportunities and strong stimulation of personal development;MacBook, a Swapfiets (bike) in the city of your choice, and a museum card;Regular (some call it frequent) dinners, drinks, and parties;A yearly retreat with the whole team (oh my!);And to rest: 28 vacation days a year.What you can expect from our hiring process?Resume review: We check your resume to see if you’re a good fit.Video Screening: We get to know you a little better, and you us!Interview: You'll speak with two team members about your background and previous experiences.Case: We'll test your abilities through a practical exercise.Offer: The Salonized team welcomes you!**Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.Apply for this positionAbout UsAt Salonized, we are on a mission to make work beautiful for beauty professionals with our easy-to-use salon software. We believe we can transform the salon experience. Together with around 70 Salonizers, we work hard to create a phenomenal experience for our clients.
