With over 12.000 salons believing in us, we are the market leader in the Benelux. We are already expanding rapidly into new countries, and we’re not done yet. That’s where you come in.Apply for this position

title: Data Engineer
description: Ben jij een gedreven IT engineer met een passie voor data science, open source software en klantrelaties? AXI is op zoek naar een Posit/ Rstudio Engineer om ons team te versterken. Als Full Service Partner (FSP) van Posit zijn wij verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van de Posit-producten binnen organisaties en fungeren wij als de brug tussen business teams, data science teams en IT. We helpen Nederlandse en Belgische organisaties Post-producten te integreren in hun omgeving en hun use cases uit te werken. Vanuit onze Talent Academy zorgen wij ervoor dat jij je talenten als IT-professional maximaal kunt ontwikkelen en inzetten. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jouw kennis up-to-date blijft en je jezelf kunt blijven ontwikkelen. Daarom stellen wij samen met jou een ontwikkelplan op. Je krijgt de kans om kennis en ervaring op te doen en je soft skills verder te boosten. Je leert de nieuwste methodes en tools kennen. Bij AXI werken we agile en op basis van de Scrum methode. Jouw wensen zijn de basis voor jouw persoonlijk ontwikkelplan. Hoe ziet jouw dag eruit? Als Posit Engineer speel je een cruciale rol in het introduceren, installeren en bieden van support op de Posit producten (Posit Workbench, Posit Connect, Posit Package Manager) bij onze klanten. Je helpt onze klanten om het maximale uit deze producten te halen voor hun R/Python Data Science ontwikkeling. Daarnaast ben je ook betrokken bij het uitbouwen van ons partnership met Posit. Als integraal onderdeel van de link tussen business teams, data science teams en IT, zorg je voor een soepele integratie van de Posit producten binnen organisaties. Dit betekent dat je afstemt met Posit specialisten, trainingen rond nieuwe producten en features rechtstreeks bij Posit volgt en meewerkt aan marketing en sales activiteiten om de AXI services rond Posit in de markt te zetten. Als Posit Engineer voer je volgende taken uit: Technische pre-sales calls samen met onze sales waarbij je de behoeften van de klant ontdekt, klanten kwalificeert voor bepaalde producten, en overtuigende uitleg (en demo's) geeft van de producten voor die klanten. Post-sales engineering calls waarbij je potentiële serverconfiguraties en architecturen met klanten bespreekt, klanten helpt met het installatieproces, en best practices en workflows deelt voor het doen van data science in R en Python met behulp van Posit’s Pro Products. Uitwerken van installatieguides met stap-voor-stap instructies voor installatie op linux-omgeving op basis van de Posit documentatie en aangepast naar de specifieke klantnoden Ontwikkeling van R/Python applicaties Bijdragen aan verschillende projecten, zoals het schrijven en onderhouden van documentatie, how-to artikelen, uitwerken van POC’s en demo's van de producten en mogelijkheden met R/Python. Wat kun je van ons verwachten? Naast een leuke, informele en flexibele werkomgeving met een uitgebreid en persoonlijk ontwikkelingstraject via onze AXI Talent Academy en tal van activiteiten voor medewerkers, kan je rekenen op: Naast een leuke, informele en flexibele werkomgeving met tal van activiteiten voor medewerkers, kom je terecht in het #one.axi.team en bieden we jou het volgende: We werken binnen AXI hybride. Dit betekent dat je zowel vanuit onze moderne ingerichte kantoren in Breda, Willebroek, Aartselaar of Gent kan werken of van thuis uit. Ook tijdens het thuiswerken zorgen we voor een comfortabele werkplek. We bieden je een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met een bedrijfsauto en tankkaart. Je komt terecht in een aangename, informele en flexibele werkomgeving. Samen stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan op. Regelmatig volg je opleidingen en workshops vanuit onze AXI Academy. Wat verwachten we van jou? Je technische skills Je hebt een goed begrip van R en/of Python. Je hebt ervaring met Linux en bent bekwaam in het werken met Git, Package Management, DevOps. Interesse in het bouwen en ontwikkelen van R Shiny apps, plumber API's, Python dash apps, python fastapi's. Je bent bekwaam in het definiëren van solution architectuur, netwerkrequirements (proxy, firewall), authenticatie, load balancing. Je soft skills Je bent een teamspeler, analytisch sterk, proactief, en flexibel. Je bent leergierig en ambitieus, met een passie voor Data Science en klantrelaties Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatievaardigheden, zowel in technische ICT-taal als in het overtuigen van zakelijke en niet-ICT-stakeholders. Je hebt ervaring met of bent bereid te leren over productmarketing en salesactiviteiten. Je diploma Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of masteropleiding Informatica of Technische Informatica. Je taalvaardigheid Nederlands en goede kennis van het Engels.

title: Data Engineer
description: Wat ga je doen?Als Data Engineer haal jij je voldoening uit het structureren en automatiseren van data en krijg je energie van het ontwerpen, opzetten, verbeteren en automatiseren van datapijplijnen en dataplatformen. Je zult werken aan boeiende projecten voor zowel middelgrote als grote organisaties.Je analyseert klantprocessen en weet deze te vertalen naar oplossingen binnen de data platforms. Naast dat je over de nodige technische kennis beschikt, ben je communicatief vaardig en in staat om te sparren met niet-technische stakeholders.Je komt te werken binnen een internationale omgeving waarbij er gewerkt wordt met de nieuwste technologieën op het gebied van data engineering, data science en data analytics. Vereiste skills en kennis:Oracle Data Integrator| ETL-Tools | SQL | PL/SQL | SAP Powerdesign | Microsoft SQL Server | Azure-platform | AWS| ERD | Cloud | Python | SSIS | SSAS | SSRS | Agile | Power BI | TableauVerder ben je:- Vloeiend in zowel Nederlands als Engels.- Gedreven om te werken in een dynamische 'scale up' cultuur.- Een communicatief vaardige teamplayer.- Bij voorkeur woonachtig in de omgeving Utrecht.Wat wordt er geboden?- Een uitstekend salaris dat recht doet aan jouw kwaliteiten.- Veel aandacht voor work-life balance, inclusief thuiswerkfaciliteiten.- 27 vakantiedagen- Een mobiliteitsregeling (lease auto of vergoeding) - Een ruim opleidingsbudget om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen.- Een pensioensregeling boven marktniveauKlaar om de toekomst van data vorm te geven? Solliciteer nu en zet de volgende stap in je carrière als data engineer.

title: Data Engineer
description: Heb je verstand van de techniek achter data-gedreven werken? Ben je bekend met data engineering-tools en/of data platformen? Dan ben jij onze nieuwe Data Engineer!De functieWe zijn op zoek naar Data Engineers die ervaring hebben met het realiseren van (cloud gebaseerde) data driven oplossingen. Als Data Engineer overzie je processen en kun je deze vertalen naar oplossingen binnen (cloud) data platformen. Je adviseert en werkt in teams om technische oplossingen te realiseren. Je vindt het leuk om nieuwe technologieën te ontdekken, verder te verkennen en deze te delen met je collega’s en opdrachtgevers.Jouw profielAfgeronde HBO of WO opleidingAnalytisch en pragmatischKennis Azure, AWS of SplunkKennis van SQL en/of PythonKennis van data modellering en data logistiekHands-on ervaring bij BI projectenGoede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel in woord als geschriftPersoonlijkheidJe beschikt over goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden en vindt het interessant om technische uitdagingen aan te gaan. Binnen uiteenlopende projecten maakt jouw vakmanschap het verschil. Daarnaast ben je proactief ingesteld en werk je graag in teamverband. Verder vinden wij het ook belangrijk dat je jezelf kunt herkennen in onze kernwaarden: People, Fun, Technology, Knowledge, Aim high en Open & Involved.ALTEN biedtSamen gaan wij op zoek naar een uitdagende opdracht, waarin jouw groei centraal staat en jouw kwaliteiten het best naar voren komen. Daarnaast geloven wij dat je als IT’er nooit bent uitgeleerd en daarom krijg je bij ons de mogelijkheid om je zowel persoonlijk als vakinhoudelijk verder te ontwikkelen. Onze consultants organiseren bijvoorbeeld regelmatig kennisavonden over nieuwe technologieën, waaraan jij kunt deelnemen. Of misschien vindt jij het zelf leuk om met je collega’s een kennisavond te organiseren?Als jij de gesprekken net zo leuk als wij hebt ervaren, dan krijg je een vast contract. De volgende stap is het uitzoeken van een telefoon en auto. Wij maken je laptop gereed en je bent klaar om aan de slag te gaan. Hard werken wordt bij ons beloond met een goed salaris en een bonus, maar relaxen vinden wij net zo belangrijk, dus krijg je van ons 27 vakantiedagen. Niet genoeg? Dan kun je er nog 10 bij kopen. Over je pensioen hoef je je geen zorgen te maken, dat regelen wij voor je (premievrije pensioenregeling).Met je mentor en Business Manager ga jij je nieuwe avontuur aan en krijg je vanuit ons de juiste begeleiding. Samen zorgen wij ervoor dat jij je ambities kunt verwezenlijken.ALTENALTEN IT maakt onderdeel uit van ALTEN Nederland en is gespecialiseerd in consultancy op het gebied van BI en Analytics, Software Development, Softwaretesten, Agile, Cloud en Internet-of-Things en dit binnen verschillende branches. Bij ons kom je terecht in een divers en hecht team, dat zich bezig houdt met de laatste ontwikkelingen.Onze klanten bevinden zich in de top 100 van Nederland. De klantenkring varieert van overheden en energiemaatschappijen tot financiële instellingen, zakelijke dienstverleners, hightech bedrijven en telecomproviders.Wij bieden volop uitdagingen. Solliciteer daarom nu om deel uit te maken van ons gezellige team!InformatieNeem voor meer informatie vrijblijvend contact op met een van onze Corporate Recruiters: regio Zuid (locatie Eindhoven) via +31(0)40-256 3080. Je kunt ook een e-mail sturen naar: sollicitatie@alten.nl

title: Data Scientist
description: Role -Data ScientistLocation - Utrecht, NetherlandsJob Description: STEM education, with a preference for econometrics or mathematics.Experience with Python, knowledge of Java and PySpark is an advantage.Experience with data and data products (e.g. data management, data analyses, artificial intelligence, machine learning, forecasting, dashboaring).Knowledge and experience within the financial sector and specifically in the field of the Customer Integrity domain is an advantage for those moving up.

title: Data Scientist
description: I am currently working with an Agritech scale up, who are on the look out for an experienced data scientist to join their growing team in Amsterdam. They are innovating in the field of vertical farming and autonomous greenhouses, with the aim of solving global food insecurityResponsibilities:You will play a vital role in development and implementation of data science strategy and use data to improve organizational growth, continuous improvements and iterations.Be a part of the main link between the business, customers and technology solutions by providing valuable insights through modelling and transforming datasets to help us make decisions and build customer solutions.Lead the strategic design, delivery and maintenance of the data science work that give meaningful insights on our performance, support the company's priorities and accelerate innovation.Have end-to-end ownership of data science work and lead alignment on all solutions developed through collaboration.Help build a data-driven culture within through data science workRequirements:- Strong knowledge of Python- Professional working experience within data science (2+ years of experience)- Experience with machine learning models is essential- Experience with the agriculture sector is beneficial but not required- Willingness to work with or previous experience in sensor dataSalary Package:• Up to €95,000 per annum (D.O.E)• Travel allowance• Hybrid working and the ability to work remotely for 4 weeks of the year• Annual bonus. (usually 5-8%!)• Pension scheme and 25 days of holiday (possibility to buy extra days)Feel free to apply below, or contact me on the following:Phone: +31203997864Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

title: Python Engineering & Machine Learning Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clientsYour teamYou will work closely with Aaron who leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. The data science team consists of two more data scientists, Rihab and Anna.Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models. Anna is specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will work with our Lead data scientist and DevOps engineer to manage our deployment processYou will maintain the libraries and codebase of our production recommender service. You will help us strengthen the machine learning processes on multiple cloud platforms and assist in training models. You will assist the data science team in developing internal tools for both prototyping and experimentationRequirementsIs this you?You have studied in a field like computer science, data science, or other quantitative fieldsYou are very comfortable in Python and enjoy optimising codeYou have a demonstrated ability to create applications using python web frameworks such as Flask or DjangoYou are familiar with PostgreSQL or similarYou have a demonstrable knowledge of Docker and comfortable with GitYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeExperience with KubernetesFamiliar with deployment on GCP or AzureCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting!Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Data Scientist
description: DATA SCIENTIS WI-FI AND SMART HOME POSITIONFreelancer: 40 hours per week for a period of at least 6 months.Permanent: 40 hours per week LOCATIONFreelancer: Connect with us from anywhere in the world, as long as you groove to the rhythm of Amsterdam's dynamic timezone.Permanent: Join us in the vibrant heart of Amsterdam, Netherlands, where innovation meets tradition. ABOUT GAMGEE Based in the lively city of Amsterdam, Netherlands, Gamgee is a trailblazing user experience firm at the intersection of technology and innovation. Our mission is to empower users through our digital platform, allowing them to effortlessly manage their wireless networks, smart devices, internet access, parental controls, and cybersecurity measures. But that's just the beginning! We also offer identity protection, robust work-from-home solutions, and smart home monitoring and automation services. With Gamgee by your side, taking control of the digital realm has never been more intuitive or accessible. COMPANY CULTURE AND VALUES At Gamgee, we're committed to putting our customers at the forefront of everything we do. Our promise is to deliver an exceptional personal experience in the world of smart homes. We're all about simplifying complex technologies into user-friendly solutions, designed to enhance everyday living while fostering a profound sense of safety and tranquility. We're not just a tech company; we're a partner in the journey to a smarter, safer, and more connected home. JOB SUMMARY Ready to embark on a transformative journey with us? Gamgee is searching for a talented Data Scientist to join our passionate team. As we lead the charge in reshaping the smart home landscape, you'll play a pivotal role in harnessing Wi-Fi sensing data to create groundbreaking algorithms. These algorithms will not only redefine home security but also empower fall detection, pet and child monitoring, home automation, and so much more. Your work will be pivotal in realizing our vision of a smarter, safer, and more connected world. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Channel your expertise in DNN, RNN, and CNN to create, refine, and evolve AI algorithms that will drive our innovative applications.Craft algorithms for motion detection, localisation, categorisation, and assigning motions to people, pets, objects, and more.Collaborate seamlessly with cross-functional teams, including Wi-Fi specialists, to ensure your innovations seamlessly integrate into our product offerings.Be at the forefront of developing advanced solutions for home security and automation. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Bring your 2 to 5 years of expertise to the table, preferably in a similar role.Master the art of AI/ML, and if you have an inkling of Wi-Fi enthusiasm, all the better.Your ability to communicate and your business acumen are as sharp as your algorithms. EXPERIENCE: 2 TO 5 YEARS, PREFERABLY COLLABORATION You're not just joining a team; you're joining a movement. We embrace Agile Scrum methodologies, fostering innovation collaboratively. While you’ll have the independence to excel in your tasks, you’ll also be an integral part of a team that includes Wi-Fi specialists – experts you can rely on for their domain knowledge. TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES Python is your primary instrument, as your algorithms will be embedded in router software. Proficiency in other relevant programming languages is a plus.Dive into structured and unstructured data, and utilize industry reference data to unlock the full potential of your algorithms. REPORTING You'll report directly to the visionary CEO of Gamgee. APPLICATION PROCES AND CONTACT INFORMATION Ready to embark on this exciting journey? Send your resume and a captivating cover letter to hr@gamgee.com. At Gamgee, we move fast, so expect two or three rounds of interviews within an exhilarating 2-week timeframe. For inquiries and applications, please contact hr@gamgee.com to start your vibrant career adventure with us. Your journey to shaping the future of smart homes begins here!

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Company DescriptionwearM.AI is a high-tech spin-off company that develops innovative wearable devices for improved muscle health in sports and daily life. The company focuses on creating easy-to-use devices that provide personalized training and real-time monitoring. wearM.AI is based in Enschede and offers a dynamic and creative work environment.Role DescriptionThis is a contract position (towards a full-time job) for a Machine Learning Engineer who specializes in Computer Vision. you will be responsible for designing and implementing machine learning algorithms and developing pattern recognition models. The role is located in Enschede but allows for remote work.QualificationsStrong background in Computer Vision, Statistics, and AlgorithmsExperience with Neural Networks and Deep Learning architecturesExperience in applying machine learning techniques to Human Pose Estimation.Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or C++Exposure to model optimization and deployment techniquesExcellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independentlyStrong communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teamsPhD or Master's degree in a related field is preferredImportant Dates:Application deadline: 31st December 2023.Starting dates: February 2024 (no later than May 2024).Duration of this contract: 9 months (can transfer to a full-time job based on the performance).Application Please send your CV and a short list (with descriptions) of your past project experiences to: info@wearm.ai

title: Data scientist
description: FunctiebeschrijvingAls Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten & onderhouden van het Datawarehouse van een mobiele app. Hierin heb je zowel een strategische als uitvoerende rol en ben je degene die overkoepelend kijkt naar mogelijkheden om data steeds slimmer in te zetten ten behoeve van relevantie voor de users van de app. Deze rol geeft jou als ervaren Data Engineer de mogelijkheid in samenwerking met de verschillende development teams tot gezamenlijke inzichten te komen en het datawarehouse verder op te zetten en aan te sluiten op de dagelijkse activiteiten van de app. Het datawarehouse is een belangrijke spil waarin data van veel verschillende bronnen samenkomen om de verschillende use cases binnen de app te ondersteunen. De engineer is bij uitstek iemand die vanuit de verschillende doelen/use cases de vertaling kan maken naar de technische invulling en hierbij zowel bronnen in front- als back end aan elkaar weet aan te sluiten. Wat ga je doen?Je onderhoudt en sluit verschillende (interne) bronnen (zowel front- als back end bronnen) aan;je creëert een toekomstvaste visie met betrekking tot inzetten van data; je koppelt de warehouse aan verschillende web en app omgevingen.Wie ben jij? Ervaring met het onderhouden van een data warehouse & data pipeline architectuur (binnen AWS) Ervaring met gangbare tooling in data: Airflow, dbt, Metabase, PowerBI, Redis, e.a. Ervaring met het opzetten van complexe ETL pipelines en orchestration van deze ETL processen (binnen AWS) Ervaring met AWS (specifiek: Redshift, Aurora Serverless, DynamoDB, & RErvaring met CI/CD processen (Pre) gecertificeerd: AWS Certified Data Analytics – Specialty Wat bieden wij jou? De mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen (professioneel en persoonlijk) via ons Live your potential programma. Dit is een aanrader voor zowel starters als ervaren professionals;een competitief salaris;100% reiskostenvergoeding met het openbaar vervoer, € 0,21 cent per kilometer met de auto;een internationale omgeving en diversiteit;pensioenopbouw direct bij aanvang van je opdracht;25 vakantiedagen per jaar.Een brutomaandsalaris tussen €4.250,- en €4.950,- op basis van een 40-urige werkweekInteresse in deze vacature? Solliciteer via deze pagina, of neem direct contact op met recruiter Sara Carlos Campos via s.carloscampos@wearekayak.com of 0629677665.

title: Junior Data Scientist
description: Als Junior Data Scientist kom je te werken bij één van de grootste ingenieursadviesbureaus van Nederland. Dit bedrijf heeft ruim 2.000 medewerkers, verspreidt over 5 locaties en richt zich op grote infrastructurele projecten. Hierbij kan gedacht worden aan projecten op het gebied van (rail)infrastructuur, mobiliteit, ruimte, water en energie.Als Junior Data Scientist maak je onderdeel uit van de adviesgroep dat zich bezighoudt met een diverse scope aan civiel technische vraagstukken. Dit zijn veelal vraagstukken met een forse schaalgrootte gerelateerd aan dynamische problemen. Hierbij kan bijvoorbeeld gedacht worden aan trillingsvraagstukken. Je zal dan ook dagelijks worden uitgedaagd om jouw analytische vaardigheden ten volle te benutten! Als Junior Data Scientist voer je complexe analyses en berekeningen uit op basis van zelf gebouwde modellen en kan je de volgende werkzaamheden verwachten: Je gaat je bezighouden met het verzamelen van data omtrent een klantspecifiek vraagstuk met behulp van de door jou gebouwde modellenJe zal naar buiten gaan voor het uitvoeren van metingen in het veldJe bent bezig met het bruikbaar maken van verzamelde dataJe zal je analytische skills loslaten op de dataJe zult je bezighouden met het valideren van modelberekeningenTot slot zal je adviesrapporten opstellen op basis van de door jou verzamelde gegevens.Als Junior Data Scientist moet je voldoen aan de volgende eisen:Je hebt een afgeronde WO opleiding in een sterk technische richting zoals Applied Physics, Civiele techniek, Mechanical Engineering of soortgelijkJe bent communicatief goed vaardigJe hebt sterke affiniteit met automatiserenJe beheerst zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal

title: Sustainability Data Scientist
description: About OlamOlam Agri supplies food, feed and fibre to meet rising demand and a shift to protein-based diets, particularly in Asian and African countries. Headquartered in Singapore and present on all continents, our value chains include farming, processing and distribution operations, as well as a sourcing network of an estimated 2.5 million farmers. Our teams have built leadership positions in many Olam Agri businesses, including rice, flour, animal feed, sesame, cotton, wood, and more. As a purpose-driven company, we aim to contribute positively to the prosperity and well-being of people along our supply chains, the protection and regeneration of our natural resource base, and the fight against climate change.Role OverviewThe global climate crisis requires us to reduce global GHG to net-zero emissions by 2050 in line with the Paris 1.5 agreement; to do so whilst feeding 10 billion people sustainably and ensuring inclusive growth, is the greatest challenge of our lifetime. With some 2.5 million farmers and 10 million hectares in our supply chains, and our on-the-ground ground presence -- throughout grower programmers, our farms and processing units, and our supply and distribution networks -- OGA businesses can make a tangible, positive impact for people, nature and the climate. As part of the Corporate Responsibility & Sustainability department, you will ensure that the company accurately and transparently reports on its environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance. You will also play a key role in helping Olam Agri measure its impact and integrate sustainability considerations across its businesses and operations. The responsibilities of the Sustainability Data Scientist / Researcher will includeDesigning studies to support sustainability programming and risk management.Identifying and building alignment around the key questions to answer and metrics to measure, to help the company achieve its sustainability goals and drive decision-making.Developing metrics, methodologies, surveys and tools for measuring sustainability baseline, outputs and impactsTopics may include, inter alia, farmer incomes, food security, drivers of farm yields, women’s empowerment, child labor, post-harvest loss, deforestation, carbon emissions. Collecting and analyzing dataCollating and analyzing data related to Olam Agri’s ESG performance and impact.Generating insights from large amounts of data and developing practical systems for relevant business users to access and visualize data insights. Guidance, training and quality control Training and guiding workstream leads and survey enumerators.Ensuring quality study design and analysis conducted within team’s workstream. Communication & disclosuresCollect, Analyse and prepare data for sustainability reporting, considering reporting standards such as GRI, TCFD, SASB/ISSB, and CDP.Keep up to date with the latest developments and best practices in sustainability impact measurement, reporting and disclosures.Supporting responses to inquiries from banks and investors Continually improving data processesIdentifying opportunities to automate data collection and management and improving online systems.Advancing supply chain traceability, in collaboration with finance, IT and commercial departmentsMaintaining documentation of processes and methodologies around data collection, ESG metrics/indicators and calculation methodologies The candidate will collaborate with a wide range of internal stakeholders for the execution of the above, including the CSO, CR&S unit leads) environment, social, governance and partnerships), business managers, IT, Internal Audit, Risk, Finance and Human Resources.QualificationsA personal passion for sustainable agriculture and food systemsExcellent data sourcing and analysis capabilitiesA good eye for designing clear and impactful graphical visualizations of data insights.Strong & clear communication and presentation skillsFamiliarity with in ESG reporting frameworks, social impact measurement, carbon footprint accounting, and survey design.University degree related to data analytics, statistics, internal audit or another relevant domain.10+ years of relevant experience, such as in ESG reporting, monitoring & evaluation, sustainability audits or ESG risk analysis

title: Data Scientist
description: Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.Role Overview:Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.Skills and Qualifications:Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great assetOffered:Competitive salary: up to €55,000Pension scheme for financial security€30 net gym budget for well-beingSwappfiets subscription for convenient commuting25 days of holiday leave for work-life balanceHybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

title: Data Scientist AI
description: CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.Wat breng jij mee?Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;Een geldig rijbewijs B.Wat bieden wij?Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;€ 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: WHY CHOOSE ENECO?Eneco has the ambition to lead the energy transition. We excel in the complete chain from energy producing assets to serving customers. This integrated approach connects all Eneco employees and enables us to fulfil our mission. You can feel it throughout the whole organisation, and it leads to multidisciplinary innovations such as Toon, e-Mobility and our Virtual Power Plant.You are going to work at a company large enough to effect real change, within a digital department that has the flexibility to rival a start-up. Our organization is open and brimming with energy. At Eneco, anyone with a sharp mind and a positive and active mindset can contribute to a more sustainable world.Create data driven innovations, services, and products for the whole company.In Eneco’s digital data science team you will set up data-driven solutions together with other business units. This means you can work on a wide variety of topics on the commercial and the operational side of Eneco, as well as the integration between those two. On the commercial side, this can mean advising customers on sustainable investments based on energy use and building characteristics. On the operational side, improving efficiency of district heating or implementing predictive maintenance for wind turbines can be your next subjects. As an integrated energy company, Eneco is also always looking for innovative solutions to integrate supply and demand. In all these projects, adding value both for the customer and for Eneco is key.Energy companies have large amounts of data available to work with, and Eneco is a leader in this field, for example from our smart thermostat Toon. The big question is: how will you leverage this data? Distributed energy generation and changes in energy demand have upended the conventional market for energy. Digital innovations help to align supply and demand and help the customer have a care-free experience; data plays a crucial part in all this.YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FORIdentify problems that can be solved using data science and turn those into impactful projects.Test and develop your ideas through hackathons, prototypes, and pilots all the way up to a working product or service.Interact with business stakeholders, data analysts, machine learning and data engineers to balance commercial requirements with engineering best practices.Convey the data science way of working within the organization.Pragmatic and iterative approach to data science: able to quickly show results to convince the business, rather than wanting to apply the most complex algorithms.WHAT YOU BRING You can easily adapt to new environments and situations. You have focus, courage and a “can do” attitude. You use these qualities to obtain the goals that you set for yourself in an ever-changing professional environment.MSc in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) field.4+ years of experience working as a data scientist within a company.Knowledge of common data science techniques and statistical methods.Strong oral and written presentation skills in English.An interest in the energy domain and innovations therein, and a curious mindset.Ability to independently drive data science projects and to inspire and guide more junior data scientists.Fluent in Python and SQL, experience with Azure, MLFlow, AirFlow and Databricks is a plus.WE HAVE A LOT TO OFFERA gross salary between €69.000,00 - €103.000,00 (annual salary including 8% holiday allowance for a full-time contract), depending on knowledge and experience.A free spendable flex budget of 6% per on top of your monthly salary, for example to buy extra vacation days or have it paid out.An annual bonus of 12%.Public transport card, also privately sustainable on the road, with which you also travel for free in your free time throughout the Netherlands.Parental leave, good pension scheme and career opportunities.Hybrid working; you will work 40% in the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide where best to work.Drive data driven decision making to build innovative digital productsHelp Eneco and its customers become climate neutral by 2035YOUR TEAMYou will work in Eneco’s digital data science team with CDO. The digital data science team’s mission is threefold:1) Set up and collaborate in projects that span multiple products in a product Family.2) Enable other data scientists by supplying technology and a consistent way of working in the Data Science Squad.INTERESTED?Do you see yourself working as a data scientist at Eneco and do you dare take up the challenge to extend the leading position of Eneco in the energy transition? Then you should apply for this position! Do you want to know more about this vacancy at Eneco? Kaustav Basu is the manager of the team; he will gladly answer your questions. You can contact him at +31 (0)6-26-46-82-96.An EU work permit is required to qualify for this position.

title: AI Developer
description: As an AI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing artificial intelligence solutions to improve business processes, enhance decision-making capabilities, and drive innovation. You will work collaboratively with a team of experts to create cutting-edge AI solutions that meet the needs and requirements of our organization. Your expertise and knowledge in AI will play a key role in building internal and external capabilities.Essential Duties:Design and develop machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems and improve decision-making processes.Develop robust data engineering solutions to ingest, preprocess, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data for AI applications.Train AI models using various techniques such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning, and deploy them to production environments.Continuously refine and optimize AI solutions to improve accuracy, performance, and scalability, and minimize resource usage.Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to translate business requirements into AI models and solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.Keep abreast of advancements in the field of AI, including new algorithms, frameworks, and tools, and evaluate their potential for enhancing existing systems or developing new solutions.Requirements:Proficiency in programming (e.g., Python) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).Strong mathematical foundation (linear algebra, calculus, statistics).Knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.Data preprocessing and feature engineering skills.Experience with cloud platforms and model deployment.Full fluency in Dutch is preferred.Minimum Bachelor degree education.What DevOn Offers: Unlimited holidaysChallenging assignments with several market leadersCar allowance, laptop and mobile phoneWeekly knowledge sessions with colleaguesTraining budget of €3.000 per year to become even more knowledgeable.Open work culture, lean hierarchy, work-life balance, no micromanagement, new-niche technology.Growth opportunities in a fast-moving, innovative organization.Learning by expert training, meet up sessions & in-house certified trainer-certifications. About DevOn:DevOn is a global technology company at the forefront of leading DevOps transformations and setting up High Performance Distributed DevOps teams with leading companies worldwide. DevOn helps market leaders to take the next step in software delivery. We consist of dynamic teams, in which personal growth is central to our organizations success.Within DevOn you get the chance to realize your ambition, in any direction. Do you really want to develop your knowledge and be known as a guru in the market? Or do you want to be more entrepreneurial and start your own team? You choose!To learn more, visit - https://devon.global

title: Data Scientist at Chapter Data
description: Data Scientist at Chapter DataRequirements2–4 years of experienceA Master’s degree, preferably in a field like Econometrics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Data Science, or MathematicIntermediate programming skills in Matlab, Python, R, Julia, or SQL (“Hello world” won’t cut it)Familiarity with technologies like Pyspark, Scikit-learn, Pytorch, Tensorflow, or TidyverseAmbition, curiosity and a willingness to dig deep and ask the right questionsAs a Data Scientist at Chapter Data, you’ll Fast-Track your career while working with our diverse clients, of different sizes, and at various levels of data maturity. You’ll help them navigate the future and uncover insights that were previously hidden by answering questions ‘What is going to happen next?’ and subsequently, ‘How do we make that happen?’Chapter Data: Supercharge your professional Growth As a Data Science professional, what you want more than anything is to learn and to grow. At Chapter Data we strongly believe that one-on-one coaching, tailored to your personality and growth goals, works better than any cookie-cutter trainee program — in getting you to that next step as fast as possible.Our clients and their challenges Our clients and their work can range from the Dutch market leader in online shopping Bol.com, exciting fintech companies building innovative solutions in the financial industry, to one of the world’s most famous, socially and environmentally responsible FMGC brands at Ben & Jerry’s. What they all have in common, is that they need help with identifying and tapping into the true value of the data available in their company. And to do so in the most innovative, ethical, and sustainable way.We help them create a company-wide Data Strategy, build their engineering and Data Analytics capacity, and to implement a truly Data-driven culture and ditto leadership. And that’s where you come in.The challenge and environment for you As a Data Scientist at Chapter Data, your findings will help our diverse clients develop insights and recommendations that solve complex business problems. On a practical level, you’ll develop your capability to collect, clean, enrich, and analyze data.You will create state-of-the-art machine learning models, often using large and complex data sets, and you’ll sharpen and leverage your programming skills to take these models into production yourself.On the consultancy and strategy side, you’ll learn how to present insights and recommendations to various stakeholders, at all different levels. You’ll help clients navigate the future by answering questions such as ‘What’s going to happen next?’ and ‘How do we make it happen?’ — and you’ll help uncover insights that were previously hidden. With your input, our clients can stay on top of their game.You’ll do all of this with one-on-one coaching and on-the-job learning, from a very experienced senior Data Scientist; our co-founder Sander Klinkenberg.Fast-Track your Data Science CareerTaking up the role of Data Scientist at Chapter Data really means pushing your career forward. Especially if you have or are currently developing both the technical knowledge and the business acumen that a great Data Scientist needs. If you’re a junior or medior Data Scientist who really wants to take the next step and wants to put in the effort to get it — this can be a great opportunity to put your career trajectory on the Fast Track. Apply now?Sounds like the next step for you? Contact Daan Bouman to express your interest – and let’s set up an introductory call to get acquainted.

title: Data Scientist
description: Wij zoeken jou als Data Scientist bij Transavia Voor ons Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team bij Transavia zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist. Als Data Scientist ontwikkel je een brede range aan advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen: van recommenders tot forecasting modellen en decision support tools. Heb jij een passie voor slimme modellen en optimalisatie strategieën? Ben jij gedreven om de business nog slimmer te laten werken en klanten beter te servicen met advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen? Dan ben jij mogelijk de Data Scientist naar wie wij op zoek zijn!Wat ga je doen?Je werkt aan AI, Machine Learning en Optimization oplossingen voor de verschillende domeinen binnen Transavia. Denk aan marketing & sales, revenue management, planning & scheduling, technische dienst, het operations control center, etc. Samen met een Data Analyst en/of Engineer vertaal je de doelstellingen van het AI/ML product door in data (kwaliteits)vereisten en een opzet voor het experiment/prototype of nieuwe release. Samen met de Data Engineers werk je aan de data en machine learning pipelines om het model in productie te kunnen zetten in onze Microsoft Azure cloud omgeving. De resultaten deel je (tussentijds) middels visuals en dashboards. Met andere woorden, je werkt aan de AI/ML oplossingen van begin tot eind: van concept, ontwikkeling en implementatie tot beheer en monitoring van de tools in productie; van MVP/prototype tot verschillende opvolgende releases. Zo optimaliseren we flight schedules, automatiseren we real time aanbevelingen voor klanten, forecasten we de benodigde crew standby en call center bezetting of bedenken we hoe we ons netwerk en vluchtschema kunnen optimaliseren.Je zal onderdeel uitmaken van Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI). Dit team is opgericht om Transavia naar een hoger niveau te brengen in Data & Analytics. SDI leidt de transformatie naar het data-gedreven werken, adviseert afdelingen aan de hand van informatie en inzichten, en bouwt aan data- en AI-oplossingen voor klanten en medewerkers van Transavia. Naast Data Scientists bestaat het team uit de Lead SDI, Lead Data Scientist, Analytics Translators, Data Engineers, Data Analysts en Business Consultants. Je zal veel samenwerken met jouw SDI collega’s, de business en onze (data) collega’s bij Transavia Frankrijk.Wie ben jij? Je herkent je in onze waarden: daadkrachtig, bevlogen, verantwoordelijk en vriendelijk, én je hebt dat “tikkeltje lef”;Je hebt een WO-diploma in een business analytics, econometrie, (toegepaste) wiskunde of een andere data science gerelateerde studie en minimaal 5 jaar relevante ervaring in een data science positie;Je bent beschikbaar voor minimaal 32 uur per week;Je spreekt en schrijft Nederlands en Engels.Als Data Scientistheb je data science kennis (vanuit zowel de theorie als praktijk) op het gebied van advanced analytics, machine learning, , statistics, data visualization, software engineering, model interpretation, etc;heb je kennis van verschillende AI/ML best practices en ben je continu op zoek hoe je de kwaliteit van onze producten kan verbeteren (en hoe dit breed in het team toegepast kan worden);ben je in staat om deze kennis op anderen (mede Data Scientists) over te brengen;heb je uitgebreide ervaring met Python en veelgebruikte packages (bijv. Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pyspark, etc.) of soortgelijke programmeertalen;heb je ervaring met het in productie brengen van data science modellen (MLOps);kun je goed overweg met SQL, Git en CLI en (Azure) Cloud; gebruik je deze kennis om een probleem uit de business te vertalen naar een wiskundige en technische oplossing;kun je problemen, maar ook kansen identificeren en begrijpen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om je data om te zetten in een concreet advies waar jij zelf, of het team, mee aan de slag kan;werk je agile. Wat je ontdekt, pas je gelijk toe.Wat kun je van ons verwachten?Werken voor dé nummer 1 budgetluchtvaartmaatschappij;Vrijheid om je functie naar eigen inzicht vorm te geven;Veel ruimte en initiatieven voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling;22 verlof- en 4 adv dagen o.b.v. een fulltime dienstverband;Vriendelijke en bevlogen collega’s; Persoonlijk budget voor jouw duurzame inzetbaarheid en vitaliteit;Last but not least; ben je reislustig, dan is onze IPB regeling (tegen mooie tarieven vliegen indien plaats beschikbaar) zeker de moeite waard!Afhankelijk van ervaring wordt deze vacature geschaald in functiegroep 10 of 11. Dit betekent dat wij op basis van kennis en ervaring een aanbieding doen tussen de €3.680,- en €6.222,- bruto per maand.Over TransaviaWe zetten graag een stap extra voor onze passagiers en voor elkaar. De sfeer in de organisatie kenmerkt zich door bevlogen medewerkers met een groen hart! Iedere dag werken we met elkaar samen om een gemeenschappelijk doel te behalen; een memorabele klantbeleving.Als zelfstandige airline binnen de AIR FRANCE-KLM Groep verzorgen wij al 55 jaar lijndiensten en chartervluchten naar meer dan 150 bestemmingen in Europa en Noord-Afrika. Transavia, onderdeel van de AIR FRANCE KLM Group, is de nummer één budgetluchtvaartmaatschappij en qua grootte de tweede airline van Nederland. Bij Transavia werken gemiddeld 2500 collega’s: 230 bij de Technische Dienst, 600 vliegers, 1300 cabin attendants en 370 kantoormedewerkers.Transavia is een dynamische organisatie (never a dull moment) die continu probeert bij te blijven in een veranderende luchtvaartwereld. Wil jij graag werken in een omgeving met enthousiaste daadkrachtig collega’s die oog hebben voor elkaar? Krijg je energie van verandering en vernieuwing en voel jij je het prettigst in een omgeving waar je regisseur bent van je eigen werk? Dan komen we graag met jou in contact.Is deze functie jou op het lijf geschreven en wil je solliciteren?Ben jij de Data Scientist die wij zoeken en kom je ons team versterken? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button. Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact met ons op via recruitment@transavia.com.Jouw sollicitatieprocedureJe solliciteert op de vacature! Binnen twee weken bekijken wij je sollicitatie en hoor je of wij je uitnodigen voor een gesprek;Eerste contact: Wij bellen je om kennis te maken en een afspraak in te plannen;Het eerste gesprek: Er volgt een eerste (online) gesprek met potentiële collega’s;Is er een match? Dan volgt een technisch (online) assessment;Indien succesvol, plannen wij graag nog een laatste gesprek met andere collega’s;Is de match compleet? Dan doen we je met veel plezier een voorstel en begint jouw reis bij Transavia! Wel moet je wegens (luchtvaart)veiligheidseisen eerst een screening doorlopen en maakt een antecedentenonderzoek deel uit van de procedure.Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen voor deze vacature als Data Scientist bij Transavia? Bedankt, maar hier gaan we niet op in. We werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: ML Engineer Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your ML engineering career with our advanced training program. We fully pay this program as well as your salary. Your job? Working as a ML(ops) engineer at one of our clients like Lely, ING, ASML or KLM on challenging projects. What kind of projects?✅ Help data-driven teams to build production-ready, scalable machine learning systems✅ Productionizing machine learning models✅ Maintain and improve automated ML pipelines and ML experimentation infrastructure focusing on scalability, usability, and performance The role itself· 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you’ll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, ML(ops) engineering and cloud fundamentals· Work 4 days a week as a ML(ops) Engineer at one of our clients like Heineken, Rabobank, ASML, Lely, FedEx, Vattenfall· Join us every Thursday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam/ on remote. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads· At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly As a ML(ops) Engineer you will work together with other medior- and senior team members on challenging projects for our clients. In these projects you will work on data science & ML related topics, such as predictive software solutions, fraud detection or data engineering challenges such as building data pipelines, developing on cloud architectures and productionizing machine learning models.Besides this, you like big data tools and programming frameworks to ensure that the raw data gathered from data pipelines are used to build production-ready scalable applications driven by data and AI. About XcceleratedXccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career. Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same. Or as Nikki, our ML engineer says: “The skills I learned at Xccelerated are incredibly valuable – I use them every day at work. After the bootcamp, I had the feeling that I wanted to rewrite all my previous projects”. This is youFrom a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality. You focus on results, have a desire to complete challenging tasks and learn while doing. Next to this, you have: ✅ A technical bachelor’s or master’s degree (e.g. Data Science, Econometrics, Artificial Intelligence)✅ 2-4 years of work experience as a ML Engineer or Data scientist✅ Statistical knowledge but are mainly experienced with end to end systems and able to run, deploy and monitor them✅ Knowledge of open-source technologies like Spark, Kafka, Airflow or Kubernetes What Xccelerated offers 💰 Good salary🛫 25 vacation days📙 Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training📊 Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)✅ Challenging assignments💻 Macbook and Iphone🍎 Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar🎒Flexibility in working from home & at the office Interested? We’d love to meet you! Please get in touch! Contact Samantha Alves Goncalves at sgoncalves@xccelerated.io or by phone at 0613889770. Application Process · First interview with one of our recruitment consultants (Samantha or Jessie)· Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote) **We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

title: Data Science Specialist
description: Our client is a top player in the Dutch finance market, providing their clients with data models and predictive analyses on investments, risk mitigation, security/fraud and environmental impact. They work with most big banks and financial institutions in the Netherlands, where they have their teams build the necessary models (usually of the complexity the clients cannot solve themselves). Sometimes the complexity is translating of business problems to the actual data solutions, sometimes the complexity is in the solution itself, the mass of the data, the regulations, etc.We are looking for Seniors and Managers, experienced Data Scientists / Consultants that can bring something extra. Of course, your bread and butter will be in the projects and working on Data Science challenges as described above, but next to this there is a variety of roles/domains where you can contribute within the organization. Think about managing a small team, taking on project management tasks, helping to scale the organization, inspire/mentor juniors, etc.The sky is the limit, and the company can create roles accustomed to the interests you have as a senior in the field!We are looking for experienced people who bring:At least 5+ years’ experience within the Data Science field.Strong Python and SQL skills as a bare minimum on the technical side.Education background in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Astronomy,Computer Science, etc.Strong communication and commercial skills, you are client facing after all.Go getter, pragmatic, analytical and positive.So, are you pragmatic and analytically strong? Do you like client facing work, creating out of the box data models for clients? Do you like to do something extra in your work on a variety of topics (leadership, PM, growth, etc.)? Please apply!Location: Amsterdam, client side and remote (hybrid, unpredictable)Salary: up to 120kRelocation: possible

title: Data Scientist (L5) - Promotional Media - EMEA
description: Our mission at Netflix is to connect global stories with global audiences. When a Netflix member opens our app, we have a few precious moments to help them choose a story that is right for them at that instance. Presenting them evidence – Artwork, Trailers, Synopses – that authentically represents each title and resonates with the member is essential to this effort.Getting this evidence just right for each title is a tall order but our creative strategists, art designers, and video editors are masters of this. Perhaps a more unique aspect of Netflix is that these teams leverage data to inform their decision-making. This is made possible because Netflix UI is a thriving learning machine, personalized via reinforcement learning.Europe is a significant center for our broader Studio and Creative Production teams. We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist based in our Amsterdam office to join our growing European team. In this role, you would serve as a trusted partner for regional Creative Production leadership. Given this data & insights-rich landscape, we are looking for a highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to partner with teams and product managers. This is an opportunity for you to have direct influence on strategic decisions through technical and thought partnership that will ultimately shape promotional content.As a Senior Data Scientist in this space, you will…As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be partnering with a diverse range of cross-functional partners to uncover new opportunities, design, execute, and analyze experiments, and deliver solutions that have a significant impact and implications for our usersYou will help drive innovations through effective identification and application of analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learningThis is a high-impact role in which you will have a direct influence on how product decisions are madeEffectively identify and apply analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learning techniques for given problemsLead the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments Proactively perform data exploration on engagement behaviors to discover future opportunitiesIdentify, compute and validate the appropriate metrics to measure success in a product areaCultivate strong partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders from product, engineering, operations, design, consumer research, etcYou are…Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field5+ years relevant experience with large scale dataStrong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation or other product analytics settingsStrong product knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in consumer/ or user interface settings or internally serving technical audiences such as engineersDemonstrated ability to communicate and drive product changeStrong SQL skillsStrong Quantitative Programming skills in Python or RAbility to work independently and drive your own projectsAbility to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at many different levelsPlus: Experience in building real-world machine learning models with demonstrated impactPlus: Experience creating data products and dashboards such as TableauPlus: Experience in building causal inference solutionsPlus: Familiarity with software engineering practice and working with APIsNetflix culture resonates with youCultureYou will have the opportunity to impact in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence decision-making in a fast paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about the Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture.We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that an inclusive work environment builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Scientist
description: Ben jij een ervaren Data Scientist die gedreven is om waardevolle inzichten te kunnen creëren uit complexe datasets? Wil je deel uitmaken van een leuk team met getalenteerde en gepassioneerde experts, werken aan uitdagende projecten waarbij geavanceerde analysetechnieken worden toegepast om oplossingen te vinden voor complexe vraagstukken?Dan zoeken wij jou:Wat ga je doen:Verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote en complexe datasets met behulp van geavanceerde statistische en machine learning technieken.Identificeren van patronen, trends en relaties in de data om waardevolle inzichten en voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen.Werken aan uiteenlopende projecten, variërend van het optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen tot het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor het voorspellen van klantgedrag.Vertalen van zakelijke vraagstukken naar data-analysevereisten en het leveren van innovatieve oplossingen.Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams, waaronder data engineers, softwareontwikkelaars en business analisten, om data science-oplossingen te ontwikkelen en implementeren.Communiceren van complexe analyseresultaten en technische concepten naar niet-technische stakeholders in een begrijpelijke en overtuigende manier.Wat verwachten we:Een afgeronde masteropleiding of PhD in een relevant vakgebied, zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde of Computer Science.Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren van data-analyseprojecten en het toepassen van statistische en machine learning technieken.Uitgebreide kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python, R of SQL, en ervaring met data science-tools en -frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn of Azure stack.Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe vraagstukken te doorgronden en innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen.Ervaring met het werken met grote datasets en kennis van data cleaning, pre-processing en feature engineering.Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk, om technische concepten en analyseresultaten duidelijk over te brengen aan verschillende stakeholders.Teamgeest en het vermogen om effectief samen te werken in multidisciplinaire teams.Wat krijg je:Uitdagende functie binnen een dynamisch en innovatief bedrijf;Marktconform salaris en goede arbeidsvoorwaarden;Goede pensioensregeling;Uitdagende werkomgeving;Gezellig team (samenwerking, kennisdeling en veel team-uitjes);Nieuw kantoor in Den Haag (elke donderdag borrel);Werk hybride, thuis en op kantoor;OV-vrij abonnement of lease auto;Ruimte voor persoonlijke groei (opleidingsbudget + mogelijkheid om certificaten te behalen);29 vakantiedagen.

title: Machine Learning Developer
description: We are looking for Machine Learning DeveloperJob ResponsibilitiesWorking on machine learning projects Analyzing and processing data to create machine learning models Implementing and optimizing machine learning algorithms Testing and evaluating models Collaborating with the programming team and other departments within the company to develop innovative solutions RequirementsMinimum 2 years of experience in the field of machine learning Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques Ability to analyze and process data Familiarity with machine learning tools and technologies Proficient in English communication Education in computer science We OfferB2B contract type Full-time employment Remote and flexible working hours

title: Data Scientist
description: About PacmedAt Pacmed we develop world leading AI-based decision support software for intensive care doctors. It’s a hugely exciting area where we’re breaking boundaries every day. We’re looking for a data scientist who’s excited to work with hospitals on implementing our product. We have currently implemented our software in our first ICUs and have the ambitions to scale across the Netherlands and beyond.What This Role Is All AboutAs Data Scientist in the Implementation & Care team, you work closely with the hospitals to implement our software. The team as a whole is on a mission to reduce the time it takes to implement our product significantly by the end of 2024, and as you are working with our clients directly, your work is an integral part of reaching that goal.Next to Brian (Implementation Manager) and Ewoud (Adoption Specialist), we have another Data Scientist on the team: Mattia, who broadened his skillset to include the engineering capabilities needed for implementations. In this role, we hope you are excited about going through a similar learning curve!One thing you can be sure of, every day you’ll be working with enthusiastic and mission-driven people who are passionate about using technology to revolutionize healthcare!What Would Be Expected Of YouWork with our customers to ensure the timely, within budget and at quality standards integration of Pacmed Critical in the hospital ICT infrastructure. You need to be excited about working with customers directly!Proactively supporting hospital partners throughout the implementation process, and contributing to meeting the overall project planning.Learning how to set up, test, and ensure quality of integrations, including:Setting up the Azure environment for hospitals, safe network connections, real-time data connection, and single sign-on.Embedding and integration of Pacmed Critical in the front-end of the hospitals EPD/PDMS.Critically assess areas of improvement/automatization of the current development process, suggest ways to improve it and coordinate with the other relevant teams in Pacmed for their implementation.Contributing to the training of the machine-learning (ML) models behind Pacmed Critical, their testing and deployment to the hospital IT environment.Responsible for the technical aspects of the customer support provided to hospitals in which Pacmed Critical has already been implemented.The perks of working at PacmedWhy Pacmed is a great place to workWe're a dynamic startup committed to improving healthcare globally.We’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for our team.We’re a talented bunch of people dedicated to helping each other grow.We foster a culture of kindness and respect.We're a team of ambitious and fun-loving people, with regular team eventsThe profile we’re looking forMust-havesThere is no need to apply if you don’t meet these requirements, sorry!Fluency in DutchCommunication, presentation and consultancy skills. This is a client-facing role, so you need to be excited about that!Desire to become proficient in the production deployment of ML models. The candidate is expected to quickly gain expertise in the technologies currently in use at Pacmed, e.g. data warehousing, ML DevOps, containerisation, automatized integration and deployments (CI/CD) and Cloud infrastructures.Experience in data science, data wrangling, machine learning and data visualization. Ability to set up a supervised learning ML model and interpret its results.Should-havesWe hope you bring these things as well, but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes.Previous experience in a client-facing role.Proficiency with Python and common data-science packages (e.g. scikit-learn, pandas, etc.).Experience with IT integrations, networking and deployments.Experience in process optimization.Collaborative & team player.Nice-to-havesThese are things that would make your profile jump out!Previous experience in data engineering (see third bullet point in the “Must-have” section).Previous experience with version control software.Previous experience in software development.Medical knowledge or previous work experience in the medical field.At Pacmed, we think there is strength in diversity. Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Pacmed encourages you to reconsider and apply! Building responsible AI requires diverse perspectives, equitable practices, and integrity every step of the way. This is our commitment.We’re looking forward to meeting you!

title: Data Scientist
description: Hungry for a challenge?That’s good, because at Just Eat Takeaway.com (JET) we have abundant opportunity or as we say, everything is on the table. We are a leading global online food delivery marketplace. Our tech ecosystem connects millions of active customers with hundreds of thousands of connected partners in countries across the globe.Our mission? To empower every food moment around the world, whether it’s through customer service, coding or couriers.All About The RoleAs Data Scientist you will be focussing on delivering new and improving existing machine learning applications for a variety of sales operations at Just Eat Takeaway.com. You will help drive better restaurant recommendations, more accurate delivery estimates, operational improvements, and better experiences for our customers, restaurants and drivers.Our Functional Sales analytics team operates as a center of excellence, and as such you will be collaborating with departments and functions across the whole company. You are an expert in Machine Learning and will share and develop your expertise together with the wider data science community where best practices are adopted. You'll work on projects side by side with Data Scientists from other departments, other times you will collaborate directly with our business stakeholders - depending on what is needed to make a business impact. In this role you will also work with our ML engineering team to shape our Machine Learning platform, which enables us to perform advanced analytics in a streamlined manner across the company.You will be part of the Functional Sales team which is part of the Sales Strategy and Operations organisation, and you will report directly to our Manager of Sales Analytics.In this role, you will also have the opportunity to:Lead and deliver data science projects from start to finish, working closely with stakeholders to ensure a measurable business impactGuide and coach junior team members to help them develop their data science skillsIdentify improvement opportunities across the data science landscape, proactively advising the team on this and taking action as needed to prevent and fix critical problems across our ML solutions with the wider team.Consult with stakeholders on data and technical issues, providing guidance on technical implementation feasibilityDevelop guidelines, best practices and drive adoption throughout the data science communityBe an active participant in the community for all data scientists and data engineersCan you deliver…Here are the skills we need from our Data Scientist:3+ years’ experience working in data scienceProven record of applying statistical and machine learning methods to solve real-world problems in a scalable way, ideally in a production-grade environment. Example methods include forecasting, anomaly detection, classification, personalization, ranking, recommender systems, and dynamic pricingDelivering data-driven insights and outcomes clearly and communicating effectively with people of varying levels of data literacy and technical knowledgeAbility to collaborate with stakeholders across different organizations and geographies to define the work and deliver initiativesConfident in extracting and manipulating data from various SQL and NoSQL data stores (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift, Cassandra) and platforms (Airflow, Spark, Kafka) in a cloud environmentAbility to develop confidently in Python. This doesn't mean hacking in Jupyter, we need people with a passion for software, who can read and understand complicated codebasesExperience working in agile teams with code reviews and source control is preferredAt JET, This Is On The MenuOur teams forge connections internally and work with some of the best-known brands on the planet, giving us truly international impact in a dynamic environment.Fun, fast-paced and supportive, the JET culture is about movement, growth and about celebrating every aspect of our JETers. Thanks to them we stay one step ahead of the competition.Inclusion, Diversity & BelongingNo matter who you are, what you look like, who you love, or where you are from, you can find your place at Just Eat Takeaway.com. We’re committed to creating an inclusive culture, encouraging diversity of people and thinking, in which all employees feel they truly belong and can bring their most colorful selves to work every day.What else is cooking?Want to know more about our JETers, culture or company? Have a look at our career site where you can find people's stories, blogs, podcasts and more JET morsels.Are you ready to take your seat? Apply now!

title: Data Scientist, Den Haag
description: Als Data Scientist kom je te werken bij een overheidsinstantie die verantwoordelijk is voor het beleid en de uitvoering van diverse aspecten van de gezondheidszorg, sociale voorzieningen en sport. Het speelt een cruciale rol in het waarborgen van de gezondheid en het welzijn van de burgers en het bevorderen van een gezonde en actieve levensstijl.Betrouwbare informatievoorziening is essentieel in hun dienstverlening. Daar zet de Programmadirectie nafase COVID-19 zich sterk voor in. De Coronacrisis geeft extra druk en uitdaging op het organiseren van de informatievoorziening voor onder andere Woo-vragen en informatieverzoeken ten behoeve van onderzoek en verantwoording. Met behulp van data science en automatiseringstechnieken optimaliseren ze de keten van openbaarmaking van COVID-19 gerelateerde documenteren.Ter ondersteuning van team Data Science & Automatisering zijn ze op zoek naar een Data Scientist met aantoonbare ervaring met Python en machine learning of kunstmatige intelligentie. Als Data Scientist werk je in een gedreven en gezellig team van drie mede Data Scientist. Gezamenlijk ondersteun je teams binnen en buiten NC-19 door te helpen met optimaliseren en automatiseren van diverse processen binnen de openbaarmaking van COVID-19- gerelateerde documenten. Je gaat met name werken met Azure en Databricks. Inzichten worden bijvoorbeeld via Databricks of via geautomatiseerde Power BI dashboards zo helder mogelijk weergegeven en gedeeld binnen en buiten NC-19.StandplaatsDen Haag, op kantoor en gedeeltelijk hybride vanuit huis.SalarisSalarisindicatie van €3.000,- tot €4.500,- bruto per maand.
